story:
A New Full-Length Album!

Hello, dahlings!

I'm Normandie Wilson... I'm a singer, pianist, & fashion plate from San Diego, California. My output is varied; over the past 8 years I've shared over a dozen independent releases of original material with the world... ranging from lo-fi indie-pop to instrumental piano... to more traditional vocal jazz & lounge stylings. 

My newest full-length album is called "Normandie Wilson Is Tired of Being Nice" and it's an exploration into new territory for me. (There's guitar on it) In all seriousness, this is a very new place for me to be... it's about concepts of anger, revenge, heartbreak, and what it means to name pain, to talk about our hurt. The record was produced in conjunction with the incredible David Fleminger and features many awesome San Diego musicians, along with contributions from Adam Marsland of Karma Frog Studios in LA. I am very proud of this piece of work, and the discussions that I hope to have with you regarding the creation of this album, along with honest and vulnerable communication around our valid feelings when we are wronged, hurt, or abused.

Where the Money Goes

I have an extensive back catalog of releases, many of which have never seen a proper pressing, or even a proper roll-out. Thanks to the generous support of my friends & fans, I was able to press a 7" record in 2010 and do pre-orders to support my last full-length release. Because of my last professionally pressed album, I was able to secure many gigs in San Diego & beyond, which have paid for themselves costs several times over. 

The first goal is to fund CD pressing of my newest album, "Normandie Wilson Is Tired of Being Nice." After that, I will work backwards in the catalog and press small quantities (100-500) of each release. A question I've heard a lot; "Do artists even sell CDs anymore? Aren't they obsolete?" For some artists, CDs are not a reliable tool, but they matter to me. At performances, CDs are still the number one way I earn extra money and connect with fans. (It's also worth mentioning that vinyl is super cool, but most vinyl releases need about 4-6 months for pressing, and I want to make sure anyone who wants a physical copy of the album can have one ASAP!) 

Any funds raised over the goal will be used to make music videos for the latest record. My community has been so good to me, and I am so grateful for all the constant support you've given me through the years. Every contribution is so valuable to me, as I have no label support.

Honest Discussions About Our Emotions

It's my hope that the record facilitates discussion around valid emotional responses to pain, abuse, and trauma that we experience as a part of being alive, being human. I want to talk about anger. I want to talk about how we heal from these experiences. I am tired of "being nice," I'm tired of stuffing down my emotions and my pain because it upsets other people. This is the most honest record I have ever made, and I want to share honestly with you, and listen to your stories also.

Other Ways You Can Help

Sharing this means so much to me! If you aren't able to order anything at this time, but you really want to help, just share the link. Thank you for your support & love!

story:
My name is Kenny and punk rock changed my life.                                

My mom bought me an acoustic guitar and 10 guitar lessons for my 14th birthday. When I discovered punk rock a year later, I wrote my first song "Friday Night At CBGBs". It wasn't very good, but I kept going, knowing there were others out there like me that weren't held back by their limitations. A year later I was in my first band and I was lucky enough to eventually make a few records and do shows in the USA and Europe. I played with some great musicians and became friends with some wonderful, supportive people. I wouldn't have gotten very far without having them in my life. 

         I slowed down my musical activity after my last solo record "Sin Cigarros" was released on TAANG! In 1996. After 18 years away, I recorded a 9 song ep  "Like The Kings We Were Meant To Be" with the Gloucester band, Electric Ears. They helped me discover a renewed enthusiasm for playing music and brought new life to songs that have been kicking around unreleased for the last decade or more. I have 30 to 40 more unreleased songs and I want to record them.




  • I came to the figure of 3000.00 after evaluating the gear I felt was needed to make a warm sounding finished product. I lack most of the equipment you might find in a home studio. I use a ZOOM 16 track digital recorder, no name microphones (except 1 Shure mic from the 80s), a bass I bought for $50, cheap cymbals and I tape a couple of mics to guitar stands in place of real mic stands. I'm the Fred Sanford of home recording. I went online to Musician's Friend to see what it might cost to bring things up a few notches. Everything is budget-line (but reasonable quality) gear.

Zildjian ZHT high hat cymbals -                                170.00

Zildjian Ride and crash cymbals -                            330.00

Drum Workshop kick pedal -                                     130.00

(4) drum heads-                                                               75.00

Drum sticks 3 pack-                                                        25.00

Shure DMK 57-52 drum mic kit (4 mics)-             400.00

1 Rode NT1 condenser mic-                                        270.00

4 mic stands-                                                                     80.00

2 boom arms (for angled mic placement)-             30.00

Behringer FBQ1502 stereo equalizer-                     100.00

ART TP S2 tube pre-amp-                                           200.00

Squier Jazz bass-                                                           300.00

Mastering at New Alliance (estimate)-                    850.00

Total-                                                                              $2960.00

This total doesn't reflect the 4% to 9% fee deducted by Indiegogo, or any third party international wire fees (around 3%). I plan on being responsible for some of the cost associated with this. 

I could never bring myself to start a crowdfunding project. I was painfully aware that it seemed like I would be asking for a handout. The folks who have supported me in the past owe me nothing.

Only you can decide if the world needs any more Kenny Chambers songs in it.

I have some perks for anyone who donates to this. If you can't afford to contribute, get in touch with me and I will give you something regardless.

There's an extra perk that will be included with the $50, $100 and $200 donation. I'm going to think of something and  let people know about it before the campaign is over. It will probably be something like a download of acoustic versions of some old Moving Targets songs.  I'd love to hear any suggestions you might have.

I posted a few videos in the gallery. The songs I want to record spread across a number of genres. Punk Rock, Indie Rock, Rock, and 2 or 3 Instrumentals. I have over 100 songs kicking around. I would say about a third of them should see the light of day.

If you want to hear my most recent contribution to music, please check out the e.p. I did with Kenny Chambers/Electric Ears "Like The Kings We Were Meant To Be"

http://kennychamberselectricears.bandcamp.com/r...

Although I will play much of the music myself, I want to ask some friends to be involved as well. I want these songs to be the best they can be.



    Risks & Challenges

    If this thing succeeds in the 60 days it's going, I intend to use the funds to purchase the items I've listed and start the project as soon as my night classes end (around the end of May). It's reasonable to believe I could be finished sometime in September when I go back to school. I think the minimum amount of songs should be 30. There's always a chance it could run overtime but I will try my best, as long as the songs don't suffer. I promise you will ultimately receive what you are promised.


    • If anyone has any suggestions how to make this succeed, I would love to hear from you.
    • I would also also be happy to hear about others experience and thanks to those who have already reached out!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

    • Share this link. Use your knowledge of social media to spread the campaign. Feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools!

    And that's all there is to it.

story:
The Project:

Hi!  My name is Evelyn Horan and I'm a singer/songwriter.  I've been hired to create the soundtrack and be the voice of the main character, Sophia, in an independent film called Pentimento written and directed by Loredana Gasparotto.  I'm so excited about this project because it's a whole new world of songwriting for me and I get to work with amazing, creative people throughout the process. As a contributor, your support will help make the soundtrack and EP for this amazing film possible!  The whole film is about Sophia's musical journey through love and life.  Without your help Sophia will remain silent.  

Where your money will go:

In order to create this inspirational soundtrack and EP I will need $1500 to help cover the costs of production, studio time, musicians (my lovely band mates and engineers), mixing and mastering, artwork, physical CDs, promotion and distribution.

I'm so excited about this project because it allows me to create music through a character that opens up another dimension of my creativity, so you'll get to hear (and see!) a different side to my music! 

If I don't reach my entire goal, the funds will first go to pay those working with me as musicians and engineers (which will be a total of about $800) and then to studio time ($225) and then I would probably end up paying for artwork, physical CDs and promotion and distribution myself.


Why should you help?

This project means so much to me because it is the first time I've been hired to create a soundtrack and be the voice of a character in a movie!  How cool is that?  I've put so much time, thought and love into each of the songs I've written for Pentimento and I can't wait for you all to hear them.  Writing songs for and about others is always more cathartic to me because it allows empathy to flow from me freely through music. 

Even just $1 helps go towards the awesome musicians and creative people I get to work with on this project and will allow this beautiful story to come to life on screen.  The whole movie is about the main character's life journey through music!  It is my honor and duty to create a soundtrack that will accompany her journey.


Challenges:

Since I've never created a soundtrack for a full movie before, there are many challenges I will be facing with this project that will probably result in more time and money spent perfecting it.  I will need to work with my team to create perfect in and out fading of songs to the scenes; each song will need to be personalized to every second of every scene and be shortened for each scene; I have to step out of my comfort zone and sing a song from a musical, which will take tons of practice; the main character is Romanian, so I'm trying my hardest to create a song that sounds Romanian and even has some parts sung in Romanian!  Even though these challenges are daunting, I can't wait to overcome them with practice, hard work, and creativity and I can't wait for you to hear the finished product.


You can help!

Even if donation is impossible for you at this moment, you can help just by sharing this project with others.  This film and project is so inspirational to me and I hope to see it soar and inspire others as well.  


P.S.- you can also check out the film and learn how you can help them as well at https://pentimentofilm.squarespace.com/pentimento

story:
I recently auditioned for a spot as a Live Audition Finalist for a Team Backpack Cypher in Hollywood and WON! If you aren't familiar with Team Backpack they have over 17 million views on Youtube and have gotten international recognization from some of the biggest brands in hip-hop such as MTV's Rapfix, Vibe Magazine, XXL Magazine, The Source Magazine, Atlantic Records, Def Jam Records, Interscope Records, Rock the Bells, and, well, you get the point... Anyways, their sole goal is to get talented musicians exposure and now I have the chance to get that exposure in the Entertainment Capital of The World. This is my lifelong dream and I need your help to make it possible! Your donations will be going towards the $400 plane ticket to Los Angeles and $100 for the hostel that I will be staying at during the 3-day event. Your support means the world to me.

Thank you, Tieran

story:
Short Summary

Hi.  have you ever had a dream but it was always a little out of reach.  Well we have one and now you can help us reach our dream a little faster by pledging to our campaign.  

We are a five piece band from western Prince Edward Island.  We had some songs put together and we laid them down live.  When we got them back we posted them up on our social network page and they took off.  So now we are on a mission to put an album together and that's why we turned to Indiegogo for help.

What We Need & What You Get

We need about $3000 for our project.  A big goal but not an unreachable goal.  That will pay for producing, mixing and printing our cd's.  We are not leaving all the work up to you the pledgers of course, any gigs we play will go directly to our album as well.  

We will be giving out some t-shirts and personal thank yous to our pledgers and some other options as well like local gigs, advanced copies, and more.  We will also send out videos to our pledgers and updates as well.

If we do not reach our goal, the cash will still go toward the album, we will just have to work harder and push the album back a little but we will still be going ahead with it as planned.

The Impact

As stated before we are a five piece band.  One of us is a fisherman (Kevin), one is a mechanic (Danny), two carpenters (Jason and Jp) and one long haul trucker (Shawn).  We are simple guys working hard on all original tunes.  Kevin came up with some tunes and so did Danny and Jp.  We all work full time and we take time away from our families late at night to run through theses tunes and arrangements and they are actually sounding really great!  Our families are supporting us and we REALLY REALLY hope that you will too.

Risks & Challenges

We really hope that we have reached you and that you do help us out.  We all have been playing music for a long time.  Danny has been playing the bar scene for 17 years and Shawn almost the same amount.  Jp and Jason and Kevin have been playing music and singing for about 15 years themselves.  It's been a long road and now we all think that we deserve this little shot at making an album.  We all have busy schedules but we all have made the sacrifices to make it work.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help.  If you like our story and the funds aren't available, please share it to all your friends and family, they might be ably to help us out and if not them, they might know someone else.  Don't forget to share it on Facebook and Twitter and everywhere else.  

Thanks for reading and pledging!

story:
Ryan Bradley's bluesy delivery, yet traditional approach to his brand of country music is turning heads in Canadian country music. With a unique vocal style and writing approach, Ryan recently placed in the Top 25 of the Music City Songwriting Competition with his self-penned song, “Rural Route 4”. In early 2014, he signed a distribution deal with Southbound Records and eOne Music Canada; his first two singles “Next Weekend” and "Wish You Could've Seen Your Face" received fantastic reviews with radio programmers across Canada. Ryan also placed in the Top 16 for the 2014 CCMA Discovery Program and he is currently working towards finishing his debut album with producer Danick Dupelle (Emerson Drive). 

Being on an independent record label and being relatively new to the music scene, government and other funding are very limited. Despite being well received and welcomed into the industry, funds can be very tight and we would love to see some help from you, the fans. Without you, our careers wouldn't be possible. 

We have some fantastic songs picked out to record for upcoming single releases and we won't be able to finish this EP without your help!

We are hoping to raise $10,000 by June 1, allowing us to get a new single out this fall and get an EP in your hands and in your iTunes libraries! Your funds would be used to help us record three new songs and help market Ryan's career over the next year.

With the help of the IndieGogo platform, we have created some fun packages that we hope you take an interest in, as we would love for you to be a part of this next phase of Ryan's career! The impact of your help will not go unnoticed and Ryan appreciates every dollar you are able to contribute. 

Please feel free to share this campaign on your social networks and let us know if you have any questions!

Team RB

www.ryanbradleymusic.com

*Own a business?  We can use your logo on the album artwork and Ryan's website if you contribute $500 or higher
story_txt:
Ryan Bradley's bluesy delivery, yet traditional
approach to his brand of country music is turning heads in Canadian country music. With a
unique vocal style and writing approach, Ryan recently placed in the Top 25 of
the Music City Songwriting Competition with his self-penned song, “Rural Route
4”. In early 2014, he signed a distribution deal with Southbound Records and eOne Music Canada; his
first two singles “Next Weekend” and "Wish You Could've Seen Your Face" received fantastic reviews with radio programmers across Canada. Ryan also placed in the
Top 16 for the 2014 CCMA Discovery Program and he is currently working towards finishing his debut album with producer Danick Dupelle (Emerson Drive). 
Being on an independent record label and being relatively new to the music scene, government and other funding are very limited. Despite being well received and welcomed into the industry, funds can be very tight and we would love to see some help from you, the fans. Without you, our careers wouldn't be possible. 
We have some fantastic songs picked out to record for upcoming single releases and we won't be able to finish this EP without your help!
We are hoping to raise $10,000 by June 1, allowing us to get a new single out this fall and get an EP in your hands and in your iTunes libraries! Your funds would be used to help us record three new songs and help market Ryan's career over the next year.
With the help of the IndieGogo platform, we have created some fun packages that we hope you take an interest in, as we would love for you to be a part of this next phase of Ryan's career! The impact of your help will not go unnoticed and Ryan appreciates every dollar you are able to contribute. 
Please feel free to share this campaign on your social networks and let us know if you have any questions!
Team RB
www.ryanbradleymusic.com
*Own a business?  We can use your logo on the album artwork and Ryan's website if you contribute $500 or higher

story:
The A'tudes & Brews Story

Hello! My name is Carrie and I am a professional musician and the founder of this digital storytelling blog, A'tudes & Brews. Back in the summer of August 2014, I was a music student starting the final year of my Masters degree and preparing to enter into the real world. While drinking my coffee one morning at school, I caught myself spiraling downwards into a very negative and depressed mentality. It wasn't an entirely new feeling, but I began to seriously question whether or not I had what it took, if I was good enough, if I had worked hard enough, and worst of all, I became obsessed over the question of whether or not I would ever be considered 'successful'.

In an attempt to alleviate my own stress, I talked to close friends and relatives of mine and found that I was not as alone as I had imagined; more importantly, I discovered that these doubts were not unique to just musicians. These doubts are unique to being human, a side of ourselves we don't always pay attention to. Ultimately I realized I was confusing my value as a human being with achievements I may or may not have as a musician, and in this confusion was how I found myself shrouded in debilitating negativity, allowing it to consume me, dictate my life and how I expressed myself as an individual. As I talked to more and more people, I realized how deeply we collectively as a society are plagued by this epidemic, and I became inspired to promote social change. Thus, A'tudes & Brews was born. 

In music, an étude in its literal definition is “a composition designed to improve the technique of an instrumental performer by isolating specific difficulties” (The New Harvard Dictionary of Music). I of course don't disdain that études and other exercises like études are important to our professions, but overcoming other "specific difficulties" we endure, like debilitating negativity, certainly does not come from études. That is why I propose another adaptation of the word. A'tudes, unlike études, aim to improve upon our ability to adopt positive 'attitudes' towards life, and shift our collective conscious away from feeling that we go through it alone. In this project, I encourage musicians and non-musicians alike to practice being honest and open with their stories over a nice 'brew' of their choice that I will provide.

How you can help!

A'tudes & Brews has many goals for itself, but in order to achieve them we really need your help! Currently this project is being entirely funded out-of-pocket, and unfortunately that means the goals we can realistically achieve at this time are severely limited. However, we're not going to let that stop us and our passion to connect people all over the world through music, and we hope you can help us with that. If you choose to donate, here is what you can expect your money to be spent on: 

Annual Operating Costs for A'tudes & Brews: 

The Brew Tour--$1,900

  • As to not limit A'tudes & Brews to just one community, this project hopes to conduct it's first 'Brew Tour' and interview people in other areas that will be determined at a later date (depending on price and audience interest in participating in interviews). This budget would cover the cost of travel expenses, as well as interview expenses incurred during The Brew Tour.

Promotional Budget--$950

  • Purchase of coffee mugs with A'tudes & Brews logo ($700 for printing & shipping costs for 75 mugs)

  • New Logo Design ($250)

50 Interviews--$1,500

  • $30/interview ($10 for 'brew' costs; reimbursement for travel costs to both interviewee and interviewer)
Website Maintenance Fee--$100
Transcription Help--$1,000
  •  The average length of an interview ranges from 1-2 hours. Since there is no software that exists to automatically transcribe interviews, each interview requires between 3-6 hours of transcription work (15 min=45 min of transcription time). Because of the deadline we want to adhere to with 50 interviews per year, spending this much time cannot always be justified to transcribe every interview from start to finish for just one person. This budget would allow for the project to occasionally hire some help with this process.
  • $20/hour for 2 hours work maximum=$40/interview
  • $40x25 interviews (every other interview)
Commission costs for using Indigogo--$350

Total Budget Costs: $5,800


Testimonies

"I think A'tudes & Brews is a great way to promote a sense of unity and care among musicians. By reading the interviews, we learn that behind every face we see at a gig is a story, often one suprisingly similar to our own. In an over-saturated market such as Los Angeles, a project like this is sorely needed. Often, even the most skilled musicians can feel like they're drowning in a sea of talent, and that their voice or craft is disposable. I feel that A'tudes & Brews seeks to remedy that unavoidable feeling of alienation. The questions asked in the interview are great at pulling out deeper thoughts and more personal stories than one might not hear otherwise. I enjoyed my experience being interviewed and was honored to have been given the opportunity. Carrie is a great interviewer because she asks the right questions and listens carefully to the responses. Nothing about the process felt artificial, controlled, or forced like many interivews can. Carrie has done a great job making her subjects feel at ease and safe--creating an essential trust with the interviewee that allows them to answer more candidly. The end result is that every interview reminds the reader that artistic pursuits are born out of common human needs and natures, and every persona has a unique perspective, or starting point on the journey, even if their final destination is the same; the enigmatic landmark we call 'succes'"------Michael Rushman

"I participated in Carrie's A'tudes & Brews project in 2015 and had a wonderful time sharing my thoughts and perspective. I think it is important for musicians and arts managers to share their background, experiences, lessons learned, and pro-tips for future success to others, because we can learn so much from each other. We can learn that the struggles and challenges often that we we are experiencing in our own journeys many not be as foreign as we think, and we also learn new viewpoints that perhaps we had never considered prior. I strongly believe that projects like Carrie's can act as cultural social agents in our modern society, in the arts community and beyond. When people share their individual beliefs and values, and others connect or resonate with those viewpoints it can strengthen confidence in their own trajectory, as well as learning how many lives are intertwined. In short, when you have a passion that you want to pursue and you hear others tell their stories of pursuing their careers, it helps make those pursuits more tangible and in turn strengthens confidence to take strides forward. We need more of this kind of encouragement in our world; it can bring passion to fruition"-----Kristen Klehr

"Having the opportunity to participate in an interview for A'tudes & Brews was a tremendously worthwhile experience. It was so wonderful to have the chance to talk about struggles and soruces of inspiration in my musical career with my great friend Carrie, along with my other good friend and co-interviewee, Erin Young. It is equally inspiring to read the other interviews to gain new perspectives, and I have been pleased to find that while all of us come from different backgrounds, in many cases we have shared experiences. In all cases, our passion for music is apparent through Carrie's excellent ability to create a relaxed interview environment, where interviewees feel comfortable to share their thoughts and stories openly. This platform could be tremendously valuable for musicians on a much larger scale, nationally and globally, if give the opportunity to expand. The diversity and openess of this project is a welcome breath of fresh air in the sometimes stuffy world of classical music, and it is sorely needed."-----Rachel Van Amburgh

Summary

First and foremost, we have to remember that we are people, and it is just as important to spend time cultivating and developing ourselves as human beings as we do musicians, engineers, teachers, etc. Even in our vast differences, sharing our experiences and what we're passionate about and value as individuals will strengthen and connect us together as a society, because as Howard Schultz put it so eloquently, "when you're surrounded by people who share a passionate commitment around a common purpose, anything is possible." Instead of continuing to allow negativity to control us, let's allow music and enjoying good conversation with one another be the common purpose everyone can practice and positively benefit from.

story:
Short Summary

Hello to all. One day I jumped out of my bed thinking: "what if I create a project where all would feel engaged in their most high ideals?". And so I started, I designed a music project that could contain great expectations of the future of mankind. And what better than an extraterrestrial influence? A more civilized race that can give us the tecnology and ideals we need to enhance our lifes. But let me introduce myself:

  • I'm a 30 year old man, I am an actor and a model and I have also done dubbing for Disney. My life goes well, and now I am even writting a book (for wich I'm also asking for a crowdfunding). I don't have a girlfriend but I'm passionate for a girl for a long time from now.
  • My campaign starts on the need to be active on certain concepts to the world (and I want it to be worldwide) and change minds that are lost and without belief in their trajectories. It's a matter of love and purpose that I want to share with the world. This is important to me for it is my beliefs that are at stake.
  • The help of you people out there will be magnanimous for it will be my concepts made come true for the world (and God, what I love you to listen to my songs right now...)Specially I believe my project is a contribution for the development of Mankind in General

What We Need & What You Get

So now let me break it down for you folks, in more detail:

  • I will need about 35.000€ to 40.000€! 15.000€ for the production of the album, 15.000€ for the marketing, image and communications; and 5.000-10.000€ for publicity and unpredicted expenses. Any more details I can give you in the future...
  • If you donate to my project I guarantee you special places in concerts, t-shirts autographed and CD's autographed. Want more? tell me about it!
  • Now, if I don't reach my entire goal the funds will go for the editing of my books that are also waiting for approval of crowdfunding. These books are about poetry on nature, love issues and spirituality; my lifestyle, political and filosophycal ideas. And, of course, I'll save the money to keep focused on my album!

The Impact

Please Go to myspace and look for Helio Lopes Pestana, there is my music. You will get a closer look. The difference your contribution will make is the following:

  • With my project you will feel the difference in your heart and in your mind on what is still needed on Earth to be developed. You will flow through the rivers of paradise of sound and the world will follow you.
  • The last thing I want you to think is that this is all fake. Trust me, it is possible to change the world into a more developed place.

Risks & Challenges

Now I may face risks and obstacles. Not all is possible and to change minds is a long and pacient process. The sugestion of ideas through music is but a start, then people need to cultivate them in their own lives. If they don't, then music is a looser process. I think I can win in this battle:

  • My lyrics are soft and are about my life experience to let the listener know more calmly on what is more urgent to be treated in the heart of humanity.
  • My sounds will be of future like. So I expect it to seduce the market.

Other Ways You Can Help

Wait, I do understand if yu cannot contribute with money to my project but there is still something you can do:

  • get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it!

story:
OUR STORY:

Ours truly is a “Long Story”…here’s the short version: Met in high school; started playing music together; dated for 10 years; broke up; stayed best of friends; kept playing music (think Jerry & Elaine from Seinfeld – minus the music - and you get the idea). Read the full story at the bottom...


Long Story - 2016        
                                                            

Along the way, life definitely threw us some curves, but we’ve always had each other’s back through it all.  The most challenging chapter began about two years ago, when Faith was diagnosed with MS (Multiple Sclerosis).  Within a matter of only a few months, Faith went from fully functioning to not being able to walk, or even dress and feed herself.



2014...a tough year! Clockwise from left: Faith's mom feeding her while drying her hair; hour 2 of 4-hour blood transfusion; taking new wheelchair for a spin for the first time (and still keeping a great attitude about it...)


After two failed treatments, Faith is finally on a medication which has slowed the progression of her disease, but it's a "limited time offer"...this treatment is only good for 2 short years, at which point the medication can cause an infection in her brain that is life-threatening.  After that, it'll be back to looking at different treatment options, none of which hold the promise of being anywhere near as effective...

We're making the time count by putting everything into our shared passion: MUSIC!

OUR GOAL:

After years of writing music - much of it inspired by the ups and downs of living with Faith's condition - we have a dozen songs waiting to be shared with the world.  We already have serious interest in one of our songs ("Lift Me Up") from a top Nashville producer & filmmaker for inclusion on an upcoming movie soundtrack; we want to build on this opportunity and use it as a stepping stone to present our other songs to labels in Nashville and throughout North America.

To do this, we need to record polished studio-quality versions of each of our songs...and we need your help to do it!  We're looking to raise a minimum of $7,500, which will allow us to:

Record: $4,000
  • 10 - 12 original songs in a quality studio setting
  • Hire musicians (where required) to contribute to recordings
  • Rent equipment/instruments
Copyright (and other legalities):  $1,000
  • Registering copyrights for each song, both in Canada and the US
  • Registering band as a legal entity in both Canada and the US
Produce:  $1,000
  • 100 CDs to distribute to labels & producers
  • Press /Marketing kits (including professional pics, bio, business cards, etc) to hand out along with CDs at events & meetings
Travel:  $1,000
  • The best way to pitch to Nashville is to be in Nashville!
  • One week in September/October to meet with producers & execs (meetings will be set up by the amazing agent & lawyer with whom we are already working down there)
  • Follow up trips as required
Miscellaneous:  $500
  • All of the research we've done - and feedback we've received from people who have run crowdfunding campaigns for similar projects - tells us that we need to allow for about 10-15% unexpected expenses...we're going with slightly less than that, but figure that will cover any unforeseeables.

TOTAL: $7,500


Recording "Lift Me Up" w. Reid Ploss at Avondale United Church  - 2016. (churches have the BEST sound!!)


Your support is vital to allowing us to pursue this very real opportunity, and to make our life-long dream a reality...while we still can.  Check out the various donation levels - and the cool perks that go with each - and choose the one that suits you best...and remember, every little bit counts!  

THANK YOU IN ADVANCE FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!


The (really) LONG STORY:

For many people with Relapsing/Remitting (RR) MS, it is a relatively mild condition, which progresses slowly, and becomes debilitating only after many years/decades.  This wasn’t the case for Faith, though…she won the worst lottery ever by being hit by a very aggressive form of MS.  Within just a few months of her diagnosis, she was first unable to walk on her own, then unable to stand on her own, and finally unable to even get out of bed or feed herself.

James was there for Faith through it all…as were some of the most amazing friends, family, and fans that anyone could ask for!  People across North America gave their time, encouragement, and even their money to get Faith the care and medication that she needed.  It has taken several years, but thanks to the hard work of so many great people – and some amazing doctors and nurses -  Faith is finally on a treatment which has brought her “back to life”…at least for now.

Faith’s treatment is temporary: she was told right off the bat that she will only be on it for 2 years before the medication can cause an infection in her brain (called PML) that is life-threatening.  At the 2 year mark, new treatment options will have to be investigated…most of which do not hold the promise of being as effective. Having started her current treatment 6 months ago, that leaves only about 18 months of relative “normalcy” for Faith…and we intend to make that time count by pursuing the one thing which has given our lives meaning: MUSIC.

Music has sustained us through all of the ups-and-downs, both listening to it or performing it live (something which we had to stop doing altogether for nearly a year, but are SO HAPPY to finally be able to do again!!).  Most cathartic has been the music which we started writing ourselves, both before Faith’s diagnosis but especially throughout her/our ordeal.  Our experiences – both shared and independent – have culminated in a slew of original songs which run the gamut from angry to inspirational to just plain fun!  And we’re determined to share these songs with the world, and those who have gone (or are going through) similar struggles in hopes that they draw strength from them.

First, let us clarify what we DON’T want to do: we do not want to be “rockstars”…we don’t want to record a demo in order to land a recording contract, and we don’t want to tour & play shows 250 days of the year to promote an album we’ve released.  Even in relatively good health, this is not something which Faith can manage, as the cumulative effects of her MS have already drained her energy…while we will continue to perform live on occasion, the gruelling grind of a touring musician is not a possibility for us.

What we DO want is to write songs for artists who are already doing all of that…simply put, we want to be SONGWRITERS (with an eye to landing a publishing contract in Nashville).  In addition to our passion for creating music, songwriting is something which Faith can continue to do even as her condition progresses.

We’re already well on our way to that goal…we have a dozen strong original songs “ready to go”, we have an amazing agent and lawyer representing us in the US, and we have strong connections – and real opportunities – in the key market of Nashville, TN.  What we don’t have – and need – is a polished studio recording of each of our songs, along with professional marketing materials to promote ourselves. This is where you come in!
story_txt:
OUR STORY:Ours truly is a “Long Story”…here’s the short version: Met in
high school; started playing music together; dated for 10 years; broke up;
stayed best of friends; kept playing music (think Jerry & Elaine from
Seinfeld – minus the music - and you get the idea). Read the full story at the bottom...Long Story - 2016                                                                     Along the way, life definitely threw us some curves, but we’ve
always had each other’s back through it all. 
The most challenging chapter began about two years ago, when Faith was
diagnosed with MS (Multiple Sclerosis).  Within a matter of only a few months, Faith went from fully functioning to not being able to walk, or even dress and feed herself.2014...a tough year! Clockwise from left: Faith's mom feeding her while drying her hair; hour 2 of 4-hour blood transfusion; taking new wheelchair for a spin for the first time (and still keeping a great attitude about it...)After two failed treatments, Faith is finally on a medication which has slowed the progression of her disease, but it's a "limited time offer"...this treatment is only good for 2 short years, at which point the medication can cause an infection in her brain that is life-threatening.  After that, it'll be back to looking at different treatment options, none of which hold the promise of being anywhere near as effective...We're making the time count by putting everything into our shared passion: MUSIC!OUR GOAL:After years of writing music - much of it inspired by the ups and downs of living with Faith's condition - we have a dozen songs waiting to be shared with the world.  We already have serious interest in one of our songs ("Lift Me Up") from a top Nashville producer & filmmaker for inclusion on an upcoming movie soundtrack; we want to build on this opportunity and use it as a stepping stone to present our other songs to labels in Nashville and throughout North America.To do this, we need to record polished studio-quality versions of each of our songs...and we need your help to do it!  We're looking to raise a minimum of $7,500, which will allow us to:Record: $4,000

10 - 12 original songs in a quality studio setting

Hire musicians (where required) to contribute to recordings
Rent equipment/instruments

Copyright (and other legalities):  $1,000
Registering copyrights for each song, both in Canada and the US
Registering band as a legal entity in both Canada and the US


Produce:  $1,000
100 CDs to distribute to labels & producers
Press /Marketing kits (including professional pics, bio, business cards, etc) to hand out along with CDs at events & meetings


Travel:  $1,000
The best way to pitch to Nashville is to be in Nashville!
One week in September/October to meet with producers & execs (meetings will be set up by the amazing agent & lawyer with whom we are already working down there)
Follow up trips as required


Miscellaneous:  $500All of the research we've done - and feedback we've received from people who have run crowdfunding campaigns for similar projects - tells us that we need to allow for about 10-15% unexpected expenses...we're going with slightly less than that, but figure that will cover any unforeseeables.


TOTAL: $7,500Recording "Lift Me Up" w. Reid Ploss at Avondale United Church  - 2016. (churches have the BEST sound!!)Your support is vital to allowing us to pursue this very real opportunity, and to make our life-long dream a reality...while we still can.  Check out the various donation levels - and the cool perks that go with each - and choose the one that suits you best...and remember, every little bit counts!  THANK YOU IN ADVANCE FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!The (really) LONG STORY:
For many people with Relapsing/Remitting (RR) MS, it is a
relatively mild condition, which progresses slowly, and becomes debilitating
only after many years/decades.  This
wasn’t the case for Faith, though…she won the worst lottery ever by being hit
by a very aggressive form of MS.  Within
just a few months of her diagnosis, she was first unable to walk on her own,
then unable to stand on her own, and finally unable to even get out of bed or
feed herself.
James was there for Faith through it all…as were some of the
most amazing friends, family, and fans that anyone could ask for!  People across North America gave their time,
encouragement, and even their money to get Faith the care and medication that
she needed.  It has taken several years,
but thanks to the hard work of so many great people – and some amazing doctors
and nurses -  Faith is finally on a
treatment which has brought her “back to life”…at least for now.
Faith’s treatment is temporary: she was told right off the
bat that she will only be on it for 2 years before the medication can cause an
infection in her brain (called PML) that is life-threatening.  At the 2 year mark, new treatment options
will have to be investigated…most of which do not hold the promise of being as
effective. Having started her current treatment 6 months ago, that leaves only
about 18 months of relative “normalcy” for Faith…and we intend to make that
time count by pursuing the one thing which has given our lives meaning: MUSIC.
Music has sustained us through all of the ups-and-downs,
both listening to it or performing it live (something which we had to stop
doing altogether for nearly a year, but are SO HAPPY to finally be able to do
again!!).  Most cathartic has been the
music which we started writing ourselves, both before Faith’s diagnosis but
especially throughout her/our ordeal. 
Our experiences – both shared and independent – have culminated in a
slew of original songs which run the gamut from angry to inspirational to just
plain fun!  And we’re determined to share
these songs with the world, and those who have gone (or are going through)
similar struggles in hopes that they draw strength from them.
First, let us clarify what we DON’T want to do: we do not
want to be “rockstars”…we don’t want to record a demo in order to land a
recording contract, and we don’t want to tour & play shows 250 days of the
year to promote an album we’ve released. 
Even in relatively good health, this is not something which Faith can
manage, as the cumulative effects of her MS have already drained her energy…while
we will continue to perform live on occasion, the gruelling grind of a touring
musician is not a possibility for us.
What we DO want is to write songs for artists who are already doing all of that…simply put, we want
to be SONGWRITERS (with an eye to landing a publishing contract in Nashville).  In addition to our passion for creating
music, songwriting is something which Faith can
continue to do even as her condition progresses.
We’re already well on our way to that goal…we have a dozen
strong original songs “ready to go”, we have an amazing agent and lawyer
representing us in the US, and we have strong connections – and real
opportunities – in the key market of Nashville, TN.  What we don’t have – and need – is a polished
studio recording of each of our songs, along with professional marketing
materials to promote ourselves. This is where you come in!

story:
We're Mulberry Soul and we want to share our music with you!

Hi there! We're five young folks living in the Finger Lakes area of New York State. Some of us have been hanging out since the mid '80s, but we've been playing music together as Mulberry Soul since 2012. We were spending summer nights jamming around a campfire at the Folk Art Guild in Middlesex, NY and started playing a gig here and there. Four years later, we've played hundreds of shows together and evolved our own flavor of rambling progressive bluegrass. After two self-recorded EPs and many moons of promising a full-length original album, we've finally got a ten song album to share!

Mulberry Soul is:

Aaron Oldweiler - Bass & Vocals
Chris Machanoff - Guitar & Vocals
Cordelia Hall - Banjo & Vocals
Gabe Schliffer - Fiddle, Cello, & Vocals
Scott Calpin - Mandolin & Vocals

What We Need & What You Get

We've invested our band fund in recording our 10 song album at with Dave Drago at 1809 Studios. That part's all done! We're creating this campaign for pre-orders to get the physical album in your hands - with some extra fun perks thrown in. To get the album turned into CDs it will cost:

$1500 Physical distribution costs to print CDs
$300 Album design by our extremely talented friend Elizabeth Bennett of EMB Design
$200 shipping expenses and Indiegogo platform costs

In exchange for your contribution, you'll get our album! In addition, you can choose from a variety of fun perks, Mulbby merch, bonus content, even a house concert!

The Impact

Although we all have many endeavors (baking bread, shiitake growing, woodworking, labor organizing, agricultural research, building, blacksmithing) we all approach music as an essential part of our lives and livelihoods. Getting this album made means we can share our music more widely, and potentially travel further from our hometown to play music for new friends.

Non-$$ ways to contribute!

If you can't contribute to our campaign, that doesn't mean you can't help! Share this page on social media, like us on Facebook, follow on Instagram and come out and see us!! We want to share our music with as many folks as possible!

story:
WATCH THE VIDEO, IT EXPLAINS EVERYONE. THANKS!

You can also read my artist biography below.

Artist Bio:

Jehzan is a twenty-four year old emcee, spoken word poet, freelance journalist, and budding entrepreneur from Honolulu, HI. She runs her own website as well as her own Hip Hop blog, hosted on www.JehzanExclusive.com. 

Jehzan credits most of her musical influence to 90s and 2000s Hip Hop and R&B artists such as 2Pac, Eminem, Missy Elliot, Lauryn Hill, T-Pain, Akon, and Nelly. However, she is a big fan of many artists in the independent Hip Hop genre such as Blue Scholars, Bambu, Classified, Hopsin, Dizzy Wright, Pryde, and Snow Tha Product. While choosing not to categorize herself as a solely as a "conscious" rapper, the level of Jehzan's lyrical content narrated through a variety of beats and instrumentals is of high caliber. She brings unique style as a female MC from the islands of Hawaii, and credits much of her inspiration to personal experiences especially being raised by her single mother, personal challenges, politics, college, and many other topics that fill her brain. She is currently a college senior, studying Marketing at Hawaii Pacific University (HPU), and is set to graduate in Winter 2016. She has experience in content-writing for social media and blogs; and continues to channel her academic and professional skills towards her music. 

Jehzan's music journey started with spoken word poetry. At age 17, she attended a summer leadership conference for minority youth housed at University of California's Berkeley Campus. The curriculum required students to pick an art form to reflect on during their experience, and Jehzan chose spoken word poetry. When she returned home to Hawaii, she soon began recording her poems over Hip Hop/Rap beats on Garage Band with some of her cousins and friends from church. Overtime, Jehzan found a knack for rapping while still keeping her poetic qualities. Throughout her early 20s, Jehzan has served in the Hawaii Army National Guard and has been a full-time student, all while she developed and strengthened her skills as a lyricist and performer. She has performed and/or made stage presences at a number of events and venues throughout Hawaii such as Hawaii Theatre, Queen Kapiolani Park Band Stage, Hawaii Pacific University, University of Hawaii West Oahu, Bar 35, Fresh Cafe, and Rende Vuu Nightclub. She has also appeared on online and Hawaii-based radio stations such as KNDI, KTUH, RudeBoyRadio, Connect Gang Radio, and P.O.L Radio. In 2015, after accepting her invitation to compete as an online finalist in Team Backpack's Mission Underground video auditions, Jehzan successfully fundraised her first crowdsource campaign via IndieGoGo. The funds enabled Jehzan to fly to Los Angeles to compete in Team Backpack's Live Cypher Draft. 2016 remains full of opportunity for this young writer, rapper, and entrepreneur. Jehzan is currently working on her upcoming mixtape, "Island Waves & City Haze," which is slated to drop in early July. Help Jehzan reach this campaign's fundraising goal as she continues to put Hawaii on the map for good.

story:
Who Is Simone Nicole?

Hello! I am Simone Nicole, a local and independent singer/songwriter from the Dallas/Fort Worth area. Some of you may know me, some of you may not. 

Hello, new person! Hello, friends! Hello, family! Thanks for stopping by! (:

New Album? Tell Me More!

Over the past few years I've been itching to record a new album. So much of my time has been spent writing music, trying to find myself and my strength, while driving through different cities, searching for other creatives to work with. I've been on a quest to bring the words and music I hear in my head to life, in hope to find the right team to accompany me in the creative process.
About two months ago, I started working with two very talented guys, thanks to my friend Joshua Mather. At first, we we're just going to record one song to see if we all meshed well together... The next thing I know, we're already 5 songs in and I'm scrambling for extra ways to pay for the beautiful music we have been creating! This is where you, my fans, friends, family, and everyone out there who loves music, come in. It would mean a great deal to me if you could help me fund this next album. Without your help, the recording and release process will take much longer to complete. 

The Impact.

By supporting this project, you're not only helping me; you're helping an entire  community of musicians and engineers that will be involved. 

The Breakdown.

  • $3,050.00 will be going towards studio rental, the wonderful producer/engineer, and mixing/ mastering of each song.
  • $2,550.00 will be going towards all the amazing musicians that have dedicated their time in making each song come alive. (Drums, Percussion, Guitars, Bass, Keys, Strings, etc.)
  • $600 will be going towards CD printing and digital distribution fees.
All of that should come out to around $6,200.00. 

Finale.

Thank you for reading through all of the text! You are fantastic! You've made it to the end! I know not everyone will be able to contribute to this campaign, but whether you can or not, it would be wonderful if you could share this campaign on Social Media sites. As always, I appreciate your love and support so very much! I couldn't do any of these musical things without you. I am crazy excited to share this new project with you in January 2017.

Much love,

Simone Nicole

P.S. Sorry for the choppy audio bits in the video... the Texas Wind decided it wanted to speak.

Also, all contributors will be credited in the album. (:

story:
Hey everyone! For those of you who don't know, we are Silence the Ocean, a christian metalcore band from southern Ohio. We have been a band for five years this August. We released our 3rd studio album, Horizons EP,  on June 4th 2016. Sadly, we haven't  been able to tour any of our releases due to not having a reliable vehicle. If we are able to receive funds for a new van that would mean the world to us. We are setting a goal of $5,000 because we would love to be able to get a newer reliable van that will last us a while. Every cent you put into this helps us in our efforts to tour and play shows for all our fans. We want to meet you all, give high fives, hugs, take selfies, and have fun together. If we don't reach our goal, everything we raise will still go into buying a new van. So, don't be afraid to donate even just a dollar. We appreciate it all the same. We are a band that wants to spread love. Every fan that tells us we have made a positive impact on their lives is a blessing to us, and we want to reach all the people we can. We have gone through a lot as a band, but in these five years we have still grown. We hope to continue to grow and that you can be a part of it. If you are unable to donate, please share this and pray for us. Anything you can do to help is amazing.

Help us reach new places, people, & hearts.

story:
Some very hard working friends of mine run my town's local record store. They've been open for a little over a year and have worked their socks off. The store's become a key part of the community and I can't imagine Folkestone without it now. 

The guys that run the store are endlessly supportive of the local community. They have offered their space for meetings about getting a local DIY space up and running and do all they can to promote local bands.

Recently they came in to find a window smashed. We don't know what happened. It may just have been a drunken scuffle that ended up knocking into the front of the shop. It may not have been malicious. But it's got big financial implications for a new business getting off its feet and the insurance doesn't cover it (ain't that always the way?). The first quote came in at £850. They've got that down to £500 but it's still a huge hit.

I'd really like us to help them out. They've got stacks of good karma for all that they've done locally, and I'd love it if we could show them some love in return.

So, if you're able to spare a couple of quid it would be great. Every penny will go to giving something back to a young independent business that's making a difference in the community.

Thanking all you lovely people in advance.

Love and solidarity,

Bridget

story:
Our Story... 

We are passionate about live music! We came up with the idea of organizing a Latin Jazz Festival in Harlem, NYC, the birthplace of Latin Jazz. 

We began to reach out to venues, local restaurants and artists...

Musical legend Tito Puente was a proponent of the Latin music wave from East Harlem, NYC, so it was only right that we called on the heir of the mambo throne, Tito Puente Jr., to give us his blessings... and what do you know! After hearing about the Festival, we are face- timed by Tito Puente Jr.!!!

We are humbled and excited from the support we have received and will not rest until live music lovers get to experience the magic of the El Barrio Latin Jazz Festival in the very neighborhood where Latin Jazz was born!

Invest!

Join us on this journey as we bring the spirit of live Latin Jazz music back to the neighborhood in which it started!

Invest $100 and join the artists and celebrity guests on stage and enjoy the concert from the comfort of the VIP lounge

Let's make an impact!

The history of Latin Jazz in Harlem is incomparable. In their time, the musicians from this New York City neighborhood changed the sounds of Latin music forever. Lets provide a stage once again for musicians to explore new sounds, for emerging artists to connect with concert goers and to use music to make an impact!

Strengths and Challenges... 

The group of volunteers that makes up our team includes people with experience in concert production and promotions, musicians and community leaders...

The venues have all been reserved. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can not invest at this time, we understand... Helping us get the word out is just as valuable! Share this with friends and family using the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
We are KB Jones & The Kontraband, a band from Queens, NY, and we need your help to bring this music video for our new song "F.U.N.K." to life. Essentially, we will be filming a great gathering of people who are coming together to celebrate what music means to them (the greatest party ever). Your contributions will help us bring the people and the music together.


We need $8,000 to bring this vision to light properly. We will be collaborating with a professional film crew and we really want to pay them. Actually, we have to. Camera equipment, lights, stands, food for staff, staff, extras, pre-production, post-production, carpenters, producers, will come into play and they all cost a sufficient amount of money. You'll get a genuine music video that represents our song "F.U.N.K." in the fullest and most absorbing way possible.


Video Concept

There will be a big party that we are going to film as the basis for the video. We want to capture the emotion of our music by bringing people together and filming their interactions. The party will be at our house in Queens, NY, where we live, write, record, play, and grow our music (an incubator of sorts). This video will allow you to immerse yourself into our song "F.U.N.K" which is about enjoying one another and living in the moment.  


There are a few things that we are confident in; one being our ability to throw a party. We also believe in our music (why else would we live on top of each other under one roof). We value our fans, friends, and family (without you this music we make has no meaning). We want everyone that appreciates our craft to be a part of this project in one way or another. If we don't meet our goal there will still be a video, but the more money we raise, the better the product will be. We have tons of new songs and visual concepts coming out after this project, so we want to start the next phase of our career in the right way. It all starts with making this video the way it is supposed to be made. 


If you can't donate money there are still ways you can contribute. We need extras for the video (the more the better). Food will help also (we have to feed everyone on set). We'll need a stage, so any materials or experience for building one is greatly appreciated. Please share this with everyone you know. The more people that see this, the better our chances are of reaching our goal. Don't be afraid to reach out and see what you can do to make this a possibility.


Thank You so much for your time, your money, and/or your support. We love you all and like most projects we take on as a band, we can't do this without you.

Sincerely,

KB Jones & The Kontraband
story_txt:
We are KB Jones & The Kontraband, a band from Queens, NY, and we need your help to bring this music video for our new song "F.U.N.K." to life. Essentially, we will be filming a great gathering of people who are coming together to celebrate what music means to them (the greatest party ever). Your contributions will help us bring the people and the music together. 
We need $8,000 to bring this vision to light properly. We will be collaborating with a professional film crew and we really want to pay them. Actually, we have to. Camera equipment, lights, stands, food for staff, staff, extras, pre-production, post-production, carpenters, producers, will come into play and they all cost a sufficient amount of money. You'll get a genuine music video that represents our song "F.U.N.K." in the fullest and most absorbing way possible. 

Video Concept
There will be a big party that we are going to film as the basis for the video. We want to capture the emotion of our music by bringing people together and filming their interactions. The party will be at our house in Queens, NY, where we live, write, record, play, and grow our music (an incubator of sorts). This video will allow you to immerse yourself into our song "F.U.N.K" which is about enjoying one another and living in the moment.  

There are a few things that we are confident in; one being our ability to throw a party. We also believe in our music (why else would we live on top of each other under one roof). We value our fans, friends, and family (without you this music we make has no meaning). We want everyone that appreciates our craft to be a part of this project in one way or another. If we don't meet our goal there will still be a video, but the more money we raise, the better the product will be. We have tons of new songs and visual concepts coming out after this project, so we want to start the next phase of our career in the right way. It all starts with making this video the way it is supposed to be made. 

If you can't donate money there are still ways you can contribute. We need extras for the video (the more the better). Food will help also (we have to feed everyone on set). We'll need a stage, so any materials or experience for building one is greatly appreciated. Please share this with everyone you know. The more people that see this, the better our chances are of reaching our goal. Don't be afraid to reach out and see what you can do to make this a possibility. 

Thank You so much for your time, your money, and/or your support. We love you all and like most projects we take on as a band, we can't do this without you. 
Sincerely,
KB Jones & The Kontraband

story:
Kuonaista päivää!

Me Kuonalla välitämme. Me haluamme ottaa teidät mukaan meidän ihanaan projektiin. Vaikka Mr. Lohja sanoi kesällä kännissä mitä sattui, me olemme ihmisen asialla.

Me haluamme tehdä kuonaisimman, limaa tihkuvimman, pahimman hajuisen levyn, jota kuunnellessa veri valuu korvista, ja kuvia katsellessa veri valuu silmistä. Se on rakkautta jos ei muu.

Meillä on kuitenkin ongelma. Me olemme kaikki kapitalisti-runkkareita ja joudumme tekemään päivätöitä ylläpitääksemme kapitalisti, riistäjä imagomme siviilissä.  Valitettavasti rahapalkkamme ei riitä kirkuvien lapsien, ulosottovelkojen, asuntolainojen, elatusmaksujen, pornhubin kuukausimaksujen ja muiden pakollisten kulujen jälkeen rahoittamaan tämän levyn kuluja. Toisinsanoen, me ollaan köyhiä runkkareita.


Ajatus (voiko basistilla olla ajatuksia?)

Me annetaan teille kaikkea pientä kivaa, kun te sponssaatte meidän projektia. Meiltä löytyy kortsuja, plekuja, ties mitä! Kun te sponssaatte, niin me välitämme teistä. Lisäksi jokainen meitä tukenut saa nimensä levyn sisäkanteen.

Rahat menisivät siis studioaikaan, tuottajaan, miksaukseen ja masterointiin, merkkareihin, viinaan, jne. Jos pääsemme tarvittavaan summaan, eli 2000€ (mukavan pyöreä luku), Kuona julkaisee vuoden lopussa pitkäsoiton, joka saa kovimmankin bläk-metal miehen yökkäämään ja tärisemään.

Portaat (taivaaseen)

Jostain on lähdettävä liikkeelle. Mr. Lohja loukkaantui ja erosi bändistä. Kuona ei vaan ole Kuona ilman sitä seksikästä mörökölliä! Ja Lohja on kuitenkin Kuona-studion virallinen isäntä, joten päivitykset ovat vähäiset ja paska-laatuiset ilman häntä. Ja nyt kun se körmy on saatu takaisin, päivitykset rullaavat kuin himokas mursu jäälautalta mereen!

Olemme huomanneet, että teidän kuoniaisten kukkaronnyörit ovat tiukalla, joten olemme tiivistäneet koko komeuden yhteen himoa ja visvaa tihkuvaan portaaseen: 

2000€:sta me tunkataan kokopitkä älppäri kaikkine hienouksineen, merkkareineen ja kiertueineen. Tämä on siis meidän multihuipentuma, orgastinen tavoite. Jos tähän ei päästä, niin se saattaapi olla pelkkä EP, mikä sieltä putkahtaa ulos. Pahimmassa (*kylmänväreitä*) sieltä tulee vaan parin biisin sinkku.


Pistetään siis rattaat pyörimään ja hinkataan levy teille iloksi/suruksi Joulun lahjasukkaan tai takanlämmikkeeksi. Jarr!! Sillä saa vaikka anopin lähtemään jo Tapaninpäivänä takaisin Nurmoon tai Joutsaan! Tai saunan taakse, missä kukin sitä anoppiaan pitää.


Loppusanat

Nyt kun seksi-ikoni ja huippumalli Mr. Lohja on taas rivissä, niin laitetaan homma kulkemaan! Jos tilaatte jotakin tuotessa, jossa on mahdollisuus valita jotakin, vaikkapa T-paitojen kokoa, plekun paksuutta tai kortsujen makua, pistäkään viestiä kuona85@gmail.com osoitteeseen. Me tunkataan siitä lahjasta sitten sellainen, että se ei täytä mitään odotuksia ja vituttaa vuoden loppuun. Ehkä jopa Helmikuuhun.

Tuossa vieressä on nyt siis lista erilaisista sponssaus mahdollisuuksista. Me päivitetään tänne videota ja kuvaa ja tekstiä, ylipäänsä Kuonaa teille nautittavaksi. Huom! Jos nautit Kuonaa enemmän kuin yhden annoksen, kognitiivinen kykysi saattaa heikentyä emmekä vastaa vahingoista teille tai läheisillenne.
Kuona on epämetallia. Kuona on ei-haluttu. Kuona on sivutuote.
Pysykää nuhteessa!
- V. Suolenkainen

story:
BedPop Record Shop at The Lane, April 23, 2016

The BedPop Record Shop, set up in 2014, is a free event that celebrates the vinyl record.  Record traders sit alongside the best local musicians to create the atmosphere of the independent record shop of olde.

Record traders pay for space and that pays for the running costs of the event.  We have been long debating how to pay the performing artists, resisting an entry charge.

All contributions will be split evenly between all the acts listed below and the generous benefactors will be acknowledged on the BedPop website and in promotional material at the next event. 

Giving their time free at our next event will be:

  • Amy Mason
  • Adam Knowles
  • Mill Race Folk (MarissaJacknDavy)
  • Poetry Slam, featuring up to five amateur poets
  • The Shtooks
  • Adam James Urwin & Robbie Miller
  • Roll Your Own Records, DJ collective

Roll Your Own Records, DJ collective

story:
If you speak english please click here for the campaign:
 
https://www.indiegogo.com/project/preview/3186a745
 
Ich bzw. wir möchten mit Deiner Hilfe eine Insel kaufen. Wo diese Insel sein wird ist noch unklar, da es abhängig davon ist wieviel Geld wir zusammenbekommen. Am liebsten wäre uns eine Insel wo es meistens schön warm ist z. Bsp. Spanien oder Italien. Hier gibt es allerdings nur wenig Inseln zur Auswahl und diese sind auch recht teuer ( 1 Million aufwärts), daher wäre Kanada (Nova Scotia) eine gute Alternative. Hier gibt es sehr viele Inseln zur Auswahl, die Inseln sind bewaldet, somit Holz zum Heizen vorhanden und auch zum Bauen von Häusern. Hier ein paar Beispiele:
 
http://www.vladi-private-islands.de/en/island+b...
 
http://www.vladi-private-islands.de/en/island+b...
 
Wir möchten dort autark leben, so gut es uns möglich ist, wir möchten Obst und Gemüse anpflanzen, unsere Lebensmittel selbst herstellen (Nudeln, Brot, Kuchen usw.). Somit ein freieres Leben führen, in dem es nicht immer nur ums Geld verdienen geht und das Geld nie reicht. Wir möchten unsere Häuser selbst bauen und auch weitere Häuser bauen, in dem Du auch Du Urlaub machen kannst oder für eine gewisse Zeit bei uns lebst. Es wird auf der Insel auch Urlaubsangebote geben, wie Meditation, Yoga, fischen, Bootstouren usw. usw. 
 
Ich habe schon lange darüber nachgedacht wie ich mein doch ziemlich stressiges Leben hier in Deutschland verändern kann. Ich bin von Beruf Bilanzbuchhalterin und bin selbständig. Ich erstelle die Buchhaltung für verschiedene Firmen und habe zudem noch einen Lohnsteuerhilfeverein, in dem ich Steuererklärungen für Arbeitnehmer erstelle. Die Arbeit an sich ist meistens interessant und ich habe sehr viele nette Mandanten, aber ich kann mir einfach nicht vorstellen den Rest meines Lebens damit zu verbringen. Ich möchte mehr Zeit für mich und meine Kinder (14 und 2 Jahre) haben bevor sie erwachsen sind.
 
Auf der Insel muss auch gearbeitet werden, keine Frage, aber es verteilt sich auf mehrere Schultern, man ist eine Gemeinschaft wo jeder jedem hilft und nicht jeder einzeln ums Überleben kämpfen muss. Eine Insel zu kaufen war schon immer mein Traum, allerdings habe ich lange Zeit überlegt, ob ich diesen Schritt wirklich wagen soll und raus aus der vermeintlichen Sicherheit in ein unbekanntes Leben..... Die Zeit war mein Helfer und ich habe irgendwann gespürt, dass ich das unbedingt umsetzen will und der Drang danach wurde von Tag zu Tag größer. Nun bin ich soweit gekommen, dass ich euch mein Projekt hier präsentiere und Dich um Deine Mithilfe bitte. Ich habe seitdem auch ein paar Freunden von meinem Projekt erzählt, die ebenfalls mit auf die Insel gehen möchten. Auf Facebook haben wir eine Gruppe gegründet, in der wir mittlerweile 160 Personen sind, natürlich wird nicht jeder von denen auf die Insel gehen, aber sicher wird sich hier der ein oder andere noch finden.  Das Geld, das Du spendest, wird in den Kauf der Insel fließen sowie in die Anschaffung eines Boots. Die Häuser wird jeder einzelne von uns selbst finanzieren. Wir wollen dabei die Kosten natürlich so gering wie möglich halten. Häuser gibt es schon sehr günstig. Einige Beispielfotos findet ihr in meiner Galerie.
 

 

Sollte das Funding-Ziel nicht erreicht werden, werden wir das Geld, das wir bereits gesammelt haben. für eine weitere Finanzierung verwenden sprich Crowdlending z. Bsp. oder ähnliches bis wir das Geld zusammen haben.
 
Wenn Du uns hilfst, kannst Du rechts die Perks sehen, die wir vergeben. Von einer Insel-Postkarte mit uns drauf über eine Video-Doku unseres Insel Projekts bis hin zu einem Urlaub bei uns.....
  
Sicher wird es nicht ganz einfach auf einer Insel weit weg der Heimat ein neues Leben zu beginnen. Häuser müssen gebaut werden, es dauert eine Weile bis Gemüse und Obst angebaut ist und verwertet werden kann. Einige Inseln sind schon erschlossen, einige auch nicht. Der Inselverkäufer www.vladi-private-islands.de  bietet aber Informationen hierüber an bzw. arbeitet mit Firmen zusammen, die auf die Erschließung von Inseln spezialisiert sind. Themen wie Wasseraufbereitung, Strom durch Wind- oder Solarenergie sowie Kommunikation (Internet, Telefon).
 
Du kannst uns helfen, indem Du uns Deinen persönlichen Betrag spendest und Dir dadurch ein Perk sicherst. Aber auch die Verbreitung unserer Kampagne bei Deinen Freunden, in Deinen Social-Media-Netzwerken uw. sind eine große Hilfe für uns, um unsere Kampagne bekannt zu machen und Geld zu sammeln. Wenn Du Interesse an unserer Gruppe hast, findest Du uns bei Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/1569418283369349/ oder Du kannst uns eine email schreiben an info@ich-einfach-frei.de oder uns auch über diese Seite kontaktieren.
 
Wir sind über jede Hilfe dankbar und danken Dir von Herzen für Dein Interesse.
