story:
My name is Žan Tetičkovič, I go by the artist name of Jean John and I am a 25 year old Slovenian percussionist and an award winning composer, living in New York City. In January 2011, I started creating an exhaustive work of extensive proportions, “The Port of Life”.

The Port Of Life is my one and only child, my raison d’être and a manifesto in front of which I stand completely vulnerable and sincere. It’s a compelling sonic experience and an emotive confession with which I am telling my story of acculturation...from saying a farewell to the first culture to complete assimilation in a new culture.

This is not a regular Indiegogo campaign. Since, I have already funded this insanely expensive project entirely by myself, it’s quite the opposite. Nothing is wanted from you, dear fans and listeners and I am not offering cookies, private lessons, etc in exchange for your support.

This 30-day campaign is just a chance for you to pre-order and get this unique work of art “The Port Of Life” for yourself, as this music will not be released in the shape of a regular CD... it is released in the shape of beautifully crafted book and a unique work of visual art.

A product like this is expensive to print, so only pre-ordered copies will be actually printed. After the end of 30-day campaign, only a limited number from my personal collection will be available and will be sold only on The Port of Life CD-release concerts.

Please share this with anyone you know that supports and like new music and art. Any support in the way of spreading the word will be more than appreciated and your biggest possible contribution to this project. Copy and paste the link on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram or anywhere else or use the Indiegogo sharing tool!

Since this project is completed and ready to be print, there is no risk involved once you purchase your copy. Your copy will be printed and shipped to you, immediately after the end of a campaign.

Thank you for supporting new music,
thank you for supporting my artistry,
thank you for supporting “The Port of Life”.

Personel & Credits

Jean John (Žan Tetičkovič) – Drums and Cymbals, Composition
Alba Nacinovich – Vocals
Lenart Krečič – Tenor Saxophone
Tomaž Gajšt – Trumpet and Flugelhorn
Jani Moder – Guitar
Marko Črnčec (Churnchetz) – Piano
Myles Sloniker – Upright Bass

Janus Atelier String Quartet:
Matija Krečič – 1st Violin
Nejc Avbelj – 2nd Violin
Barbara Grahor – Viola
Zoran Bičanin – Violoncello

Andrej Lamut – photography
Marko Damiš – design
Sergej Harlamov - poetry

Žiga Murko – electronics
story_txt:
My name is Žan Tetičkovič, I go by the artist name of Jean John and I am a 25 year old Slovenian percussionist and an award winning composer, living in New York City. In January 2011, I started creating an exhaustive work of extensive proportions, “The Port of Life”.




The Port Of Life is my one and only child, my raison d’être and a manifesto in front of which I stand completely vulnerable and sincere. It’s a compelling sonic experience and an emotive confession with which I am telling my story of acculturation...from saying a farewell to the first culture to complete assimilation in a new culture. 


This is not a regular Indiegogo campaign. Since, I have already funded this insanely expensive project entirely by myself, it’s quite the opposite. Nothing is wanted from you, dear fans and listeners and I am not offering cookies, private lessons, etc in exchange for your support.


This 30-day campaign is just a chance for you to pre-order and get this unique work of art “The Port Of Life” for yourself, as this music will not be released in the shape of a regular CD... it is released in the shape of beautifully crafted book and a unique work of visual art.






A product like this is expensive to print, so only pre-ordered copies will be actually printed. After the end of 30-day campaign, only a limited number from my personal collection will be available and will be sold only on The Port of Life CD-release concerts.



Please share this with anyone you know that supports and like new music and art. Any support in the way of spreading the word will be more than appreciated and your biggest possible contribution to this project. Copy and paste the link on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram or anywhere else or use the Indiegogo sharing tool!





Since this project is completed and ready to be print, there is no risk involved once you purchase your copy. Your copy will be printed and shipped to you, immediately after the end of a campaign.




Thank you for supporting new music, 
thank you for supporting my artistry, 
thank you for supporting “The Port of Life”.


Personel & Credits

Jean John (Žan Tetičkovič) – Drums and Cymbals, Composition
Alba Nacinovich – Vocals
Lenart Krečič – Tenor Saxophone
Tomaž Gajšt – Trumpet and Flugelhorn
Jani Moder – Guitar
Marko Črnčec (Churnchetz) – Piano
Myles Sloniker – Upright Bass

Janus Atelier String Quartet: 
Matija Krečič – 1st Violin
Nejc Avbelj – 2nd Violin
Barbara Grahor – Viola
Zoran Bičanin – Violoncello

Andrej Lamut – photography
Marko Damiš – design
Sergej Harlamov - poetry

Žiga Murko – electronics

story:
Will you help me to bring hope to others?

Hi, I'm Terry! How are you?

Having had such an overwhelmingly positive response to my first ever professionally recorded song, Let Me In, I've decided to record a full-length album!

Having overcome my own serious challenges, I've spent a large portion of my life helping those who are battling addiction, and this album will be an extension of that.

One of the songs written for the album was actually co-written by my daughter Lauryn, too, who will also be playing on it – something really special for me. 

Beyond this being just another collection of good songs it also will be a tool that can be used to:

  • Start conversations
  • Challenge toxic thinking
  • Bring hope to those who are living without any
Here's the thing: I want to do it well. But to do it well I need some help.

Not just a CD – but a DVD plus booklet!

As the heart of this project is its message, (rather than me trying to be a rock star), then to communicate it in more than just songs will give it the best chance of lasting success. So, I'm planning a 10-song CD, a DVD and a supporting booklet (similar to the Norah Jones packaging below):


1. The CD will contain songs that carry a strong theme of transformation and hope. 

2. The DVD will contain an interview with me sharing the stories & meanings behind the songs. I'll also tell more about the journey of my life, and give clear, practical steps to help those who are struggling in similar difficult situations to those I've overcome.

3. The booklet will credit everybody by name who has contributed to making this project a reality, list all song lyrics, give directions on how to get the most out of the resource and might even feature a photo of me!


£10,000+ is my goal

These are the estimated expenses that will go into making this record. My team and I will be extremely careful with how we spend this money. Each of these costs is significantly less than if this was being released on a traditional label, and we will be doing as much of the grunt work as possible ourselves.

  • Recording = £3,600
  • Mixing = £2,400
  • Mastering = £500
  • Filming = £720
  • DVD editing & production = £720
  • Photography, artwork and packaging design = £720
  • 1,000 CD & DVD production run = £2000

Anything we raise above the goal will be directed toward marketing, touring, and promotion of the record. 


What you'll get from me

As a way of saying thanks, I've come up with some fun perks to give you in return for every donation. Each reward is unique and I've never before given or sold these items. All the more special to be a part!

The more we raise, the more we can do: Every pledge counts. However small your contribution, it is hugely appreciated! If we join forces anything is possible. 

Even if I don't reach my entire goal then all funds pledged will go towards making the best product possible within that budget. I promise that nothing will be wasted or pledged in vain.


My studio choice

To help me I've found a great local studio – Revelator – to work with, enlisting Mark Pierce as producer/project manager to guide me. 

Mark specializes in working with songwriters and solo artists on instrumentation, production, branding, photography, artwork design, and digital distribution.

He has produced over 200 songs, plays multiple instruments, and has extensive experience as a studio musician. 

Before starting Revelator in 2005, Mark worked in senior roles for a number of design agencies, the accounts including BBC, ITV, SKY, LLP & EMAP, and has worked on marketing campaigns for Elton John & Bryan Adams.

Also, his photography has been used by Toni & Guy, Parcelforce, Aviva & Penguin Books.

Find out more on the website: www.revelator.co.uk


Risks & challenges

Obviously this is a big project to take on but I'm making the point of not going it alone. Not least I've got the support of my family, friends and church, plus I am very confident that with Mark's experience and proven ability to see big projects through to completion, my album will be in the safest of hands.


Other ways you can help

I realise that you may not be able to contribute financially – and that is totally fine – but you can still help in a big way:

  • There are people who'd love to get behind what I'm doing, but perhaps haven't heard about this project fundraiser. Would you please help me get the word out and make some noise about my campaign? 
  • Using the Indiegogo share tools on this website is a great way to do it!

Thanks so much for taking the time to read about my project campaign. I really do think this is important. It's born out of a strong heart conviction and I really can't do it alone, so please consider helping.

Many thanks,
Terry

   Other ways you can help I realise that you may not be able to contribute financially – and that is totally fine – but you can still help in a big way:  There are people who'd love to get behind what I'm doing, but perhaps haven't heard about this project fundraiser. Would you please help me get the word out and make some noise about my campaign?  Using the Indiegogo share tools on this website is a great way to do it!   Thanks so much for taking the time to read about my project campaign. I really do think this is important. It's born out of a strong heart conviction and I really can't do it alone, so please consider helping.Many thanks,Terry

story:
I released my debut album, Ajo, in 2012. It was well received and still gets regular airplay in the Netherlands as well as my native Nigeria and elsewhere in the world. 

In 2015 I released a new single, C.O.P. (which stands for Country of Pain) – the first track from the new album. You can listen to it here https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oRC5dDYoW4E  to get a flavour. While the tone is upbeat, the subject is serious, addressing the issues surrounding migration and inequality around the world. Being an African immigrant to Europe myself and a regular traveller has given me a particular perspective, which I share through this song and others.

I have already recorded and mixed several other tracks and have more in the making. The album will be informative yet entertaining, reflecting on freedom of political and musical expression but with an irresistible groove.

Afreekanism will be deeply rooted in African idioms.This is a Futuristic African music its 85% African and 15% Jazz , Soul,Funk, Blues  and Black music in general, In addition to composing, arranging, singing and playing guitar on most of the songs, I also play various African instruments, including Kalimba, Ngoni and Sakara. I have already had a special costume created by the visionary designers at Ore Apparels in Lagos ,  had the  photo shoot for the album artwork by The award wining Photographer Adeola Olagunju in the ancient Yoruba city of Ile-Ife, and the  Graphic designed  By Maria Stathi Soto . However the album will also be global at heart, featuring special guests from the USA, the UK and Greece,Netherlands as well as Nigeria and Senegal.

Please support this campaign and let us tell a wonderful story together.  

What We Need & What You Get

Producing an album is an expensive business. By supporting this campaign you’ll help me finish the remaining tracks and mix, master, print and publicise Afreekanism. 

Here’s what I still need:

More studio sessions 

payment of Session musicians

Payment of Sound engineers

Mixing

Mastering

Graphic Design for CD and Vinyl  

Printing  Cd and  Vinyl

Publicity and all other things that post production entails.

To thank you for your support, depending on how much you pledge, you’ll qualify for a perk. These include:

pre-release downloads

unreleased materials that will reveal how the album evolved

specially designed Afreekanism T-shirts

handwritten scores

and even a custom cover song of your choice!

The Impact

With its themes of freedom of expression, migration and equality, I believe Afreekanism is truly relevant to today’s global audience and needs to be heard as soon as possible. 

Songs from my first album, Ajo, are regularly played on the radio in Netherlands  and Nigeria and the album received positive reviews, however it never achieved the public profile I had hoped for. With your help, I know Afreekanism will make a much bigger impact.

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether or not you can contribute financially, you can also help to bring Afreekanism into reality by helping me make some noise about it. You can use the Indiegogo share tools, tweet using the hashtag #Afreekanism or just tell your friends! 

Thank you in anticipation.

Musically yours

Adedeji

story:
About the Vamps

We are a Pittsburgh-based soul, blues, and R&B band whose musical style is inspired by the heavy horns of New Orleans just as much as the raw, lonesome Stella guitar. With influences ranging from soul icons such as Otis Redding to modern shakers like Amy Winehouse, we employ timeless melodies and instrumentation to exude a natural air of nostalgia for a sound that has never faded away.

After releasing our debut EP in December 2013, we hit stages all across the 'Burgh sharing the story of heartbreak, anger, and acceptance that makes up the record, Love Through the Line. Now we have returned after three years with some fresh blood and new stories to share with you.

About the Project

In order to bring this music to you, we need to do it right. And for us to do it right, we will be recording in a top-notch facility and hiring some bad-ass sound engineers and producers.

The total cost of this project will cost roughly $5,000, but we will be setting our fundraising goal at $3,000. If we meet it, or even surpass it, we will get to focus completely on the creative aspect of our album with a little less financial stress on our shoulders. With this crowdfunding campaign, we are asking all of you to be directly involved with the process of making this record from the very start!

The EP will be loaded with our usual mix of vintage soul, delta blues, and smooth R&B. We have grown a lot since the Vamps began in 2013, and we are experimenting with a slew of new instruments, methods, and moods. But in the heart of it all still lies our familiar frank lyrics and classic vibes that you can find on our debut EP. You can be sure to expect some swearing and some sass, of course.

Expenses for this record include tracking, mixing, mastering, and printing. We are working with some of the best technology and engineers in Pittsburgh (and Nashville!) in order to make us sound as kickass as possible. To do this without a label or an agent is quite the feat for any local band, but we are doing everything we can on our end to give you a high-quality product!

About the Studio

For this soul-heavy, full-throttle project, we are setting up camp at the stellar Tonic Recording Studios in McKeesport, PA. Sound engineer Donnie Moretti will be working like a maniac to make us sound like rockstars.

When the recording and mixing are complete, our tunes will be sent to Nashville to be mastered and perfected by Independent Mastering, the same studio that has worked with Lynyrd Skynyrd, Willie Nelson, Joan Osbourne, and more!

     

Our first record was very much a journey of heartbreak. When shit hits the fan, you go through every emotion from anger to revenge to debilitating sadness. Those emotions are exactly what drove Love Through the Line. With this new EP, things are seen a little more clearly. The pieces are being picked up and thrown out with the waste. Of course, there is still anger and sadness and tons of mistakes. There will always be.  But at the end of the day, we are all stronger than our nastiest demons, and life indeed does go on.

And sometimes, you just gotta realize, "Bitches are crazy."

About Your Donation

We want everyone to know how much we appreciate every cent that is donated, and we have put together some fantastic rewards for your support. We have goodies from digital downloads and signed posters, to a personal Skype show and a rare chance to be an executive producer!

Most importantly, we need your help in spreading the word! Local independent music is rooted in fan support and word of mouth, and we can’t do this without you.

We want our music to be shared with you all, and we want it to be done right. You can help us make it happen!

Thank you so much for checking out our campaign! Make sure to follow us on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram to stay up to date on the project. We will be posting photos, videos, and more in order to keep you all in the loop!

We hope you can be patient with us as we take our time to make this EP as close to perfect as possible. We have not set a deadline for completion yet, but we promise to make it worth the wait, and we’d love to have you along for the ride.

All of our love,

Chelsey & the Vamps

story:
Hello!! 

Welcome to my Indiegogo Campaign, I am so grateful you've made it this far!  

As you've most likely read, or heard- I am on the quest to get to Israel for July to participate in IVAI Tel Aviv 2016! Yay! I am reaching out to friends, family, and acquaintances for support- because working and living abroad is no small feat.   

 The program will be a rigorous month of performing, and will also consist of: master classes with legendary singers, intensive vocal study, and an opportunity to work with world-renown teachers, and directors. This will be a tremendous next step for my career. 

 My goal is to raise $3,500 by June 15th, in order to cover the cost of the program, and my travel and living expenses. I am asking for your support to help make this next step in my musical career a reality. If you are willing and able to donate please do so above! 

 I am excited to say that this fundraising effort will end with a recital this Spring, so save the date: May 14th, 2016, 7:30PM at the National Opera Center in NYC! More details to come.

 I am beyond grateful for your time, and continued encouragement. Regardless of whether you can donate or not, I wanted to share some of my recent music with you. Two links links can be found below, I hope you enjoy!

Much love,

Elliot

Soundcloud: www.soundcloud.com/elliot-rosen

Youtube: www.youtube.com/watch?v=QKcPfO1Tmmc

story:
Our Mission

It takes one person to ignite the fire and many to keep it burning. Ignite The Fire is not just a band, but a way for our fans and us as musicians to express ourselves through music. Our mission is to create music that people can relate to and be able to enjoy. Fans of Ignite The Fire know the energy, preparation, and care we put into each and every song and how much we strive to fully entertain those at our live shows.

The Plan

The plan is simple, to be able to continue to do what we do, we want to create an album with and for the people who make Ignite The Fire possible. You. This album will be the culmination of everything Ignite The Fire is; the intensity, focus, drive and even quirkiness. We want to create an album that is a Thank-You letter to not only our fans, but fans of rock music.    

What We Need & What You Get

The goal is to raise $6,000 to be able to get into the studio and record new music. The funds we raise will be used exclusively to record our new album.

We've put together some great perks that will be exclusive to our contributors. Each perk can be found to the right of your screen. They include Digital Downloads, a Signed Physical Copy of our New Album, Posters, Shirts, Hoodies, Custom Art, a Signed Acoustic Guitar, our Stage Banner, and an opportunity to get a matching tattoo with our guitarist Mike as well as many other great perks!

Shirts and Hoodies will feature this exclusive design created by our vocalist Jack:

The Impact

Ignite The Fire is fans of music making music for the fans. Your contribution not only goes towards us living our dream, but also us creating music that may help or inspire someone else. It may sound silly, but music impacts all of us in different ways. As stated in our mission, we want to create music that people can relate to that can also help express themselves as human beings. Musical expression is important to both those who create music and those who listen to it, that is why we want to make an album with and for you.

Other Ways You Can Help

By being our fan and friend, you help give us the inspiration we need to continue on our musical journey. If you can't make a monetary contribution, you can help by sharing this campaign with your friends and family on social media or out in the real world. Share our band page on facebook and help spread the word as much as you care. 

Thank You!

It takes one person to ignite the fire and many to keep it burning. Thank you for your continued support and friendship as we set out to begin this new album with you! From all of us in Ignite The Fire... Keep Rockin'!

Fans of Ignite The Fire know the energy, preparation, and care we put into each and every song and how much we strive to fully entertain those at our live shows.

The Plan
The plan is simple, to be able to continue to do what we do, we want to create an album with and for the people who make Ignite The Fire possible. You. This album will be the culmination of everything Ignite The Fire is; the intensity, focus, drive and even quirkiness. We want to create an album that is a Thank-You letter to not only our fans, but fans of rock music.    
What We Need & What You Get
 The goal is to raise $6,000 to be able to get into the studio and record new music. The funds we raise will be used exclusively to record our new album.
We've put together some great perks that will be exclusive to our contributors. Each perk can be found to the right of your screen. They include Digital Downloads, a Signed Physical Copy of our New Album, Posters, Shirts, Hoodies, Custom Art, a Signed Acoustic Guitar, our Stage Banner, and an opportunity to get a matching tattoo with our guitarist Mike as well as many other great perks!
Shirts and Hoodies will feature this exclusive design created by our vocalist Jack:

   The Impact Ignite The Fire is fans of music making music for the fans. Your contribution not only goes towards us living our dream, but also us creating music that may help or inspire someone else. It may sound silly, but music impacts all of us in different ways. As stated in our mission, we want to create music that people can relate to that can also help express themselves as human beings. Musical expression is important to both those who create music and those who listen to it, that is why we want to make an album with and for you.

    Other Ways You Can Help By being our fan and friend, you help give us the inspiration we need to continue on our musical journey. If you can't make a monetary contribution, you can help by sharing this campaign with your friends and family on social media or out in the real world. Share our band page on facebook and help spread the word as much as you care. 

Thank You!
It takes one person to ignite the fire and many to keep it burning. Thank you for your continued support and friendship as we set out to begin this new album with you! From all of us in Ignite The Fire... Keep Rockin'!

story:
Sobre Mi...

  • Me llamo Martín soy estudiante de administración de empresas y música de la Universidad Javeriana pertenezco al movimiento católico Regnum Christi. Vivo en Bogotá. Me apasiona la música y he logrado componer un setlist de canciones para Dios.
  • Creo que es importante llevar a Dios a todas las personas, y considero que no hay mejor manera de hacerlo que a través de la música. Es por eso que quiero grabar mi disco y a través de él dar a conocer el amor de Dios. 

Lo que necesito 

  • La meta es recaudar 3000 dólares, de los cuales 1500 se irían a producción de las canciones, 1000 para las copias y 500 para el trabajo gráfico.

El impacto

  • Creo que el valor de este proyecto es contribuir a la evangelización y llevar a través de la música el amor de Dios a los demás y así mismo expresar nuestro amor hacia él.
  • el CD está pensado para que sean 10 canciones sobre adoración al Señor, veneración a la Virgen María y sobre los valores.

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Algunas personas no pueden colaborar, pero eso no significa que no puedan ayudar:

  • Les agradecería mucho que si no me pueden ayudar económicamente lo hagan a través de sus redes sociales y logremos sacar adelante este proyecto para Dios.
  • Recuerda usar las herramientas para compartir de Indiegogo.

¡Gracias!

story:
Dear collaborator,

You may know that I previously ran an Indiegogo crowdfunding campaign for the launch of my debut EP which hit its target and was released on Record Store Day 2015 with Soaring Magpie Records, produced by Will Angeloro:  https://saravian3.bandcamp.com/releases

It's been receiving a very enthusiastic response and I’ve earned the title of "fastest-selling local indie artist" at “Raves from the Grave” indie record store in Frome: http://ravesfromthegrave.com/

So... I am now daring to release my debut album on Record Store Day 2016 and invite you to join me on the journey as I can’t do this alone…

The Goal

Raise approx. £3000 to cover:

•production, recording & mastering

•Musicians

•CD & vinyl pressing

•Digital release

•Marketing

•Launch party

•Extra unseen costs

Why am I doing it and how can it serve the world?

Well, having suffered from long-term depression after my sister died in 1989, I understand the need and importance of music to lift us up, to get a higher perspective on things and help us move forward, so my intention for this album is to offer something beautiful, inspirational and exciting.  

If my message and/or music touches you and you feel to support this project, please CONTRIBUTE NOW in return for a whole host of gifts and/or perhaps let others who might be interested/benefit from what I am doing, know too.

Thanks for taking the time to read this - I look forward to meeting you (if I don't know you already!)

Sara X

PS: Massive thanks to John Wyatt for shooting the crowdfunder video!

story:
Okay Realists, the time for us to hit the road again has come!! We've had a hard end to 2015 with the loss of our touring van and trailer in an unfortunate turn of events.

We've got our funds together for a new set up but that leaves us with little tour budget to feed our van to get us to you and to keep us fed and alive on the road.

This holiday season we will have some special gift ideas for you, your friends and family to get you ready for 2016:Year of the Realist. We appreciate any amount, every thought and every shared post for this fundraiser.

**Please check out our perks! We love each and every one of you!**

story:
Short Summary

Love And Fear is a record that I was inspired to begin in 2011. Life took me down some paths I didn't expect and taught me a lot of lessons. I wanted make this record a lot sooner, but God had other plans for me. Five years later, the time has come.

I've written and demoed 13 songs that are ready to see light and be light for others. But making the record won't be easy. I and the musicians who are taking this on together--we need your help.

What We Need & What You Get

We've already scouted some viable recording spots for Love And Fear, and we've made some demos. But making a record is not quite that simple. When you join us by making a pledge, here is what you're funding:

  • Recording equipment (microphones, mastering tools, etc.)
  • Session musicians (for parts that aren't standard rock quartet stuff)
  • Merch (for the perks you'll get when you pledge, and for whomever we meet on the road)
We've been talking to some excellent session musicians and co-producers, and we're really excited about the talent that'll be going into making this record.

Everyone who pledges $10 or more gets an instant download of our first demo from the record, "Find You In The Light" (featuring my good friend Crystal Cummings for the band One Renown), as well as an advance download of Love And Fear when it's finished and ready to roll. Other perks will include t-shirts, posters, and more.

If you watched the promo video, that was "Find You In The Light." You have to contribute to download it, but you can listen to it at this link:

https://soundcloud.com/mnicholszero/findyouinth...

The Impact

Love And Fear was inspired by a time in my life when things we're very dark. Music was my therapy and my outlet. It had been for years prior, which is the real reason why I'm in music today. Christ showed Himself to me and brought hope through music and through the people who nurtured me into my life in music. A lot of times, having a song that shows you someone else in the world knows how you feel--sometimes that's all a person has. That's the whole point of Love And Fear: to show the world that when they're still loved even when the world is terrifying and crashing around them. We're not trying to be superstars, just to shine light in dark places.

Risks & Challenges

Straight up, we're not trying to be superstars, but to be successful in music, you need to be noticed, and being noticed in music isn't always easy. The industry is diverse and full of talent, but there are also fantastic musicians that the world doesn't even know exists. Point blank: that might be us. But we won't know until we've poured everything we have into this. And that's exactly what we're going to do.

Getting booked for shows, getting in touch with the right people, making connections with other musicians, and getting noticed will be the biggest challenges, but with your support and willingness to spread the word, we can make this happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can put money into this. We all know what that's like. ;) But the best way that you can help is by spreading the word to friends and family. We're on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram, so you can connect with us there.

All it would take is 500 pre-orders of Love And Fear to make this happen. That's 500 people pledging $10 to get an instant download of our "Find You in the Light" demo and an advance download of Love And Fear when it's finished. And the more we can raise, the more we can do.

So join the pledge if you can, and spread the word. It's all of us together. Let's do this! :)

story:
Short Summary


Le nom de notre groupe est Sundaram. Après avoir voyager en Inde pendant de nombreuses années, nous avons commencé à faire du chant de mantras en Sanskrit ici au Québec afin d’amener les gens de notre communauté, et nous-mêmes, à entrer dans un état de méditation, de joie et de paix. Depuis quelques années, ici à Val-David, tous les dimanches soirs, mais aussi dans divers centres de yoga à-travers le Québec à d’autres moments, nous organisons des soirées dans le cadre desquelles les gens sont invités à chanter avec nous.


(english to follow at the bottom)


What We Need & What You Get

Les gens nous demandent souvent si nous avons un album de disponible afin qu’ils écoutent notre musique à la maison, mais la réalisation d’un un tel projet demande des ressources financières importantes.

Nous aurons besoin minimalisent de 7000 $ pour réaliser ce projet:  2000$ pour imprimer les disques et pochettes, 3000$ pour la prise de son et l'édition, 1000$ pour le "mastering", et $1000 pour les 4 musiciens. 
 
7000$ est un montant minimal: nous espèrons de ramasser plus pour offrir un produit d'encore meilleure qualité, et de pouvoir mettre un peut dans la publicité et le diffusion.

Pour recevoir un album, lorsqu’il sera terminé, vous devez faire un donation de 20$ ou plus et cliquer sur un perks (ce sont des cadeaux bonus que vous choisissez avec les montants que vous decidez de donner).  
VOUS POUVEZ AUSSI DONNER LE MONTANT DE VOTRE CHOIX SANS L'OBLIGATION DE CHOISIR UN PERK.  JUST CLIQUEZ SUR LE BOUTON "BACK IT". 
ATTENTION: n'oubliez pas que si vous voulez l'album vous devez cliquer sur un perk.
;)  =)


The Impact

En chantant à chaque semaine, en compagnie d’une cinquantaine de personnes, nous recevons de nombreux témoignages de gens qui nous disent à quel point chanter leur fait du bien. Dans un monde aux prises avec tant de stress, il nous semble important de faire en sorte que les gens puissent avoir accès à de la musique facilitant la relaxation ainsi que la possibilité d’entrer dans un état de méditation et de joie: un état d'intériorisation et de présence à soi. Le mot mantra signifie d’ailleurs en sanskrit "libération du mental", et nous avons tous et toutes besoin d'apaiser le tourbillon des pensés, afin accéder à ce qu'il y'a au-delà.


Other Ways You Can Help

Tout les dons, peu importe le montant font une différence.  

Et s'il vous plait partagez si vous connaissez des gens qui, vous pensez, pourraient aimer ce genre de musique.

Merci de tout coeur!


Hari Om!

Voici un lien vers notre vidéo pour vous donner une idée de notre musique.

https://youtu.be/qquN4pLXZXw


English

Our band name is Sundaram.  Which in Sanskrit means beauty; and that is what we strive to create as we play music with these ancient mantras of India.  The word mantra means liberation from the mind, which is the effect of their repetition in these group singing sessions called kirtan.

Since four years now we have been gathering once a week to sing with our community.  We see everyone leaving open, peaceful, and happy at the end of the evening which is proof for us of the good that it does to people; and its an effect which we feel in ourselves as well.  

Often we're asked to make a new album, so now we're reaching out for your help to raise the funds necessary to provide this for everyone who would like to dive into this music of meditation and ecstatic joy.

All contributions help, and together we can gather enough funds to get this healing music to those awaiting, or interested, listeners.  For any donation bigger than 20$ you will receive the album when it is ready, by choosing a perk.  Although no perk is necessary: you can choose to give any amount you feel compelled to give.

And please feel free to help out by sharing this campaign with others!

thank you so much!


hari Om!

Ghostface Killah, is an American rapper and prominent member of the Wu-Tang Clan.  After the group achieved breakthrough success in the aftermath of Enter the Wu-Tang (36 Chambers), the members went on to pursue solo careers to varying levels of success. Ghostface Killah debuted his solo-career with Ironman in 1996, which was well received by music critics. He has continued his success over the following years with critically acclaimed albums such as Supreme Clientele (2000) and FishScale (2006). His stage name was taken from one of the characters in the 1979 kung fu film Mystery of Chessboxing. He is the founder of his own label Starks Enterprises.

Killah Priest, is an American rapper and Wu-Tang Clan affiliate who was raised in Bedford-Stuyvesant and Brownsville, Brooklyn. He is known for his intensely spiritual lyrics, containing religious references and metaphors. He is connected to the Black Hebrew Israelites through his rhymes, and is known for his controversial and political subject matter. He is also a part of supergroup the HRSMN along with Canibus, Ras Kass, and Kurupt.


Frequently Asked Questions

Q: I ordered a T-shirt, how do I submit my shirt size?
A: Submit your shirt size here.

Q: When do I get my order?
A: Please allow 4 to 5 weeks for delivery.  Orders made before February 24th can expect to see delivery around end of March.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt: Short Summary Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:  Introduce yourself and your background. Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you. Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.  Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?   What We Need & What You Get Break it down for folks in more detail:  Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.  Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited! Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.    The Impact Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:  Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world. Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one). Make it real for people and build trust.    Risks & Challenges  People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.  Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles. Describe your plan for solving these challenges.    Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:  Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign. Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!   And that's all there is to it.

story:
Who Am I

"Clif Payne is a lush tenor with soaring melismas in his individual passages."
Don Heckman, LA Times

I'm R&B/smooth jazz vocalist Clif Payne, and--Welcome To My World !

RELEASE DATE: February 9, 2016

Wednesday, Feb. 24--This morning, I received this message from CD Baby:

"CD Baby RESTOCK request for clifpayne / Welcome to My World
Clif-
Congratulations! Your music has been selling and we need more copies of Clif Payne: Welcome to My World to satisfy anticipated demand."

i.e. We sold out of the hardcopy CDs! Wow and Yeaaaaa! Thank so much for the overwhelming response domestically and abroad. You can still download the album. But we need to re-stock the "hardcopy" CDs to meet the increasing demand. I need your help, so I've started an Indiegogo campaign to ask for support to manufacture and distribute more hardcopy CDs of Welcome to My World. You've been so supportive and encouraging regarding my music. Now, here's your chance to be a part of the process of getting more CDs of WTMW to the masses. Preston Glass, Larry Batiste, Freda Payne and the entire "cast" of Welcome To My World--we are truly blown away by your response. It will absolutely help to make our day if you would lend me your continued support.--especially at this time. 

Thank you all so much! You are fantastique!

                                                                *   *   *

Born in Harlem, I now reside in the beautiful San Francisco Bay Area.  Since being "discovered" by Bobby McFerrin, I've performed internationally and have opened for Tony Bennett, Johnny Mathis and Dionne Warwick.  In my career, I've sung on many recordings.  But now, my own debut solo album--Welcome To My World-- is almost ready for release.  And, I just couldn't be more excited about it.  Here's why:

The Artists

Produced by Soul Music Hall of Fame inductee Preston Glass, the album features some of the finest  LA musicians in the world including original En Vogue singer Maxine Jones, Midnight Star co-founder Reggie Calloway, Grammy Awards show music director/producer Larry Batiste and a very special guest appearance by R&B/Jazz legend Freda Payne.


The Songs

on the album are written in the R&B/Jazz style--capitvating grooves  They are a musical mosaic of life and love seen through my view of the world--it's a reflection of who I am.  Eight of the 10 songs were written by Preston, Larry and myself.  The remaining 2 songs--well, I'll let that be a big surprise!  But the highlight of the album is my duet with the legendary R&B/Jazz vocalist Freda Payne on the song "No Payne, No Gain."

The Goal

Initially, the start of this project was delayed because of an accident I had during a performance in 2013.  I ripped off both knee caps in a jump from the stage into the audience.  What followed was nearly one year wheelchair-bound and many months of challenging physical therapy.  But, I'm back on my feet again, and I'm looking forward to achieving this project's goal of bridging the generations and reaching the masses with enduring and endearing music.  And, of course, reaching our pledge goal will go a long way towards making that possible.


The Recording & Mixing Phase . . .

of Welcome To My World  was completed in early January of this year at Laughing Tiger Studio in San Rafael, California and Private Island Audio in Los Angeles.  Ari Rios engineered the Laughing Tiger sessions and Adrian Ensor engineered the Private Audio sessions.  

Challenges & Risks

As you might expect, creating an album of music, manufacturing and releasing it to the masses takes quite a bit of planning, persistence, resources fan engagement and involvement.  Add to this the fact that the music business has changed dramatically over the past few years.  Gone are the days when a "record company" recorded, manufactured and released a disc.  Now, it is possible for an artist to completely control their music from songwriting to recording to release.  It's risky, though, because without fan support for manufacturing and distribution, a great album can end up just sitting on the shelve.  Add to that the ever-changing unpredictability of making music that lasts for generations and we've got quite a challenge.  Add to that the possibility of not reaching our financial goal.  The recording phase of Welcome To My World has ended, and there is a small amount left in the budget to get this next phase started.  But, getting this album to the masses on a grand global scale--that takes a Herculean effort.  I believe we can do this together and be successful.  Unlike the old days, you can be more involved in the process releasing of this album with me than ever before!  And, I welcome the opportunity to touch base with each of you!
 
How You Can Help & What You Will Get

We are now in the manufacturing, marketing & distribution phase.  This is where you can exert your much-needed impact.  Having personally contributed in the past to the crowdfunding musical projects of Victoria Theodore, Mark Little and Mike Blankenship, and seeing how successful it is possible to be with solid and engaging fan support, I understand just how important your contribution will be. 

Where does your money go?  Specifically:

  • The cost of manufacturing more CDs! (we've sold out!), pressing the album on  vinyl, hi-tech transferal to digital downloads and potential music re-mixes.  Estimate:  $4,000
  • The development and the implementation of a strategy to impact the airwaves, traditional media (newspaper, magazines, billboards) and retail outlets on a grand scale.  Advertising and getting radio airplay is extremely challenging and costly.  We would love to be able to promote the album on the airwaves at least 6 months.  Estimate: $3,000
  • CD Release/Listening Party in Los Angeles  Estimate:  $3,000
  • Basic hardcopy press kits (Fees / Postage / Materials)  Estimate: $2,000
  • Credit card and Indiegogo (Fees / Postage / Materials) Estimate:  $2,000
  • Perks production and shipment   Estimate:  $2,000
  • These are only estimates with the costs potentially being less than or more than the stated estimates.  And all of your money will go directly into this manufacturing, marketing & distribution phase of Welcome To My World.   
What Will You Get In Return?  You'll get a great album, of course, but you'll also get some cool perks--as you can see on the right side of this page.  Don't see a perk that peaks your interest?  Suggest one that does!  If you have any questions, just contact me at saangpayne@gmail.com.
More Ways You Can Help

With all that has been said here, we know that not everyone can make a monetary contribution, but that doesn't mean they can't help.  Here's how they can . . .

  • Send people to this Indiegogo page
  • Share this page on your Facebook page
  • Use Indiegogo tools to share this campaign
  • Email your friends and family around the world (this system works best)
  • Tell music magazines/websites/blogs/other relevant pro's about Welcome To My World
  • Tell all of your friends about Welcome To My World

Kudos . . .

to you for considering to lend your support to this dream project and help take it to the next level.  Yes, we'll keep you posted, updated on what's happening as you help to take Welcome To My World through this challenging but exciting next phase--manufacturing, marketing & distribution.  Kudos to all of you for your kind words of encouragement--not only during this project phase--but throughout my career. Many of you already know just how long I've been wanting to do my own album project.  There were times when I wondered if it would ever happen.  But, now it has, and I just can't thank you enough.  So I encourage you to do this with me.  It is personal, and it is mutual.  Let me hear from you;  give me your thoughts about this project and the process.  It is greatly needed and will be greatly appreciated. 

Much love to you all!  

Clif
clifpayne.org
saangpayne@gmail.com



-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

story:
Short Summary

It was only a few years ago that Jake and I met while playing in the Worcester, MA hardcore/metal band Vultures. Late last year that band went on what would become an indefinite hiatus. We looked at this as an opportunity to head in a new direction. A direction that while still bringing the same grit and intensity as before would be harder, faster and more melodic. With a little help from our friends we were able to demo a few songs and do a short winter tour. 

Now we need your help! We have already done the legwork and spent a few thousand dollars to get things rolling but recently, as some of you may have heard, we had a van accident. Fortunately no one was hurt but it did soak up the rest of our funds. After renting a truck and a trailer and towing our van and our gear back from Upstate New York we learned that the van was totaled. We barely covered the expenses and soon realized there was no way to get this music released.


What We Need & What You Get

Recently campaign fundraising of another kind has changed the way we look at the world here in America. Let's just say it. If Bernie Sanders, love him or hate him, can raise millions with a message to get money out of politics why can't we do the same with the music industry.

There have been many different approaches and fans of music are starting to understand this format, but it's lacking something. Bands and artists don't show you how the money gets spent.

We however, will show you how every dollar is spent and that making a top notch record comes at a price. Who knows, if we exceed our goal we may be able to do things we may have only dreamed about. Essentially, the success of this campaign will determine how amazing this record will become as well as how Nihil's future pans out. Extra money can mean a lot: more music, more tours, more fast, and more loud. We have designed this campaign to use Flex Funding. This means if we don't reach our goal, we are still getting the money that is raised. So, if we don't reach our goal, we will have to reevaluate how we are planning to do this record. Regardless, we are ready to deliver however our campaign plays out.


Exclusive Fundraiser Packages



Merchandise Previews!



The Impact

By taking part in this campaign you will become a part of inner circle and, in turn, you help  to change how we make music. Every time we've headed into the studio in the past, we've kept all the people who have supported this band in mind. The level of responsibility is so much higher this time.

With that in mind, we give you our word that we will not settle for “good enough” - we wont take any shortcuts, and above all – the money we raise in this thing will be reflected in the final product.

Let's do this!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially here are some other ways you can help...

Spread the word! Tell your family and friends. We don't expect everyone to be able to give so if you can't do it yourself let people know this is happening. By posting links to this page you are reaching places we would never be able to reach on our own.


Here is how it breaks down...

Here's a projected budget we've prepared to give you an idea as to how we've planned to allocate the funds. (Budget is based on reaching our goal).
Recording Budget

Expenses
Pre-Production $700

Studio Fees
Studio Time $3,000
Production $1,000
Engineer $1,300
Gear Rental $300
Tech Work $250
Session Fees $200

After Recording
Mixing Fees $1,000
Mastering ($50 per song) $450
Album Artwork $300
Exclusive Artwork $300
DIY Launch Video $500

Other Expenses
Travel $400
Accomodations
 $300

Grand Total
$10,000
Indie GoGo Fees (5%) -$500
Credit Card Fees (3%) -$300

Adjusted Gross
$9,200
Cost of Goods for Perks -$6,265
Studio Money $2,935





Remember, time is limited and these items are only available through our Indiegogo campaign!

story:
NEW PERK! SUPER LIMITED, AND EXCLUSIVELY FOR INDIEGOGO. 

This is The Anchor Ball Cap. Grab yours while they last.



INDIEGOGO VIDEOGO! #2

As we countdown to ATLAS, 

were gonna be shooting some behind the scenes videos.

Follow us to rehearsals, writing sessions,

shows, and other miscellany,

and help us reach our goal!

We are better together


I want Heaven here
in the middle of us,
exploding through the dark like a standoff
where You are our allegiance
You are the wilderness.



THE STORY

There’s something beautiful about art that evolves over time—that changes and matures as we unearth things about ourselves. Art that stretches and contracts with each new experience. 

  

Two years ago, The Anchor Collective gathered and did something it had never done before. We piled into cars and drove to Georgia and live-tracked our first project, The Homeward EP. To us, it represented a bridge between the worship music we were comfortable with and a new, unencumbered honesty we felt needed to exist in our music. The response was nothing short of amazing.

 


In the months to follow, we travelled all over our home state of Florida; playing our songs in coffee shops and warehouses, church buildings and living rooms and even a festival stage. We wanted to see if our music would coalesce regardless of context. To our relief it did, and we made some amazing friends and shared the stage with some incredibly talented artists.
And we also grew.
That year we grew as musicians, as friends, as humans. Naturally, our music grew with us. For the first time in a long time, we were writing songs we felt we should’ve been writing all along. Songs with weight and depth, that excavated our thoughts on life, love, God, rebirth, and our place in the Cosmos. 

 

 


So here we are! Ready to head back to the studio and track our VERY FIRST FULL LENGTH RECORD (!!!). We’ve titled it, ATLAS. 

We can’t contain our excitement.


WHERE YOU COME IN

Unlike The Homeward EP, we are looking to fund every step of the project. We are excited to be working with Jimmy Purchase, as well as  Josh Diaz from C&I Studios, with mastering by Mike Fuller. Our hope is to really dive into the recording process  head first, and that’s where we need you. 

We need to raise $5,900 to make this project happen. This money will go towards paying for studio time and equipment, mixing, mastering, as well as printing and distribution on numerous mediums. We want to create a record with the legs to reach as many people as possible. AGAIN. THIS RECORD CANNOT HAPPEN WITHOUT YOU.


In exchange for your support, we’d love to give you some personalized gifts we think you'll love:

-full digital recorded download
-Behind the Songs commentaries
-t shirts
-photo sessions, hand-written poems, lyric sheets,  the elusive "Mystery Instrument," and LOTS MORE.

Cliche as it seems, every little bit really helps.

 STRETCH GOAL
If we  are able to surpass our goal, all funds will go towards a 2017 tour to connect this project to as many people as possible 

WHY THIS RECORD IS IMPORTANT

This record is another bold step into our purpose as a band— to dwell as a microcommunity of artists, to the glory of our God and the good of our city. 

To cultivate music that is authentic and beautiful.
Music that is expansive and challenging, like buckets to the ocean.
Like grace itself.


OTHER WAYS TO HELP

Just because you can’t contribute to the record doesn’t mean you can’t help us. Share our link! Use the Indiegogo share tools to promote on social media, and use #TheAnchorCollective on Facebook, Twitter & Instagram.

We’d like to thank you so much in advance for your love and support. Truly, we are each other's keepers. 


Josh, Scott, Lizette, Chris, Israel & Adrian
The Anchor Collective

We want to create a record with the legs to reach as many people as possible. AGAIN. THIS RECORD CANNOT HAPPEN WITHOUT YOU.In exchange for your support, we’d love to give you some personalized gifts we think you'll love:-full digital recorded download-Behind the Songs commentaries-t shirts-photo sessions, hand-written poems, lyric sheets,  the elusive "Mystery Instrument," and LOTS MORE.Cliche as it seems, every little bit really helps. STRETCH GOALIf we  are able to surpass our goal, all funds will go towards a 2017 tour to connect this project to as many people as possible  WHY THIS RECORD IS IMPORTANTThis record is another bold step into our purpose as a band— to dwell as a microcommunity of artists, to the glory of our God and the good of our city. To cultivate music that is authentic and beautiful. Music that is expansive and challenging, like buckets to the ocean. Like grace itself.OTHER WAYS TO HELPJust because you can’t contribute to the record doesn’t mean you can’t help us. Share our link! Use the Indiegogo share tools to promote on social media, and use #TheAnchorCollective on Facebook, Twitter & Instagram.We’d like to thank you so much in advance for your love and support. Truly, we are each other's keepers. Josh, Scott, Lizette, Chris, Israel & AdrianThe Anchor Collective

story:
PROJECT OVERVIEW (what’s it all about)

This is a fund raising campaign asking you to pre-order my new 15 song CD.  There are many investment levels to choose from that include merchandise, tickets to the CD release party with VIP seating (fall of 2016), BONUS songs only available online, video clips of the actual studio recordings, an up and close personal concert with just me and my guitar, or my band performing live at a venue of your choice.  When you pre-order, you’ll be helping us get back in the studio to get the songs recorded, mixed and CDs manufactured.  The details of which I talk about in the BUDGET section below.  

BUDGET (what does it cost to record this CD?)

Typically, in this market recording costs can range between 1500.00 & 2,000.00 per song to record a CD and include the manufacturing of 1000 CD’s.  It helps to have done this before with the Foster Martin Band, so I have a good idea of costs.

I started pre-production for this project over a year ago.  Writing, recording rough demos which meant paying musicians and studio time.  Countless rehearsals with the band trying out songs that may or may not make the album.  Photo sessions, video recordings and editing, web site design, CD design, social media preparation and so on…..

So up until now, I’ve spent about 7000.00 slowly putting the final list together and now we’re ready.  15 brand new real country songs are ready to hit the studio, not to mention 3 BONUS songs already recorded,  and I believe we can finish it for about 7500.00.  That’s the pre-order fund raising target goal.  Last but not least, I would not be doing this project but for the grace of God, therefore a portion of all funds raised will be donated to a charity which supports the homeless.  My new CD will be called Real Country, so please "select a perk" and help us get this new album completed.  Thanks, Ray Martin

story:
Short Summary

We are sisters, Lauren and Brooke DeLeary. Together we are LoveCollide. "LoveCollide" is representative of the cross.  Where God's incredible love for us collided with our sin.  Once you collide with Jesus your life is changed forever.  We don't want that great LoveCollide to be simply a one day decision, but a daily collision with His love that changes not only your life but the world around you. We want to live boldly for Christ, resonating God’s love in everything we do. 

RES-O-NATE  (Rezn-at): produce or be filled with a deep, full, reverberating sound.  We want to personally be so filled with Jesus that our lives, filled with Him, reverberate into the lives of others and we want you to do the same. It starts with each of you. It starts with me - one person, one drop in the ocean. One drop creates the ripple, and It takes a ripple to start a wave, and a spark to start a flame.

These past few months, we had been working on a new 13 track album to reflect  this mission. The closer we got to completion, we realized with so many songs some of the messaging may be lost.  Our music is the vehicle God has given us to share His message.  It became clear that we were being directed to create a project that would reflect a life of resonating Jesus. So, we decided to split it up this project into two separate 8 or 9 track albums.

As we prayed and talked through this idea, we were sure we wanted the albums to be connected to each other. So, we would like to introduce to you RESONATE. "RESONATE: A Ripple to a Wave" & "RESONATE: A Spark Into a Flame".  It’s the same project just split up in two records. We want RESONATE to be more than just an album. We want it to be a way of life. Our mission is to reignite passion in Christ followers and awaken those who don’t know him. Splitting the album in two, creates a journey that extends through many months, giving us time to soak RESONATE in as a lifestyle. We are releasing "RESONATE: A Ripple To A Wave" at the end of April and "RESONATE: A Spark Into A Flame" 6 months after.

ONLY with God's blessing and your help will we be able to accomplish the task we feel God has set before us. 

What We Need & What You Get

Before the first CD release, we would like to release a music video and release one music video each month until the release of the second CD.  We want to create devotions based on each song and to create an atmosphere of learning to grow in our love and surrender to Jesus.

As independent artists it is not an easy task to produce such a large project and music videos and do it with excellence.  If something is worth doing, we believe it should be done with excellence for Him. We want to be able to market this project so it gets the attention it deserves.  We want to be able to promote a couple of these songs to radio to reach even more people with this message, but that is where we need your help.  It costs a lot of money to accomplish what we are trying to do.  After recording our last album and touring the past 18 months we were able to save and have invested all our profits back into this project, but we still don’t have what we need to accomplish our goals. 

Part of our platform is being real, transparent and authentic in everything we do. Here is the breakdown of some of the required costs.  If you want more specifics on how we developed the budget or exactly where the money is going please ask:

  • $30,000 - recording costs: producing, session musicians, programming, mixing, and mastering

  • $15,000 - 5 music videos

  • $5,000 - Radio promotion

  • $2,000 - Marketing (PR)

  • $4,000 - 1000 physical copies of each CD

  • $4,000 Promotional material - Photo shoot, branding, design, graphics for CD, website management and new merchandise

  • $500 - New RESONATE banner

  • $60,500 for both CD’s

  • We have put $15,000 into the project already. We need $45,000. We are asking for $15,000 through indiegogo and excited to see how God provides the rest.

  • We have put together exciting perks as extra incentive for you to partner with us and join the mission to RESONATE! Click the perk on the right that is right for you!  A few perks have limited amounts so don't wait!

The Impact

Your contribution is like supporting a mission trip or missionary.  As independent artists we can only produce music and share the message of the Gospel with your support!

Risks & Challenges

We have prayed fervently for this project and sought God's wisdom and His will.  We have full faith that this project will come to fruition.  If we do not get the funds we need, we will still move forward, but will have to cut back in quality, promotion, a delay in release and ultimately a decrease in the number of people we will be able to reach for Jesus. To overcome, we will continue to invest all we have into the project. We are booking shows and cutting corners any way we can personally.

Other Ways You Can Help

We totally understand some people just can't financially contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!  We know PRAYER is the most important component of this campaign and our ministry in general. We are still trusting Him to provide all the funds necessary.

  • Join us as prayer warriors asking God to supply all our needs.
  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Email, share and tell people you think would share the vision of our mission.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
For the past 20 years I have written and arranged live music for youth circus performances in partnership with iconic Youth Circus pioneer Jackie Davis, and also directors Sara Greene and Jonathan Roitman. Now the moment has come for me to finally (YES!) put all the best pieces down on an album for posterity, but more importantly to make them available for youth circus directors and educators to use freely as accompaniment for their live performances.

Currently, I am already in the process of recording this quintessential collection of music. These pieces are all tried and true works that have supported many solo and group acts on stage in the circus arts. From lively to lyrical, energetic to humorous, dramatic to endearing, the music comes alive with the many textured layers of fiddles, flutes, trombone, tuba, piano, percussion, drums, and more.

Please have a look at the video, explore this site, check out our unique perks (rewards) and seriously consider donating. Your generosity will help me to preserve and archive the music that has been loved and delighted in for many years by audience and artists alike in performances by Hilltop Circus, Flying Gravity Circus, Silver Lining Circus and the new Granite State Circus.  With your help it will be made available far and wide;  wherever original music is needed that is carefully crafted to play a crucial supportive role for young people in the circus arts.

Please donate if you can, and help us get the word out by sharing this link.

Thank you!

Leslie Vogel

story:
Hey Folks! A bit about us:

Jack Of The Ville is a heavy Southern Rock/Metal band from Nashville, TN. Lead singer, John Salmon, began putting the pieces together in December of 2013. Salmon’s brainchild, Jack Of The Ville, evolved quickly into a collaborative effort:  Guitarists Donovan Bettise & Thomas Banks, Bassist Nate Zensen, and drummer Wayne Michel. Just months after forming, JOTV played SXSW. A mixture of classic Guns N’ Roses licks & Rage Against The Machine influenced audacity, Jack Of The Ville shook a rooftop of 1,300 people. Since then, the band mates have played numerous shows around the Nashville area and released an EP in December of 2014, “The Fire On I-65,” available for stream at www.JackOfTheVille.com. 

We have come out of pocket roughly about $5,000, but need your help to finish our full length album, "Hogan's Goat". 

We have been writing this album for nearly two years and are so close to completion. Your help will mean the world to us, as many hours have gone into its creation. Your contribution will not only facilitate the album's completion, but also enable us to pay for top notch mastering, short run CD & Vinyl printing, and retain a reputable publicist and marketing team. 

  • Our funding goal is $7,500. 
  • $3,750 will go towards remaining studio time/daily expenses. 
  • $500 is the remaining balance for our album artwork!
  • Mastering will total roughly $2,000.
  • The remainder will go towards physical copies of the album (CD & Vinyl), and merchandise including: T-shirts, Stickers, Pins, Matchbooks, etc. 
  • We have a few really exciting and funny perks, including our drummer Wayne tattooing your initials on his a$$!
With your help we will be geared up and ready to tour this fall! Our ultimate goal has always been and will continue to be to get on the road and do what we love to do! 

 Help us get the word out there and let us bring back real, hard, Rock N' Roll! 

Thank you so much!!!
- Jack Of The Ville
John, Wayne, Dono, Thomas & Nate.

story:
Our Story

After 15 years in full-time ministry we, (the Jason Ellsworth Band) are preparing to release our fifth full length album.    
How is this one different?  We feel called to make this available at no cost to everyone. We are willing to give it away. Of course, this is a horrible business plan! But we were never out to get rich. We just want to help people encounter God.  We've already invested a significant amount to make this next project accessible to everyone.  But we need your help. 
If you have seen or experienced the impact that our ministry has had, you may want to join us in partnering financially to finish this project.

What We Need

$12,000 is a lot of money.  

We've taken care of the costs involved in recording this CD. But recording is only the first step in releasing an album.  

Once we're done tracking it, we have to send off our project to have it tweaked, mixed and mastered at Awestruck Studios.  Larry Gann (who worked with us on our last album) has worked with Elton John, The Backstreet Boys, Lit, John Rich (Lone Star, Big & Rich), Natalie Merchant, Kansas, Head East, Waterdeep, DreamWorks Records, DreamWorks Pictures, Paramount Pictures, and many more. Larry did an incredible job with our Overcome CD and we look forward to his artistic contribution  to this project.  In addition, there are graphic design, manufacturing costs as well as the cost of making the music available online at no cost.

 We've been amazed at how our music has been used to draw people into profound encounters with the Holy Spirit.   We are inviting you to partner with us in taking this music to thousands of new listeners. 

How you can help

  • You can pray with us. We need God's grace in very aspect of this endeavor.
  • You can give financially toward finishing and distributing this album.
  • You can help us get the word out about our campaign through social media and word-of-mouth.All financial contributions will be made to One Voice Ministries International. a not-for-profit ministry organization that oversees the translocal ministry of Jason Ellsworth.

story:
Welcome to the start of a new exciting production of the El Violin Latino series. The next chapter will be called “The Cuban Volume.”

When I arrived in New York in 1994 I developed a passion for traditional Latin American music, especially Cuban, Brazilian and Argentinean compositions. It all began with Johnny Almendras’s band Los Jovenes del Barrio which performed every week at Gonzales y Gonzales Club on Mercer St. in Greenwich Village.

Los Jovenes del Barrio played a modern variation of Cuban Charanga dance music. This tradition is maintained today by ‪the Orchestra Aragon, which was founded circa 1939 and was the roots for Cuba’s most famous Salsa Band Los Van Van.  This traditional music displayed  the importance of the violin in this music.

In addition to the central role of the violin, I was also fascinated musically and compositionally by the rhythms of the Afro-Cuban Batá drums. Jerome Goldschmidt, the bongo player with Jovenes del Barrio, introduced me to these rhythms. Johnny invited me to play violin with the band and I worked with them for 3 years straight.

I was so badly infected with the Cuban Charanga virus that I traveled to Cuban in 1998 to study with the violinists of the famous Cuban band, ‪Orquesta Aragón. I also studied piano with Chucho Valdez and Hilario Duran.

Soon after my trip to Cuba, I met Cuban poet Mappy Torres at the famous Nuyorican Poets Café. She poetically sang the praises of the violin in Latin Music during a guajira (theatrical Cuban music) while I accompanied her on my violin. During this session the idea for the original EL VIOLIN LATINO project took seed.

In 2010 the first El Violin Latino CD was released. In 2015 with crowd sourcing help I produced the second Volume.

All of you who helped create my second album El Violin Latino - Vol. 2 know about this process and stood beside me during all the excitement and hard work of this journey.

Since I recorded both CDs with a mix of Cuban, Argentinean and Brazilian music I would love to focus now on the music of each country more closely. I plan to release several more volumes,  starting with the music of Cuba.

I would love to invite some special guests to this recording including Edmar Castaneda on the harp, John Benitez on bass and the singer Yumaria from Curaçao.

In the world of music today the actual production is very important but the promotion of an album is equally important. As a musician of my generation you have to learn this the hard way and I think I did. My previous Indiegogo campaign was a great success, in terms of funding the project, as well as promoting it. This time I would love to use some funds to hire a publicist who is familiar with this field of Latin music and Jazz to get El Violin Latino to the next level of recognition.

After the release of the last album, we had amazing concerts and sold out shows in the US and in Europe. My music is played on the radio around the world from Australia to Japan, all over Europe, South America, Canada and the US. El Violin Latino has become a trademark!

I invite you to join El Violin Latino on our next journey to Cuba. I am very happy that I am able to play with my son Ysai and hopefully my daughter Naima will soon join us as well.

If you are already a part of the El Violin Latino family and have enjoyed my last productions please help me again to make this happen or become a new El Violin Latino member and enjoy the music of Cuba mixed with Jazz.
