In 2015 with crowd sourcing help I produced the second Volume.All of you who helped create my second album El Violin Latino - Vol. 2 know about this process and stood beside me during all the excitement and hard work of this journey.Since I recorded both CDs with a mix of Cuban, Argentinean and Brazilian music I would love to focus now on the music of each country more closely. I plan to release several more volumes,  starting with the music of Cuba.I would love to invite some special guests to this recording including Edmar Castaneda on the harp, John Benitez on bass and the singer Yumaria from Curaçao.In the world of music today the actual production is very important but the promotion of an album is equally important. As a musician of my generation you have to learn this the hard way and I think I did. My previous Indiegogo campaign was a great success, in terms of funding the project, as well as promoting it. This time I would love to use some funds to hire a publicist who is familiar with this field of Latin music and Jazz to get El Violin Latino to the next level of recognition.After the release of the last album, we had amazing concerts and sold out shows in the US and in Europe. My music is played on the radio around the world from Australia to Japan, all over Europe, South America, Canada and the US. El Violin Latino has become a trademark!I invite you to join El Violin Latino on our next journey to Cuba. I am very happy that I am able to play with my son Ysai and hopefully my daughter Naima will soon join us as well.If you are already a part of the El Violin Latino family and have enjoyed my last productions please help me again to make this happen or become a new El Violin Latino member and enjoy the music of Cuba mixed with Jazz.

story:
(Video Previews coming soon!)

Hello!

I am Akashi and I am a singer-songwriter and composer in Japan. I am originally from Australia and have also lived in Canada so I would consider myself a Third-Culture-Kid, not defined by any ethnicity, nationality, or any one specific culture, but a unique blend of cultures. From this position, I hope to become an artist in Japan in order to become one of the many cultural bridges of the world to unite people of different countries through the common experience of music. As someone who has also experienced racism and abuse in some forms, I also hope to use music to support those who may feel broken and alone, to somehow give strength to those who are facing difficulties.

初めまして！アカシと申します。日本の東京と神奈川辺りで活動しているシンガーソングライター・コンポーザーです。カナダから引っ越してきましたが元々オーストラリアの出身で、どこの国の人かを聞かれたら本当に答えられませんのでTCK（サードカルチャーキッド）と思ってください。TCKというのは国籍と文化が色々混ぜている世界的な市民ってことです。この立場で日本でアーティストになることを目指し、音楽を通して世界の人々をつなげるために一つの文化的な橋になりたいです。僕は昔色々差別やいじめも経験したことがあって、音楽を通して落ち込んでる人や差別されてる人々の味方になりたいです。音楽には力があると思いますので、その力を使って苦しい時を超える力をどうかあげたいのです。

Please check out my website at https://www.ZeroToHiro.com

よかったら僕のサイトをチェックしてくださいね、https://www.ZeroToHiro.com

There you can preview some of the songs that might make it onto the EP in their amateur quality conditions!

そこでこのEPに出る曲のプレビューを聞くことができます。

Please also follow me on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram on

http://www.facebook.com/Akashi.Music

http://www.twitter.com/Akashi_RedDeath

http://www.instagram.com/Akashi.Tokyo

以上のフェースブック、ツイッター、インスタグラムとパトリオンサイトでフォローしてください。

To have a listen at some of the tracks as previews, please check out this page. You can also hear the full streams of the draft versions of two tracks in this EP for some fun insight into the writing process. https://www.zerotohiro.com/music

以上のページでこのEPに入ってる２つのトラックのドラフトを全体的に聞くことが可能です。作曲作りプロセスを少し見れますので面白いと思います。

A little more about me?

The genre I like to write in is, for lack of a better term, "Emo" Alternative Rock with symphonic elements. My favourite bands are: Nano, Shunn, My Chemical Romance, Panic! At the Disco.
I'm an avid gamer. My favourite titles are the Nier series, the Persona series, and the Zelda series to name just a few. Playing these games influence me when I compose orchestral music, but that's separate to being a singer-songwriter.

僕の一番好きなジャンルはエモっていうロックのサブジャンルです。同時にオーケストラ系ゲームBGM音楽も好きなので、僕の曲にはエモもロックもオーケストラの影響もあります。一番好きなバンドは日本でいうとナノとShunnで、アメリカというとMy Chemical RomanceとPanic! at the Discoです。

趣味はビデオゲームで、一番好きなシリーズはニーアとペルソナとゼルダ伝説です。

The Gist

I have decided to run this campaign because, in my preparation for making this EP, I have been learning a lot about how difficult this process can be, both in energy but also financially. In order to become a sustainable artist, one needs to balance a variety of things including marketing, distribution, fan-interaction, etc. however, nothing can begin until the artist moves past the bottleneck which is the production of the first CD. With a product in circulation, the artist is able to more freely work on all the other important things that need to be done to progress in his or her career. Therefore, this campaign is important to me because it is my first major step to becoming an artist here and to be able to cover some of the expenses of producing a debut EP will help us greatly, and once it is done, the bottleneck is overcome and I will be more free to engage in many more exciting activities.

このキャンペーンを作ろうとした理由は、EPを準備する中で色々な難しさがあってサポートが必要だからです。特にエージェンシーから独立したアーティストになるには大変お金がかかるので、難しいです。その上に普通ならエージェンシーがやってくれることが色々あって（マーケティング、流通、プロデュース、などなど）、すべてが自分でやらなければなりません。でも、もちろん最初にやらないと何もできないなのは売れるクオリティのCDを作ることです。僕のアーティストとしての最初の一歩ですので、このキャンペーンはすごく大事です。この最初のEPを作ることができたら他のアーティスト活動をはじめるとして色々な扉が開くと思うので、よろしければサポートをしてください。

My artist name is Akashi, which can mean many things, but my real name is Hiro. My website is called ZeroToHiro. I have chosen this name because at this very moment, I am literally a Zero. However, with your help right now in supporting my first great step on the journey, I will move towards the goal of becoming Hiro; to move toward becoming my "true self", in other words, the "me" that I am meant to be", the "me" of the future.

アーティスト名意味の多くあるアカシですが、本名はヒロです。サイトはゼロトゥーヒロといいます。どういう意味かというと、僕は今のところはでまだ「ゼロ」で誰にも知られていないけど、いつか必ず「ヒロ」として本当の自分になるんだということです。

What We Need & What You Get

In order to create the first EP, I need $2000 USD in order to professionally produce just 4 songs. This price includes hiring of musicians to play for the recording, a professional mixer and recording engineer, and many other things.

最初のEPを作るために、4曲で約20万円が必要です。この値段はミュージシャンやレコーディング、ミックスのエンジニアへのギャラなどで、それでもぎりぎりの予算なのです。

In addition to the $2000, I require new photos for this project which brings the budget up higher. If you have been following me for a while you may notice I have used the same photos for 6 years now. While they are great, I do need a revamp of my image to suit my style as a singer-songwriter. As a result, a photographer is also required and budgeted. I am also continually taking vocal lessons to ensure that the quality of my work will always be improving.

さらにフォトシュートなども必要です。これまでフォローしてくれた方は気づいていると思いますが、僕が今使っている写真は6年前の写真なので、今の新しいイメージの写真が必要なのです。また歌のクオリティをもっともっと上げるためにボーカルレッスンを受け続く必要があります。

Here is a rough breakdown:

以下は必要な費用の一覧：

Mixing and Recording: $250 per song

ミックスと録音：1曲で2.5万円

Hiring an instrumentalist: $100 per instrument, per song.

ミュージシャンへのギャラ：１楽器、1曲で1万円

Recording Director: $60 per day

レコーディングディレクター：1日で6千円

CD Manufacturing: Still Unknown
Digital Distribution: Still Unkown
Physical Distribution: Still Unknown

CD制作、デジタル配信、流通などいついてはまだはっきりしません

Photographer: Between $500 to $1200 depending on the Photographer and Quality

フォトグラファーは腕によりますが5万円から12万円くらいです。

And these are all at negotiated prices, to give you an indication of how much it costs to make a CD.

普通はもっと高いようですが、なんとかお願いしてこれくらいに収まるようにしようと考えています。

At this point I am aiming to cut costs by doing the graphic design myself.

好きだしコストカットにもなるので、グラフィックデザインは多分自分でやります。

If I can reach beyond $2000, I might be able to add more songs and still finish the EP in the projected deadline.

この予算で4曲入れられますが、20万円を超えることができれば曲をもっと入れられる可能性があります。

I have set the final goal as $6000 because I do not intend to make an EP and retire, I intend to work hard to keep making more and more music. I hope to make a full Album at the end of next year and while 4 tracks cost $2000, I imagine 12 tracks will be much more costly. In this way, it would really help to have a headstart with that funding.

ゴールは50万円にした理由は、このEPを完成した後に活動が終わるわけではなくて、そこからフルアルバムを作るために準備したいからです。4曲で20万円でしたらきっと12曲はそれよりもっと高いと思いますので、サポートしてもらえたらすごくありがたいです！

If the goal is not reached, I am still going ahead with the EP project so rest assured that 100% of the funds will go toward either the EP or future music endeavours.

ゴールに届かなくてもEPは必ず作りますので安心してください。お金はすべて音楽の活動のために使います。

Perks!

It is difficult to post CDs internationally from Japan. Japan Post seems to have quoted the postage to Australia as $23 Australian dollars, however, I suspect this is incorrect. I have therefore put the shipping as $3 USD for now. Because of this, backers who wish to acquire my EP will receive a digital copy unless I discover a cheaper way to get the physical discs overseas. Backers in Japan have the option to get the physical CDs. Shipping updates will be provided via comments.

(Prices are based on average price of songs on iTunes Japan [250 yen per song / Approx $2.5 USD])

日本から海外にCDを送るのは結構高くつきます。オーストラリアに送ろうとしたら2千円ぐらいらしいらしいですのでオーストラリアやカナダなどにいらっしゃる方々ならデジタルの方がいいかもしれません。2千円ではないはずだと思いますのでとりあえず3ドルにしました。送料について新しい情報がきましたらアップデートタッブでお知らせ致します。

Risks & Challenges

The challenge for reaching this goal is the risk that working as an artist does not turn out to be sustainable after a period of time. However, in my time here in Japan, I have many people I can count on to help guide me through, as well as some international musician friends who have also come close to the edge but have overcome their own obstacles. I believe that as long as I persevere and work hard, there is always hope. Additionally, no matter what happens, I will never cease to keep doing all I can to improve my own music skills, and as such, if I ever were to fall, I will keep coming back up stronger and stronger, making greater music every time until it is great enough to become something big. I aim not to do this for my own sake, but I truly want to contribute to the progress of humanity and for the harmony of the world as best I can.

リスクとしては、最終的にアーティストになれないかもしれないということですが、僕には日本に来てたくさんの優しいサポートしてくれる友達や音楽関係の知り合いができたので、どうしてもアーテイストになるまで一所懸命頑張ります。諦めずに頑張れば、どんなに難しくてもゴールが消えないので希望を持てると思います。僕の目的は自分を有名にすることではなく、もっと世界の人に届くような音楽を使って世界のハーモニーと人類の進化に少しでも貢献することです。

Other Ways You Can Help

Contributing financially would really help me out, however, sometimes it is difficult to contribute in this way. For people who are in situations like this, there are other ways you can help. The best way is to share this page or to get the word out about my journey and to keep supporting me as I strive forward. 

もちろんお金でサポートできない人もいると思います。もしそうであれば他のサポートする方法があります。よかったらこのページと、僕のSNSページをお友達にシェアしてください。大きな助けになります。

どうぞよろしくお願いいたします！

 

At the moment, the most up to date activities and announcements can be found at http://www.facebook.com/Akashi.Music please click like to follow!
or check out https://www.zerotohiro.com/music for short previews of some tracks coming in the future :)

story:
What Your Contribution Pays For:

-Physical pressing of the CD

-Promotional materials and radio play (so I'm not just playing this album to myself)

-Stickers and other physical merch

What You Can Do Instead Of/ In Addition to Contribution:

-Tell your friends. I really can't stress enough how well a friend recommendation goes in creating a fan. You guys are the only thing that keeps me going in the darkest days of my creation, and all it takes is a couple seconds telling someone you know.

- Let me know how you're feeling about the music. As I said, you guys are my lifeline. Without hearing from you or your dollars, I feel like I'm creating music in a vacuum, Your feedback means the world to me.

What This Album Means To Me:

This album bares my heart and soul for the past couple years. The good, bad, and ugly of my life can all be found within the lyrics and notes of this album. I'm trying to give the world a part of me and you can help make that a reality. This is my attempt at making the world a better place. This is me reaching out a hand to those who may be struggling. You can make my voice heard. You can help others.

story:
guys... i need some money

tomweeksmusic.com tomweeksmusic.com tomweeksmusic.com tomweeksmusic.com tomweeksmusic.com tomweeksmusic.com tomweeksmusic.com tomweeksmusic.com

 

My fellow Americans, legendary* iconoclast** saxophonist and composer Tom Weeks (me) is completely broke and desperate.

Just got a truly radical life-changing*** opportunity to go over to St. Pete's Burg (russia, not florida) to get into some real-ass composition talk with a select few of my fellow tier-one elite classical music operatives. Its like rainbow 6 only there's only gonna be 5 of us, and we're just gonna be goofin' around.

We're talkin:

resident ensemble: MolOt Ensemble https://www.molotensemble.org/international-mas...

guest composers: Alexander Knaifel (St. Petersburg, Russia) and Helena Tulve (Tallinn, Estonia).

​ (hell yeah)

 

I'm gonna write a piece (probably piano trio) for this ensemble, and they're going to perform it in concert, and its going to rule and the USA is going to win again. I guarantee it.

 

I've been burning the candle at both ends and I still don't have the money to pay for these damn plane tickets. I need some damn help, damn it.

 

Every bit helps.

 

$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$

story:
Franz Kafka Ensemble are: Damir Prica Kafka, Igor Pavlica, Bruno Vorberger, Franjo Glusac, Ivan Marincel and Roko Crnic. Three-year quest for sound that would resonate with our souls resulted in this material which we finally present to the world, on vinyl and cd.

Franz Kafka Ensemble su: Damir Prica Kafka, Igor Pavlica, Bruno Vorberger, Franjo Glušac, Ivan Marincel i Roko Crnić. Trogodišnja potraga za zvukom koji bi zatitrao naše duše je rezultirala ovim materijalom koji napokon predstavljamo svijetu, na vinilu i cd-u.

For this we need your HELP. How?

Za to trebamo vašu POMOĆ. Kako?

So far, we collected two thirds of funds needed for realization of this project through national Ministry of Culture funds, our record label Dirty Old Label, and our personal savings. Costs involve completion of all parts of the process: recording, mixing, mastering and vinyl and cds printing. We need to raise 1500 $ more through this crowdfunding campaign to finish the process, and this is where you can help us, in a following way.

Do sad smo prikupili dvije trećine sredstava potrebnih za troškove snimanja, miksanja, masteringa i tiskanja vinila i cd-a ovog albuma kroz sredstva Ministarstva kulture Republike Hrvatske, te sudjelovanjem našeg izdavača Dirty Old  Label u troškovima izdavanja albuma, i kroz naše ušteđevine. Trebamo prikupiti još 1500 USD za dovršenje procesa, a tu nam vi možete pomoći, i to na sljedeći način.

By preordering the album on vinyl, or vinyl which comes along with the cd inserted, or cd alone, you reserve yourself a copy of this great album, and help us gather the funds needed for completion of album release, for a price listed in perks.

Prednarudžbom vinila na kojem se nalazi ovaj album, ili vinila koji dolazi zajedno s cd-om, ili cd-a samostalno osiguravate sebi primjerak ovog odličnog albuma, a nama sredstva za dovršenje projekta njegovog izdavanja, po cijeni navedenoj u perkovima.

 

In which other ways can you SUPPORT our crowdfunding campaign?

Na koje još načine možete možete PODRŽATI našu crowdfunding kampanju?

  • By sharing information about it, simply visit our Facebook page (Franz Kafka Ensemble) and share our status about our crowdfunding campaign so your friends and acquaintances can see it, and SUPPORT the campaign
  • All other ways of communicating information about the campaign to your friends and acquaintances who would like to SUPPORT our campaign in any way

 

  • Dijeljenjem informacija o njoj – posjetite našu Facebook stranicu (Franz Kafka Ensemble), i podijelite našu obavijest o crowdfunding kampanji kako bi je Vaši prijatelji i poznanici mogli vidjeti, te je PODRŽATI.
  • Bilo kakvom drugom vrstom obavijesti Vašim prijateljima i poznanicima koji bi se na bilo koji način htjeli PODRŽATI našu kampanju.

 

Thank you sincerely for all the attention and help you have shown
for our crowdfunding campaign!

Iskreno vam hvala na svoj pažnji i pomoći koju ste posvetili ovoj crowdfunding kampanji!

story:
Short Summary

Have you ever sang in the shower and sounded flawless? Perhaps you have a favorite spot in your daily commute where you ears perk up to the sounds of the city, be it the sound of the subway or a cicada. 

My name is Nani FM and I am a NYC based musician. I have lived in Brooklyn and Staten Island, NY for the past 7 years. I conceptualized this project as a way to showcase and explore spaces with naturally amazing sound qualities. I picked places that are only open to the public, so that the listener could experience these recordings and then later explore the spaces for themselves. Living in Staten Island for the past several years, I have found many places where I adore the sound qualities and I am excited to have this project show off some of these spaces in NYC's "forgotten borough." 

These recordings have taken over a year to finalize and have been a wonderfully beautiful process. Each person involved has expressed genuinely that it has been a project unlike any other. 

It's very important for the sake of the recordings and the conceptual use of space as a soundscape that this project is finalized on vinyl. The listener should experience these songs and recordings in two very different mindsets and this is best achieved through the physical act of flipping a vinyl record. Additionally, the preservation of these recordings will stand the test of time on a vinyl recording much better than any other form of media available. 

I have received partial funding for this project from Staten Island Arts and the NYC Department of Cultural Affairs. The only remaining cost is the vinyl pressing. 

I am a third year NYC Department of Cultural Affairs grant recipient and was awarded the Excellence in the Arts from Staten Island Arts in 2015 for songs I recorded in people's homes around the world, from Atlanta to the Middle East.

This project is not-for-profit and with every contribution of $20 or more, a final pressing of this vinyl will be delivered. I hope to see this project finalized by December 16, where I will present the final work at the Newhouse Museum of Contemporary Art in Staten Island, NY. Any funding that exceeds the requested amount will go to Snug Harbor Cultural Center of Staten Island for their help and collaboration on this project.  

Special thanks to Brandon Herman for the amazing video of this project and to Megan Leach for the album art. 

Thank you so much for any support you can give. Even if you can't contribute in dollars please share this project on your social networks.

story:
YOUTH PHILCHARMONIC ORCHESTRA BORISLAV PAŠĆAN (since 1978)

We are young musicians, students between 14 and 22, gathered around the idea that one day we will  play in some of the great orchestras in Serbia or the world.

Our orchestra is non profit.We play out of pleasure with passion and love for classical music.

In a beautiful ambience on the Danube bank in Golubac Fortress complex will be organized a music camp and an open-air concert between August 21st-26th, 2017.

Professional orchestral musicians from Belgrade Philharmonic Orchestra and National opera  will hold master classes during the camp and share their knowledge and experience with us free of charge.

What We Need ?

- We need money for covering costs for 7 days of accommodation and meals for 50 young musicians in hotel Golubački grad

Other costs  (participants and instrument transport, sound and light equipment, stage for orchestra) are covered.

If we obtain less then 3000$, we will be forced to reduce duration of the camp and cancel some of the masterclasses.

The final concert on August 26th, 2017 will be certainly held!

story:
I suppose like most singers/musicians talking about 'your work' is always a bit complicated.I love to sing.....and I love to interpret others work,be they song,poem or prose,quite like an actor does a script and since last year I have taking to writing some of my own songs....so a definite second album in the making.But first things first,as they say.

This album was my first step into the recording arena,I enjoyed it largely to the relaxed approach of Martin O Malley in Miltown Malbay,who I am very grateful to.

Thank you all for your support

LET THE MUSIC KEEP YER SPIRITS HIGH

Davog

 

Davóg Rynne was born into the Moore and Rynne musical/artistic family at the end of the 60’s. He grew up with the sounds of Liam Óg’s early morning tuning in the basement of Downing’s house, where his father was born and where Planxty made their first album. Miltown Malbay became the family home in the late 70’s. Willie Clancy, the bodhran and the penknife, teenage roadie for Moving Hearts, Abbey Actor, Borstal Boy in the Gaiety. Davóg left Ireland in the early 90’s, worked as a Stage Manager/Roadie for over twenty years – before returning to the roots of folk songs, poetry and theatre.

"Davóg Rynne's first gig in Dublin at the Cobblestone was just a Tour De Force......from Co Clare Davóg,who is now living in France but surprisingly his first gig in Dublin - outside of Ballyboughal, that is!

A Singer / Songwriter, Musician and lovely interpreter of Poetry from the likes of his friends Senan Lillis, Denis Kelleher, his brother Donnacha Rynne, Frank Callery, and others to boot.

I could have photographed him all night with his ever changing - in split seconds - mood and stares into the audience...finally an Irish performer that keeps his eyes open during his performance of so many songs!"

Colm Keating - Photographer

 

All contributions will pay for the recording,printing and distribution of the album

story:
What is NUMUS and why should I support it?

NUMUS has been presenting contemporary music for the past 30 years in Waterloo Region. We have commissioned many new works (and we commission more woman composers than any other organization in Canada) and have worked with hundreds of Canadian and International composers and performers. We are an important platform in our region for emerging artists.

Through this fundraising campaign, help us put on 10 concerts next season, employ 30 musicians, and utilize 7 local venues. 

Community outreach is incredibly important to us - we have initiated several great opportunities for young artists such as:

  • An annual Emerging Improviser competition
  • Our new Emerging Composer Contest
  • Our new Student Curator Contest (with the winner presenting their own concert in NUMUS' series)

Opportunities like these are incredibly important for young artists and go a long way towards fostering young careers.

This campaign is important to us. We want to provide even more opportunities for young artists, we want to increase the number and size of concerts we offer each year, and we want to bring the best contemporary music to Kitchener-Waterloo on a regular basis. Without NUMUS, the local contemporary music scene will be largely nonexistent. Help us to grow and and present the most cutting edge music in your community. Our community thrives when its arts and culture thrives!

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $5,000 through crowd funding. This money would go straight into programming costs for next season. As we are currently in the middle of booking our 2016-2017 concerts, a boost in funding from this campaign could change things quite dramatically for us - allowing us to expand the budget for next season and offer bigger and better shows. But we don't expect you to contribute for nothing - we have lots of perks!

  • Get NUMUS merch with your contributions!
  • Get admission to our events!
  • Get the opportunity to meet and greet our artists!

What We Do in the Community

NUMUS expands upon our rich culture of contemporary art that our region has become known for. We intentionally present and produce concerts and events that represent and appeal to a wide variety of individuals. The events we present and produce enhance the arts and culture in the Region greatly because we are the only seasonal presenter of contemporary music in the Region of Waterloo. We're also all about young musicians and emerging artists and reaching out to the community. We program up-and-coming artists in our MIX series and we offer at-risk youth complimentary tickets to our productions via Big Brothers Big Sisters of Canada.

Your contributions will make a difference in many different ways

  • We will be able to employ many people in the region and beyond: musicians, tech staff, graphic designers, administrative staff, students, and we'll be supporting local venues too.
  • We can continue our many outreach activities that directly benefit young artists such as our young composer contest, our student curator contest, and our young improviser contest.
  • You'll help to ensure that NUMUS continues to be recognized as one of the foremost presenters/producers of contemporary music in Canada.
  • You'll help us bring world-renowned artists and ensembles to our community of Kitchener-Waterloo, exposing our residents to phenomenal productions without having to leave the city.
  • You'll be directly funding arts and culture in your community.

Risks & Challenges

Some of the funding we've come to depend on over the years has recently been cut. We need to find new ways of making our organization viable and we've come a long way in doing this over the past year. We've even eliminated our deficit! We have secured sponsorships from businesses in the community and we've unlocked new sources of support locally. We're now stable as an organization but we want to expand upon the past few years and offer our community more. Budget cuts made us take a few steps back, but we've recovered and now want to push forward.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share our concert listings and announcements when you see them on social media! See more at: www.numus.on.ca
  • Ask your friends and contacts to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!
  • Remind your friends to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
The Eastern Music Festival is a summer music program for students all over the world who are looking to gain experience playing in an orchestra and further their knowledge of music. It is a five week festival, beginning on June 27, that includes weekly student and faculty orchestra concerts, masterclasses, chamber music, private lessons, and music classes. Many famous musicians have studied at EMF, such as Wynton and Branford Marsalis. I am so excited to have been accepted to the festival as one of nine flute players from all over the country!

This is an amazing opportunity that I could not pass up! There is just one problem: the cost of the festival is $5,600, not including the transportation costs! Ever since I found out that I was accepted in late March, I've been working extra jobs to try to cover the cost. It's not easy to raise over $5,000 in 2 months as a full time student! I received some scholarship from my audition and I am earning money through work study, as I was hired as the festival's student photographer. I also received grant money toward the cost of the festival! After all of that, I am still left with a hefty amount to pay, and a $570 flight.

So, I am creating this campaign to raise $500 with the hopes of putting it toward the cost of my flight! Any amount that you are willing to donate is a huge help for me and I greatly appreciate it! I cannot thank you enough!! 

As the festival goes on, I will be updating the indiegogo campaign page with photos and anecdotes from the festival to keep you updated and involved. For more information about the festival, feel free to visit  http://easternmusicfestival.org/study/orchestra

Lastly, please view the perks that you can receive from donating! I am excited to offer you some downloads of my recordings! Also, every higher perk includes the perks beneath it. For example if you donate $15, you will receive the download as well as the postcard. And you can choose to donate any amount- it does not have to be one of the amounts associated with a perk. Thank you for your time and interest in my campaign!

story:
Phoenix Conservatory of Music's Music is Life College Preparatory Program offers DYNAMIC and ENGAGING Music Education Programming.

Phoenix Conservatory of Music (PCM) is a 501(c)3 non profit organization with a mission to provide quality music education that is affordable and accessible. Many students receive full scholarships to participate in our programs.

Our College Preparatory Program is a partnership with the Berklee City Music Network, a consortium of community organizations across the country. This partnership allows us to offer an exciting college preparatory curriculum that harnesses the energy of contemporary music to provide music education to 4th through 12th graders in underserved communities. 

Participating Music is Life College Preparatory Students Receive:

  • Weekly music ensemble instruction
  • Music theory instruction, assistance with college interviewing and audition recording, and extra-curricular classes in music production, music business and audio recording
  • Opportunities for scholarships for private lesson instruction for qualifying students
  • Opportunities to attend to the Berklee College of Music 5-Week Summer programs
  • Frequent performance opportunities in a variety of venues
  • Connection to local professional musicians, teachers, and to a vast network of musical peers

Our Impact:

Participation in musical ensembles and other classes helps students to develop a sense of teamwork and collaboration, improve critical thinking and problem solving skills, develop creativity, improve spatial, linear, and non-linear reasoning, and so much more.  Beyond any benefits in individual development, music is a vital part of our society and our local and global communities.  It brings people together and offers an undefinable tool for expressing feelings, trends, and thoughts of our times.  

Innumerable studies show that practicing and performing music may help students’ cognitive development and stimulate connections in the brain associated with creativity, decision-making, complex memory. Music is also linked in the improvement of a student’s ability to process conflicting information from many senses at once and in the development of brain areas associated with language and executive function.  

In addition to offering musical education to communities that often cannot access high quality programs otherwise, PCM advocates for arts and music funding in schools and local communities. We partner with local schools and other organizations in order to expose more young people to the joys of music.  

Through the years hundreds of students have been involved with our college preparatory programs.  So, don't just take our word for it! Watch our video for our students' testimonials and hear about the impact that music has had on their lives.  

More About Our Impact:

  • Last year, 12 of our graduating seniors received a total of $350,000 worth of scholarship offers to attend colleges and universities across the country.
  • This year, two graduating seniors received full scholarships to the Berklee College of Music, and 10 others received scholarship awards to attend Arizona colleges and other universities around the country. 
  • As part of the Berklee City Music conference in 2014, PCM students were able to perform in a jam session with world-renowned guitarist Kevin Eubanks, learn from other music professionals, and participate in multiple performance opportunities.
  • Students engaging in our College Preparatory ensembles receive discounted and free concert admission to local venues such as Orpheum Theater, The Musical Instrument Museum, The Nash (the performance and education home of Jazz in AZ), local festivals, and more.
  • Students are connected to a network of local professionals for specialized instruction even beyond PCM's services.
  • Students often enjoy higher performance in academic classes with increased musical participation.
  • Students self-report huge increases in confidence on stage and in other settings such as the classroom. 
  • Students build lasting friendships and professional relationships.

Challenges:

In order to offer a low to no-cost program with superb, well-qualified instructors, PCM must receive a combination of grants and donations in order to supplement paid lessons and other classes.  

Our goal is to raise minimum of $5,000 through IndieGoGo to help support the compensation of instructors, the purchase, maintenance, and upkeep of instruments, rehearsal space, audio equipment and technology, recruitment and outreach programs, visiting instructors and clinicians, live concert opportunities for students, and much more.  With a roster of over 90 students to support, there is a high demand for additional resources.  

Many of our students would not have access to a high quality, music education program if it weren’t for PCM.   

  • If we raise $1,500, we would support 1 student in the Music is Life College Preparatory program
  • If we raise $5,000, we would support 3 students
  • If we raise $10,000, we would support 7 students

We believe in our team of teaching artists, our staff, and our students, so we are here to give them every bit of support possible.  Our instructors are highly qualified and proven to be up to the challenge of supporting these dedicated students.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't make a contribution today, you can help us reach our goal.  Share our campaign with your friends.  Post links on your social media pages.   Even better, if you are so inclined, send the link to this campaign directly to some close friends and let them know why you believe in our mission and encourage them to support us as well. Remember, IndieGoGo has lots of sharing tools to make spreading the word easy and convenient.  

Thank you so much for all of your support!

story:
Listen to singles from the record:

Iris, 3:54 of dreaming dangerously

The deal

Hey folks! I'm Tom Filepp, the person behind the electronic/experimental project Cars & Trains, based out of Portland, Oregon. After a couple of years break since releasing my 2012 full-length We Are All Fire, I've got a brand new record for you all. My fourth full-length release is called Dust, and is completely instrumental!

The record features walls of analog and granular synthesizers, acoustic instruments, and additional arrangements by the profoundly talented William Ryan Fritch.

I've released most of my records to date via the amazing label Fake Four, Inc, but decided to self-release this one because I want to keep it simple and release the album on October 16th, earlier than I'd be able to otherwise. I'm going to release the album digitally and via a limited edition cassette edition of 250, with beautiful offset printed packaging.

I'm keeping the release modest and trying to do as much of it as I can myself, but the rest I need to hire folks. Essentially what this boils down to is making things happen, but making sure I'm paying folks like the designer, additional recording engineer, and video editor as close to a fair wage as I can. Anything past that will go to trying to cover production costs on the cassettes and packaging.

Listen to the first single Iris, on Bandcamp.

Here's the artwork, and the cassettes:

What I need, what y'all get

My goal here is to raise $2,500. Exactly $750 of that will go to the talented designer Michael Crigler, who designed the artwork for Dust. $750 will go to the amazing musicians that helped build out additional instrumentation on the record. The remaining $1000 left after making the perks will go to helping me cover any production costs for the cassettes, packaging, and mastering, which adds up to a little over $1400, all said and done. I can't do it alone, but with your help we can make this happen. I also love the idea of making this record a project we're all essentially a part of.

I'm offering a handful of different items and packages to make this worth your while, including an early release of the digital album, the cassette, t-shirts, hoodies, my entire discography in vinyl and CD, in addition to a remix of your song, or even having me produce your original song in full.

If I don't reach my goal, then I'll at least pay the artists and musicians in proportion to what I've laid out above, giving them priority and foregoing covering production expenses on the cassettes. We've got this, though!

Beyond the goal, a vinyl edition?

I'm aiming for the $2,500 goal to cover expenses. If this ends up being successful enough though, if we can get the campaign to a more ambitious $4,000 then dang, I'll press Dust on a run of 250 vinyl!

Risks & Challenges

If we don't hit the goal I'll figure out a way to still make this happen. It's more of a risk to me personally, since I'm fronting the money. Either way this is coming out, but by helping you're ensuring that I'll be able to do future Cars & Trains albums.


If you can't afford a perk, you can still help

Regardless of whether you can help fund this campaign, spreading the word to your friends and family via social media is a gigantic help to me. I can't do this without you either way!

Let's make this happen, thanks 1000x folks! Looking forward to sharing this album with you all!

<3,
Tom // Cars & Trains

story:
Snir Yamin? Who?

Hey, I'm Snir Yamin. A 25 years old Singer-songwriter originally from Tel Aviv, Israel. I started my music career 6 years ago, toured mostly my home country Israel from North to South. I performed at big venues and in "venues" that aren't really venues (you know, the kind of places when you have 0 equipment nor sound guy and when someone decide to turn on World Cup in the middle of my set). 2 years ago I started to perform outside my comfort zone and made my way to Europe, performed my songs for the first time in English to international audience. I toured German and the UK. A year ago I released my debut EP called Urban Stories, which sold over 5,000 digital copies worldwide! But I still want to fulfill my dream and break to the most inspiring yet challenging market - U.S.A.

I recently took the first step and got accepted to perform at CMJ MUSIC MARATHON in NYC. For those of you who are not familiar with it, it's an industry event and platform for artist and music industry people (such as labels, managers, publishers etc..) to get to know each other. 

You can listen to my latest release and other recording materials here:

So why am I here anyways?

CMJ Music Marathon was successful! I was invited to continue touring the U.S with my songs all over North America, Isn't that great?! Well, Yeah it is! BUT.. For all of this to happen I need to get some paper work done and, of course, some budget. In order to an International act to perform legally in the U.S. it is require to hold a permanent Artist Visa (Called O-1 Visa, and not just a status). That's a first. 

Second, In order to the tour runs smoothly, I need to get equipment insurance so if something went wrong on the roads, I still could make it in time to the shows without canceling. 

Third, the tour must get some exposure somehow, and the best and most effective way to get it done is to hire a publisher! Cool ah?! Yeah I know, but again - it s require some budget too.

And last but not least - Transportation and Hotels. Touring all over the U.S and Canada by foot with all the equipment won't be the east right? Sooo yeah. I need to get on domestic flights and/or hire a mini van to get from one venue to another.

And now - (Drum Loops...) PERKS (:

Sooo.. I thing you got the idea until now. I'm a Singer-Songwriter who's trying to make it BIG. And to make it really big I need to get somehow to the biggest music market in the world. In order for it to happen I can use your little and appreciable help, if you'll be willing to help me with it.

  • $5 will get your name on my upcoming EP Credits!
  • $10 will get your name on my upcoming EP Credits + Free digital copy!
  • $20 will get you all the above + a limited edition hard copy of my latest Urban Stories EP!
  • $50 will get you all the above + a one demo song from my upcoming EP!
  • $100 will get you all the above + a custom made music video for any song you choose!
  • $150 will get you all the above + a limited edition hard copy of my upcoming EP!
  • $200 will get you all the above + WAV. acoustic cover of your favorite song mastered by top U.S mastering studio!
  • $500 will get you all the above + a free access for one of my shows anywhere in the U.S or Canada and we can hangout afterward!
  • $1,000 will get you all the above + A PRIVATE ACOUSTIC CONCERT!

This is me, so nice to meet you! Pic by the Talented Ruth Edelstein.

From The Press

  • "When I first listened to Snir Yamin's songs, the first thing that caught my ear was his incredible vocal performance.
    This young but yet super professional Israeli singer/songwriter emerged to be one of his countries best singers and I can definitely understand why. 
    His unique sound and the raw emotions that he brings to his songs are hearts melting and very fresh."                                                     Sputnik Music, EP Review 
  • "If I close my eyes, I can almost envision a young Snir Yamin with a guitar in hand, one leg propped, playing for a square full of enamored ladies clutching at their hearts and slowly swaying from left to right. His Urban Stories EP contains three beautiful, very sweet songs, all carried with his very strong voice."                  
  •                                                                                                      The Equal Ground
  • Like the river he is named after, Snir Yamin has cast off the throws of the icy winter and is once again flowing as the singer songwriter begins his first world tour.
    Snir has toured his homeland of Israel from top to bottom, played the pubs of London, and spent some time in New York City; but this time around Snir is looking to cover more cities as he supports the release of his new album "Urban Stories".                                                                                    All Voices Magazine
  • While all the songs off Snir Yamin’s EP, Urban Stories, were excellently crafted and delivered, I absolutely loved the song “Stay” and was by far the most taken and impressed by that song. It was so unbelievably strong and so full of emotion. It’s a love song/break up song, but it’s not at all like any you’ve heard before. “Stay” seemed much more personal than your traditional “love/break up song” and immediately grabs at your heart as you listen.    Mars Bands
  • The charm lies in his minimalist orchestral vibe. It's real, its acoustic and there is little sign of digital effect on the majority of his works. That alone grants the space between the notes grace and equal value because, as I say, it is all, so, magnificently real. It is hard to explain... The easy comparative would be Glen Hansard as it is the similar raw, romantic and reason driven story that is crafted so brilliantly in sound and meaning.    Revolution 360:PEOPLE THAT MATTER

Other Ways You Can Help

If you got here and you are willing to help but financially unable, that's totally cool! Hey, cheer up! All good (: You can still help me fulfill my dream by sharing this campaign with your friends, family, co-workers and anyone you think would be interesting to get me on the roads !

THANK YOU SO MUCH <3

While all the songs off Snir Yamin’s EP, Urban Stories, were excellently crafted and delivered, I absolutely loved the song “Stay” and was by far the most taken and impressed by that song. It was so unbelievably strong and so full of emotion. It’s a love song/break up song, but it’s not at all like any you’ve heard before. “Stay” seemed much more personal than your traditional “love/break up song” and immediately grabs at your heart as you listen.    Mars Bands

The charm lies in his minimalist orchestral vibe. It's real, its acoustic and there is little sign of digital effect on the majority of his works. That alone grants the space between the notes grace and equal value because, as I say, it is all, so, magnificently real. It is hard to explain... The easy comparative would be Glen Hansard as it is the similar raw, romantic and reason driven story that is crafted so brilliantly in sound and meaning.    Revolution 360:PEOPLE THAT MATTER


Other Ways You Can HelpIf you got here and you are willing to help but financially unable, that's totally cool! Hey, cheer up! All good (: You can still help me fulfill my dream by sharing this campaign with your friends, family, co-workers and anyone you think would be interesting to get me on the roads !THANK YOU SO MUCH <3

story:
Flaveworld Presents brings you a soul stirring, musical experience that can't be missed: The "Robotic Stimulus" Tour. Flaveworld Presents provides innovation through thought stimulation with music, video & stylish concepts. The tour will showcase new music selections from electro funk punk outfit CannabiDroid's new digital EP "Robotic Stimulus". Droids will be accompanied by KELU, a 10 piece, high energy, pop culture collective & will be embarking on a 7 night - 7 city extravaganza filled with excitement, mystery & fun for all!! Your contributions & support will assist us in shifting peoples frequencies to a higher level of funky bliss, as well as providing the means for our tour to navigate the roadways safely & effectively.


7.18 Seattle, WA
7.26 Portland, OR
7.27 Arcata, CA
7.28 Oakland, CA
7.29 San Jose, CA
7.30 Los Angeles, CA
7.31 Las Vegas, NV

Our ultimate goal is to raise $3, 100. We are 12 people embarking on a 2, 940 miles mission of musical healing & any money collected will specifcally be used for:

Transportation (rental van. fuel)
Lodging (hotels, campground fees)

Merchandise (t-shirt printing, cd/ dvd pressing)

Video Production (videographer/ editing)

Promotion (flyers, radio/ newspaper ads)


Please feel free to donate whatever you like to the misson, theres no set limit to what you can contribute. But we have some really cool perks for certain amounts in the form of various packages of personalized merch & private performances. Besides the general feel good vibrations our tour will generate, contributors and supporters can have a sense of pride and accomplishment being involved with a positive movement that creates moisture for the thirsty & maximizes the euphoria. We have been plugging away performing locally in the NW & different regions across the US consistently and with your valuable support soon we will be spreading our artform worldwide. 

We understand everyone can't contribute, but you can always help by spreading and sharing our campaign, our music & video links, and if you are in a city where The "Robotic Stimulus" is making a stop, tell all your friends and family to come rock the house with CannabiDroids & KELU!!!

story:
BOSSA: "Something that is done with particular charm, natural flair, or innate ability."

Thank you for visiting! I create music for you. YOU are want makes my career meaningful.

In January 2014, I began recording an album of classic bossa nova with my recently formed Brazilian project, Michel Navedo and Brazil Novo. We recorded 12 brilliant songs, five of which made it on to the upcoming release. 

The album, entitled "BOSSA", is a shining example of classic Bossa Nova, both in instrumentation and style. Twinkling keys, samba infused rhythms, and subtle, sultry vocals adorn four classics and one original composition. Featuring impeccable performances by Jason Goessl/guitar, Birch Pereira/bass, Dave Bush and Simon Lucas/drums, Chris Morton and Josh Rawlings/piano, and yours truly on trumpet, vocals (Portuguese), piano and percussion.

It is also my debut album as a producer, and one that I am extremely proud of. I cannot wait to get it out to you!

Your donations will go directly to help cover mastering, publishing, CD printing, and advertising costs related to the release of this album.

Check out the new single of the Jobim classic, Fotografia, a steamy duet with Brazilian songstress Adriana Giordano! An instant classic!!! 

This album will succeed only with your help. Hit the "Select A Perk" button now!

With admiration and appreciation.

Yours truly,

Michel Navedo

story:
Make sure to see our other videos below!

*If you don't know your filter size, that's okay. You can support our project today and we will follow up with you via email to confirm your filter size.





Philanthro is an exciting new brand of air filters with a charitable mission to transform the lives of orphans and vulnerable children around the world.  Every time a Philanthro product is purchased, we donate at least 20% of the proceeds to fund international mission trips and support holistic orphan-care charities.

Most of us replace our furnace filters on a regular basis.  Furnace filters have traditionally been a boring commodity item purchased from a brand without a compelling mission.

Philanthro is different.  When you join us and choose a high-quality Philanthro furnace filter instead, you know you are making a big difference for a child who needs our help.

Please read the rest of our story below!


We donate at least 20% of every Philanthro purchase to fund international mission trips and support holistic orphan-care charities.

How can we afford to donate this much?  We have a small team and we run lean. We keep overhead costs low and we're scrappy with our marketing budget.  We accept lower profit margins...on purpose.

Why? Because our #1 goal is to help as many orphans as possible.  We like running a solid business, but we really love helping the kids we serve.

    


Philanthro filters are engineered to deliver the same (or better) air filtration as the leading brands found at home improvement and other retail stores.  We've been in the heating and air conditioning industry for a long time and we designed Philanthro furnace filters with high standards in mind.

All Philanthro filters carry a MERV 11 rating.  MERV stands for Minimum Efficiency Reporting Value.  The higher the MERV, the better the filtration.

We carry all filter sizes.

*If you don't know your filter size, that's okay! You can support our project today and we will follow up with you via email to confirm your filter size.


According to UNICEF, the international orphan crisis affects more than 163,000,000 (163 MILLION) children around the world.  They range in age from infants to teenagers, all without a family to meet the most basic needs.  Children are orphaned for a wide range of reasons, including war, poverty, natural disasters, and abandonment.  If all these children were grouped together, they would constitute the 10th largest country in the world - an entire nation of vulnerable children, left to fend for themselves.

163 million is a number that is difficult for most of us to wrap our heads around.  We can agree that whatever the reason for family failure, children should not be the ones to pay the price.  How do we address such an enormous challenge?  One child at a time.  

At Philanthro, our company mission statement is "To transform the way people purchase products that improve their comfort, health, and happiness, as we transform the lives of orphans and widows around the world."

We believe that we have an important duty to love, protect, and care for the most vulnerable people in our society, and we've built a company that channels a large portion of its financial success toward this cause.  We strive to provide care for today, and hope for tomorrow, for orphans and vulnerable children around the world by rolling up our sleeves on international orphan care mission trips and by funding select non-profit organizations that develop thoughtful, sustainable programs to make a long-term difference in the lives of these children.

In living out a higher calling, we desire to transform lives around the world and play a central role in meeting the needs of orphans and vulnerable children, from family preservation and adoption to provision for specific physical, social, educational, emotional & spiritual needs.

By incorporating "social good" into our business model and involving our customers in the cause, we can make a sustainable and scalable difference in the world.  We aim to have a positive impact for tens of thousands of children.  We envision Philanthro growing and becoming a household name and extending into new product categories.  We eventually want to see Philanthro on the shelves at major retailers and in homes and businesses around the world.  As Philanthro grows and more people join our cause, we will be in a position to give back even more.

Every time you join us in this cause by purchasing a Philanthro product, you are making a choice that makes a difference in the life of a child!

Please join us!  Support this project, make the choice to purchase Philanthro air filters, and tell your friends and family so they can join us too.



Back2Back Ministries is our primary non-profit partner.  When you choose a Philanthro product, you're helping us channel more resources to serve orphans in places like Mexico, Haiti, Nigeria and India.

Members of the Philanthro team have been serving with Back2Back on international mission trips since 1998 and our team members have donated over 10,000 combined hours serving alongside Back2Back in countries all over the world.

Back2Back has been impacting the lives of orphans and vulnerable children since 1997.  Through their 5-Point Child Development Plan, they strive to provide holistic care to each child they serve, meeting spiritual, physical, educational, emotional, and social needs to help kids overcome their life circumstances and break free from the cycle of generational poverty.

Learn more about Back2Back from this awesome video!


The Philanthro team originates from a third-generation, local heating and air conditioning company founded in 1954...we've been in the industry over 60 years!  We're located in Monroe, Ohio, just north of Cincinnati.  We've always emphasized the importance of family values like honesty, integrity, and service to others.  Our experience in the HVAC industry and our focus on giving back to the community set the stage for the launch of Philanthro.

In 2006, Will Housh founded the ecommerce company Housh, Inc. and launched our first online store.  In 2013, we launched our flagship website HVAC.com, one of the world's leading online marketplaces for heating and air conditioning products, services, and helpful information.

Will is Philanthro's founder and CEO.  Ever since going on his first mission trip to Mexico (with Back2Back Ministries) in 1998, he's had an insatiable passion to help orphans and vulnerable children.  Will’s passion is contagious and it motivates everyone in his presence (ask anyone who knows him).  He and the whole Philanthro team are determined to see Philanthro succeed.

For the past five years, our company has taken volunteers from our team on company-sponsored international mission trips in partnership with Back2Back Ministries.  The company pays for all trip expenses and extends an extra week of paid vacation to the team members so they can serve without reservations.

We get very excited about rolling up our sleeves and serving the kids.  We have always yearned for an opportunity to engage our customers and suppliers in the cause.  After a lot of brainstorming about how to raise awareness and make a bigger impact in the lives of orphans around the world, the idea for Philanthro was born.

We are super excited to invite you to join the Philanthro "team" by supporting this project, helping us launch Philanthro, choosing to use our air filters in your home or office, and even joining us on a mission trip!  Please contact us so we can tell you more about our vision and see how you can get involved.  We'd love to hear from you!




We invite you to join us as we change the lives of orphans around the world, one child at a time.  The need is great, and now with Philanthro everyone can do something to help!

Please join us today and back this project.  Click the pink "Contribute Now" button at the top of this page to support Philanthro and choose from one of the exciting perks!

Together we will make a huge difference for orphans and vulnerable children around the world!


Where do I enter my filter size?

When you contribute to this Indiegogo campaign and choose a perk that includes Philanthro air filters, you do not enter your filter size during checkout.  We will follow up with you via email/phone at the end of our campaign to make sure to ship you the correct filter size!

Where does my money go?

20% of your purchase goes towards Back2Back Ministries in order to transform the lives of orphans & vulnerable children around the world.

When will I receive my Philanthro air filter?

Your Philanthro air filter will be shipped September 2015.

story:
We reached our first landmark of €1,000!
Thanks so much to all who have contributed
and shared so far!

As promised, here is a live video of us performing last year in Ireland. This is a previously-unreleased video, never seen before. It is our way of thanks for the continued support to our crowdfunding campaign.
Enjoy!



What Is This Campaign About?

Now this is going to sound cheesy, but when we started this band it was simply about connecting together through the beautiful language of music. Ouch, it's even cheesier now that I see it written down..Oh well, it's true, and I've already started now, so I better go on..​.
Four years later, and this connection is stronger than ever. Our music has brought us to amazing places, performing for wonderful audiences along the way. The three of us have been blessed to share our music with many people, and we would love to welcome you into DINOSAUR's world!

( No, we are not opening an amusement park called  'Dinosaur's World', filled with clones of extinct vertebrates...We are a band that makes music. Passionate music. Music that comes from a deep place within us, which we cannot express simply through words. For that, you will just have to listen to it. )

Ehh anyways, the time has come for DINOSAUR to record our first album. While this is an exciting prospect, right now it is simply a dream. We cannot do it alone, and need your help to make it a reality.


Who Are DINOSAUR?

Aengus, Mauricio and Maya met while studying at the Conservatory of Amsterdam, one of Europe's finest music schools. These three persons, from three different countries, with three different backgrounds, came together through one shared love, music.

Bringing together our influences from Ireland, Colombia and Russia, we formed DINOSAUR in 2011. Touching on areas as different as jazz, rock, film music and Latin-American folk, our sound is constantly evolving.
These past four years together, writing music and exploring creative ideas, have been a lot of fun. By far the best part has been sharing our music with all of the folks we have been fortunate enough to play for. Last year we did our first tour of Ireland, a truly inspiring experience. After playing to crowds all over the country, we were blessed enough to finish up at the National Concert Hall of Ireland!
Along the way, we received many heartwarming reactions from admirers and fans. They described to us the vivid imagery they pictured whilst listening to us perform. Time and time again, we were asked: “Do you have an album?” And time and time again, we sadly answered no..Well, the time has come for that album to be made!

Despite all the marvellous experiences we have had, DINOSAUR's story has not been without its challenges. Soon the three of us will live in three separate countries, on two separate continents! Most bands would probably quit at this point. But then again, we are not most bands. Music is much more than a career to us, it is a way of life..Our opportunity to express ourselves, as well as the moving responses of those we share it with, are inspiration for us to find a way to continue.

But, in order to do this, we need your help. As an independent band, without the support of a record label, we cannot afford all of the costs involved in making this album. We are asking you to help us fund the production of this album. In doing so, you will become a creator of a permanent work of art, with emotion and committment behind each and every note. As well as this, it will give a massive jumpstart to our careers, opening doors far beyond even this album.


What Will Be Covered By Your Contribution

Specifically, we are aiming to record DINOSAUR's debut album in a very special studio (check it out here), have it mixed and mastered by the Netherlands' finest, press 1000 copies onto CD, and then get it out into the world!

The amount of €3500 (plus our own savings) will pay for :

  • Recording             (this is where the music happens...)

  • Mixing                   (this is the next step, where the music gets polished...)

  • Mastering            (this is the final touch, where the music gets all shiny and
                                   sparkly...Mmmm...)

  • Distribution         (this is where the music gets to your ears!)

  • Physical copies  (1,000 CDs)

  • Album art           (photographs, concept art, graphic design)

  • Travel costs       (did I mention we all live in different countries..?!)


Other Ways You Can Help /

If You Want To Help But Money Is Tight

As Aengus said in the video, every contribution helps, no matter how big or small.
If you cannot afford to contribute money, you can still help us out hugely by spreading the word about our campaign.

Please share the campaign link and/or video on Facebook, Twitter, Youtube
and via email to your friends and family:

http://igg.me/at/dinosaur-album-crowdfunding

You can also like and follow us on social media, to stay up to date about the campaign and our debut album. Help us create a buzz about our campaign!

Facebook

Twitter

Youtube


We would also love to hear from you, email us at velvetdinosaur@gmail.com.

From Aengus, Mauricio and Maya, THANK YOU!

of a record label, we cannot afford all of the costs involved in making this
album. We are asking you to help us fund the production of this
album. In doing so, you will become a creator of a permanent work
of art, with emotion and committment behind each and every note. As
well as this, it will give a massive jumpstart to our careers,
opening doors far beyond even this album.




   


What Will Be Covered By Your Contribution




Specifically, we are
aiming to record DINOSAUR's debut album in a very special studio
(check it out here), have it mixed and mastered by the
Netherlands' finest, press 1000 copies onto CD, and then get it out
into the world!
The
amount of €3500 (plus our own savings) will pay for :






	Recording            		(this
	is where the music happens...)



	Mixing                  		(this is
	the next step, where the music gets polished...)



	Mastering            		(this
	is the final touch, where the music gets all shiny and
	                               sparkly...Mmmm...)



	Distribution        		(this
	is where the music gets to your ears!)

Physical copies 
	(1,000 CDs)




	Album
	art           (photographs, concept art, graphic design)



	Travel costs       (did
	I mention we all live in different countries..?!)






   Other Ways You Can Help / 
If You Want To Help But Money Is Tight


As Aengus said in the video, every contribution helps,
no matter how big or small. If you cannot afford to contribute money, you can
still help us out hugely by spreading the word about our campaign. Please share the campaign link and/or video on Facebook, Twitter, Youtubeand via email to
your friends and family: 
http://igg.me/at/dinosaur-album-crowdfunding

You can also like and follow us on social media, to stay up to date about the campaign and our debut album. Help us create a buzz about our campaign!

Facebook

Twitter
 Youtube


We would also love to hear from you, email us at
velvetdinosaur@gmail.com.


From Aengus, Mauricio and Maya, THANK YOU!

story:
Emergency year 1...

In the summer of 2014 Sault Ste. Marie saw a few major summer events come to an end because of lack of funding, seeing it as an opportunity as well as an emergency, local event organizers sought to change this situation.

Stephen Alexander owner of Loplops Lounge and his team decided a street festival was in order. This one day festival saw local and touring acts perform on Queen St. on multiple stages, and was free for the public to attend. The weather was perfect, and the event was a success.

Fast forward 1 year later...

Now in its second year, the festival is hoping to expand its reach within the community. This year’s event will feature touring and local bands on multiple stages, an art display courtesy of The Sault Ste. Marie Arts Council, vendors, and activities for the whole family.

This one day event will be held from 12pm-9pm August 15th, 2015. Featuring free stages, as well as a licensed ticketed area.

Lineup is still being added to but it's looking good…

Sunparlour Players

Tasman Jude

Fast Romantics

Poor Young Things

The Pixo Control

Northwest

Gnaeus

Zachary Lucky

Why we need your help?

Festivals cost a lot of money and sponsorship continues to be another "emergency" in our community as large businesses cut back. Most importantly we want to pay artists what they’re worth. We’re asking you to help us raise $10,000 to continue the Emergency. Your contribution will also help with transportation, deposits, supplies, technical equipment, decor, and any other associated costs. We want the people of Sault Ste. Marie to have the best experience possible and you can help with this endeavor by donating today.

story:
CLICK HERE IF YOU'D STILL LIKE TO SUPPORT FUNKY DL's ALBUM EVEN THOUGH THE CAMPAIGN IS CLOSED


AFTER 3 YEARS SINCE THE LAST FULL STUDIO ALBUM, YOU'RE INVITED TO BE A PART OF HELPING FUNKY DL RELEASE HIS BRAND NEW ALBUM...

                         ____________________________________________________

        Back in 2007, I released the Number 1 iTunes hip-hop chart album,

"THE 4th QUARTER"

                          

The album was a musical journey between

4 different styles of hip-hop,

Soul   New Age   Jazz   & Authentic 

CLICK THIS LINK TO LISTEN TO THE ORIGINAL 2007 4th QUARTER ALBUM NOW!

____________________________________________________

8 years later...

I'm about 50% through with the album and I'm preparing to take you all on an exciting new journey with the release of this creative adventure in the form of the sequel album.

I've forgotten about dealing with difficult record labels who want so much control over the music with minimal investment... and I'm making this about just me the fans and our bringing this album alive and to the finish line!

"The 4th Quarter 2: Autonomy - promises to be one of my most special and mind-blowing album releases. I'm gonna carry my art through these 4 zones of styles in a way the first album didn't. You're gonna escape in this album and travel through the world of the 4th Quarter 2 unlike any other album you've previously heard".

"Not having written or recorded a new album for 3 years has given my creativity time to reflect. Time to step away from the rhythm of the usual cogwheels and see the world differently, experiencing and learning new things, so that when I step back into the shoes of my creativity, what is born is a new lease of creative life, a new vision, a rebirth... a new found awesomeness!"

"This is definitely going to be me delivering at my absolute best, but one of the differences in this sequel will be the strength of the lyrical content. The album is sub-titled as "Autonomy" because lyrically it's going to get intense and resonate with my truth and for the first time, bring out the true lyrical activist in me. If ever there was an album I was going to make with significant lyrical food for thought... this is it right here!"

And the journey doesn't end there...

There's an INDIEGOGO ONLY EXCLUSIVE BONUS Quarter,

THE 5th QUARTER: The Latin Quarter

This Latin Quarter will NOT be commercially released as part of the main album and is exclusively for only the Indiegogo supporters who select the relevant perk!

                           ____________________________________________________

So I'm asking you all to come on-board The 4th Quarter 2: Autonomy train to contribute and help towards bringing back and supporting the true characteristics of real and authentic hip-hop! 


This new Funky DL album is going to be made possible by YOU and your Indiegogo support.

The days of the old model where artists do deals that keep the label in business and the artists struggling is OVER!! Lets make this happen!!!

                            ____________________________________________________

And it don't stop there',

You can see on the subway map above that "THE LOVE QUARTER" will not be open for this album, but especially for the fans, one brand new unreleased track entitled "That's Love" (+ Instrumental) is available NOW for every Indiegogo supporter who shows "LOVE" beyond the 1st perk...

Exclusively from THE LOVE QUARTER!

                           CLICK TO LISTEN TO A TEASER OF "THAT'S LOVE"

* Download links will be sent out within 48 hours of your pledge.     

                          ____________________________________________________

And it STILL doesn't stop there',

through this campaign, you can soon get....

 THE UNRELEASED FUNKY DL - ALL NEW REMIXES

DIGITAL ALBUM

"Le Emporium De Jazz"

Including 15 never before released

Funky DL remixes of his joints.

For supporters who select the relevant perk, this album will be sent to you as soon as this 30 day Indiegogo campaign has ended.

                           ____________________________________________________


Rewards

This campaign is all about "the music", so the rewards are primarily focused on that! Here's some of the cool rewards available by backing this project.

  • A digital download of the new album + instrumentals.
  • A digital download of a brand new unreleased Funky DL track.
  • The new and previously unreleased "Le Emporium De Jazz remix album.
  • An autographed CD of the the previous and the new 4th Quarter album.
  • An official 4th Quarter Funky DL T-Shirt (we will confirm your correct size with you).


SOME OF THE OTHER COOL PERKS AVAILABLE...

CD's


VINYL


Where Your Support Goes!

Your much valued and generous pledges will go towards:

  • Studio / Mastering sessions.
  • Session musicians.
  • Graphic design for the artwork.
  • Manufacturing the CD album.
  • Promotional Video.
  • Manufacturing and shipping of Limited Edition official Funky DL “4th Quarter 2” T-Shirts (Design yet to be confirmed)
  • Shipping costs.
  • Additional video content surrounding the project.

                         ____________________________________________________

THANK YOU

Thank you so much for your support.  It is this that keeps me in the studio, and it truly means a lot!


#letsmakerealhiphop

peace...

story:
Jonny Gore, Guitarist of the band Least of These and Guitarist/Producer Ryan Bentley (Former Guitarist of Memphis May Fire) have graciously offered to record our new album! They will be driving all the way from Dallas, Texas to record us right here in Memphis, TN. We have 30 days to raise $3500 with your help!

As Independent Artists, we do not have the help of a record label to pay thousands of dollars to record a new album. We rely on the love and kindness of those around us to help us reach our goals. Forsake Your Nets is not just a band, it is a movement. When Chris and Luke started playing music together in 2012, they wanted to create an atmosphere with their music that promoted the love and acceptance of Jesus Christ. With the formation of Forsake Your Nets, a community of musicians and music fans was born.

The goal of the band has always been to allow the music to speak for itself, and love those around you in word and deed. We hope that you will see the value in investing your hard earned money in us as we build a community of music fans that is known by their love and passion.

With this new album, we are hoping to reach those that may not have heard our music before and bring them into the family-like atmosphere of Forsake Your Nets. We appreciate your time and hope that you would consider contributing to our cause.

story:
Composing Fantasy 2015

Hey there! I'm Olivia Kieffer. I'm a composer, percussionist, and music educator. 

I teach percussion plus other fun classes at Reinhardt University, and I am bandleader and drummer for the Atlanta Chamber Rock band, Clibber Jones Ensemble!

I'm raising funds to help pay my tuition for the Charlotte New Music Festival, where I have been accepted as a composer. 

I love writing music! At this festival I'll get to study with great composers, hear some of my pieces performed, and write some new music. This is a super exciting opportunity for me!


I need $1,500 to complete my balance for tuition + room and board.

That's what the money will be used for!

Now, what do you get out of helping me pay my way?

You're supporting an "emerging composer". I put it in quotations because it's a funny term, but an accurate description. 

I'm going to write a marimba solo, that I will perform and record, and you'll get an exclusive copy of the music (a download, and a copy of the score!). Think of your contribution as a consortium...you're joining in on a commission for a marimba solo!

And you can also get a fun magnet for your fridge!


**HIGHLIGHT OF THE DAY:

"Hot Work" (for bass clarinet and tenor saxophone) is on the GremlinsDuo CD!

You can order the CD here!

And listen to it here!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have any money to help, you can always spread the word by copying and pasting this link to any of your social media sites!

THANK YOU!!!!!!

story:
Story:

At the age of 14-18 years old (from 1987 to 1991), I composed music for numerous famous Commodore 64 games. It's been my dream for over 20 years to remake the most memorable of these C64 SID soundtracks in a professional way.


Over the past few years I've been asked many times by my Facebook friends and fans when I would start a crowdfunding campaign to create an album with remakes of the best "Jeroen Tel / Maniacs of Noise" Commodore 64 game music.

I've decided to start this musical journey now and wholeheartedly invite you to join me on this 8-bit quest!

I want to dedicate myself towards producing the album called:
"Jeroen Tel - Tel Me More".
 

In order to do this, I will need to raise funds for:

  • Booking studio time.
  • CD mastering  and replication.
  • Design and manufacturing of the luxury DVD-sized cd book.
  • Pressing & printing of the limited edition LP Vinyl album.
  • Design & fabrication of the "Jeroen Tel - Tel Me More" T-shirt.
  • Printing the "Jeroen Tel - Tel Me More" poster.
  • Post & packaging for sending out the perks to those who pledged.
  • Living expenses during the time I am producing the album.
    (So I can dedicate myself 100% towards this project!)
  • Taxes (...)
  • Unforeseen expenses.

I've created perks to reward your pledge amount from "a unique download code for the album in MP3 and lossless FLAC format" to "A limited edition (collector's item) vinyl LongPlay record". Please look at the perks for details.


The cd (and digital) album will include the following titles:

  • Robocop 3
  • Cybernoid II The Revenge
  • Rubicon
  • Hawkeye
  • Myth
  • Turbo Outrun
  • Supremacy
  • Stormlord
  • Battle Valley
  • Cybernoid
  • Eliminator
  • Iron Lord

I've put up links in the 'Gallery' tab to all of the original Commodore 64 music on Youtube, especially for those who are not familiar with my Commodore 64 music.

There are plans to add bonus tracks, depending on how much I raise for the project.

The cd album book will include colorful details about the Commodore 64 games themselves (screenshots, original artwork & credits).

Please, join me on this 8-bit quest and let’s create an epic, funky, melodic & beautiful album you can listen to for years!
 

(poster)

Thank you for your support! :-)
