story:
Short Summary

My name is Harley Rowell. I am the worship leader at Destiny Church International in Daphne, Alabama.  I am a full time student at the University of South Alabama majoring in Music Business. My dream is to share the love of Jesus Christ internationally through music. I am getting ready to start my first official collection with producer Chris Springer, former producer and A&R for Integrity Music. Recording my first album will be a dream come true! By your giving, I can record these songs AND share the love of Jesus INTERNATIONALLY!

I am a psalmist dedicated to writing all types of music that bring glory and honor to my Father. My first debut project will be a collection of songs that I have written for and with my fiancé, Ashleigh Donnelly. She will be working on this project with me and I am so excited about doing this with her! We will be getting married in May of 2016. 

Our goal is to use the songs that we record in our wedding. I am also going to record a collection of worship songs that God has birthed in me for such a time as this! 

Giving to this project help me financially AND it will also be launching me into was God has called me to do! Please pray for me and Ashleigh as we begin to start this journey together. Thank you so much for your contributions and God bless!

What We Need & What You Get

1. $4,000 is what we will need to be able to fund this project. The money will pay for the cost of studio time, paying our producer and engineer to mix and master this project, as well as any additional operational costs for bonus material. 

2. By giving to our project, items that you will receive include:

$10.00 

Digital download of latest project

$25.00 

Digital download of latest project, Hard copy of latest project.  

 $50.00: 

Signed Copy of latest project, Digital Download of latest project, T-Shirt, Personal Thank You Letter, 

$200.00 

Signed Copy of latest project, Digital Download of latest project, T-Shirt, Personal Thank You Letter, FaceTime Thank You, and Our Eternal Gratitude

$1,000.00

Signed Copy of latest project, Digital Download of latest project, T-Shirt, Personal Thank You Letter, FaceTime Thank You, Free Concert at your Church (depending on distance), Backer Updates, and Our Eternal Gratitude

$3,000.00 

Signed Copy of latest project, Digital Download of latest project, T-Shirt, Personal Thank You Letter, FaceTime Thank You, Our Eternal Gratitude, Free Concert at your Church (depending on distance), Backer Updates, Personal Song Writing Session With Harley Rowell and Ashleigh Donnelly , Song Will be Recorded, and Backer will be Noted as a Co-Writer of Song.

3. As we reach beyond our goal, all extra money will be put into a fund to help us do missions and future recording projects! 

The Impact

Me and Ashleigh feel called to lead worship both nationally and internationally. We have led worship in Honduras, Nigeria, Africa, South Korea, and all across the Southeastern United States.

God is opening HUGE doors for us. I believe that these songs that you help us record will change the lives of people all around the world! 

You can check out our Facebook page at Facebook.com/HarleyRowellMusic. 

Risks & Challenges

I am a full time college student and my dream is to lead worship full-time. My calling includes traveling, touring, and writing music with world renown writers. Ashleigh and I love traveling and leading worship in new places! We are so excited to be sent out into the world to chase our dreams!

I am not financially able to make this happen on my own. Your giving is going to be a seed planted into me and into the lives of thousands of people around the world. 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help us by praying for Me and Ashleigh! Pray that God will provide for us to be able to make this project happen! 

Also you can help us by posting about this Fundraiser on your Facebook, Twitter and Instagram pages.

1. $4,000 is what we will need to be able to fund this project. The money will pay for the cost of studio time, paying our producer and engineer to mix and master this project, as well as any additional operational costs for bonus material. 
2. By giving to our project, items that you will receive include:

$10.00 
Digital download of latest project
$25.00 
Digital download of latest project, Hard copy of latest project.  
 $50.00: 
Signed Copy of latest project, Digital Download of latest project, T-Shirt, Personal Thank You Letter, 
$200.00 
Signed Copy of latest project, Digital Download of latest project, T-Shirt, Personal Thank You Letter, FaceTime Thank You, and Our Eternal Gratitude
$1,000.00
Signed Copy of latest project, Digital Download of latest project, T-Shirt, Personal Thank You Letter, FaceTime Thank You, Free Concert at your Church (depending on distance), Backer Updates, and Our Eternal Gratitude
$3,000.00 
Signed Copy of latest project, Digital Download of latest project, T-Shirt, Personal Thank You Letter, FaceTime Thank You, Our Eternal Gratitude, Free Concert at your Church (depending on distance), Backer Updates, Personal Song Writing Session With Harley Rowell and Ashleigh Donnelly , Song Will be Recorded, and Backer will be Noted as a Co-Writer of Song.
3. As we reach beyond our goal, all extra money will be put into a fund to help us do missions and future recording projects!    The Impact 
Me and Ashleigh feel called to lead worship both nationally and internationally. We have led worship in Honduras, Nigeria, Africa, South Korea, and all across the Southeastern United States.
God is opening HUGE doors for us. I believe that these songs that you help us record will change the lives of people all around the world! 
You can check out our Facebook page at Facebook.com/HarleyRowellMusic. 
 Risks & Challenges  
I am a full time college student and my dream is to lead worship full-time. My calling includes traveling, touring, and writing music with world renown writers. Ashleigh and I love traveling and leading worship in new places! We are so excited to be sent out into the world to chase our dreams!
I am not financially able to make this happen on my own. Your giving is going to be a seed planted into me and into the lives of thousands of people around the world.    Other Ways You Can Help 
You can help us by praying for Me and Ashleigh! Pray that God will provide for us to be able to make this project happen! 
Also you can help us by posting about this Fundraiser on your Facebook, Twitter and Instagram pages.

story:
Hello everyone! my name is Gaia Mobilij and I’m an italian musician and songwriter. From 3 years I‘m living and performing for many months a year between the US and Mexico, places where I ‘m having incredible human experiences and music. My life is simple, dynamic and punctuated by constant movement, with a suitcase and my accordion. I decided to record MY FIRST ALBUM  of my songs and musics , in MEXICO, with the artistic production of Jeronimo Gonzalez ( bassist and jaranero of " SONEX" mexican band of garrote fusion and winners of the National Geographic Channel contest "Tu música también cuenta - Día de la Tierra".) ,mixing my music sounds with traditional or modern Mexican and Latin. Unfortunately, musicians live for the day and not always, if live of this job,You can afford to pay for a nice album. And that's why I decided to groped a crowfunding to help me deal with the costs of this new musical journey! The video that I attached is an example of the fusion that I want to create between me and Mexico ... which has already given me so much.Thank you very much and even now those who wish to contribute and to help me finance my project.
_ italiano_
Salve a tutti! 
mi chiamo Gaia Mobilij e sono una musicista e compositrice italiana.Da alcuni anni vivo e mi esibisco per molti mesi all'anno tra Stati Uniti e Messico, luoghi in cui ho avuto esperienze umane e musicali incredibili.La mia vita è semplice e  dinamica e costellata da continui spostamenti, con la valigia e la mia fisarmonica. 
Ho deciso di registrare il mio primo CD a mio nome, con i miei pezzi , in Messico, con la produzione  artistica di Jeronimo Gonzalez  ( bassista  e jaranero di SONEX, band messicana di Son Jarrocho e fusion originari di Xalapa,Veracruz e vincitori del concorso "Tu música también cuenta - Día de la Tierra" de  National Geographic Channel) ,fondendo la mia musica con sonorità tradizionali e moderne  messicane e latine.
Purtroppo il musicista vive alla giornata e non sempre, se fa questo di lavoro, spesso non puo permettersi di pagarsi un  buon lavoro discografico.
Ed è per questo che ho deciso di tentare un crowfunding per aiutarmi ad affrontare le spese di questo nuovo viaggio musicale!
Il VIDEOCLIP che ho allegato è un esempio della fusione che voglio creare tra me e il Messico...che mi ha già dato tanto.
Ringrazio molto e già da adesso chi abbia voglia di contribuire e di aiutarmi a finanziare il mio progetto.
-español-
Hola a todos! mi nombre es Gaia Mobilij y soy una música y cantaudora italiana. Durante varios años he vivido y me realice por muchos meses al año entre los EE.UU. y México, lugares donde tuve experiencias humanas y música increíble, sobretodo en Mexico. Mi vida es simple, dinámica y puntuada por el movimiento constante, con una maleta y mi acordeón. Decidí grabar mi primer disco en mi nombre, con mis piezas, en México, con la producción artistica de Jeronimo Gonzalez,  bajista y jaranero de Sonex es una banda musicalmexicana de Son Jarocho originaria de Xalapa, Veracruz, los ganadores del concurso "Tu música también cuenta - Día de la Tierra" de National Geographic Channel) fusionando mi música con suenos y instrumentos de México y América latina tradicionales y modernos. 
Los musicos de hoy, no siempre se pueden pagar el trabajo que se necessita en la creation de  un álbum bueno.. Y por eso me decidí a intentar un crowfunding para ayudar a lidiar con los costos de este nuevo viaje musical! El VIDEOCLIP que aparece aquí es un ejemplo de la fusión que quiero crear entre mí y México ... que ya me ha dado tanto. Muchas gracias y hasta ahora los que deseen contribuir y para ayudarme a financiar mi proyecto.
GRACIAS A TODOS Y HASTA PRONTO!!!
www.gaiamobilij.com
https://www.facebook.com/pages/Gaia-Mobilij/263670587000235?ref=hl

www.reverbnation.com/gaiamobilij

story:
About Me:

I'm Amy Jay, a singer and a songwriter living in New York City. I'm raising money to record and produce my first studio EP Supposed to Be. My new music has poured out of my songwriting journal, and I'm so very excited to have the opportunity to share it with you. The songs are all based on stories of struggle and revelation - some from my own, some from others. I only hope at the end of the day these stories will speak to something deeper inside everyone who listens.





What I Need:

Telling my story does come with a price. I'm committed to producing this EP the right way: in a professional studio with musicians I trust by my side. The money I raise from this campaign will go directly to the following:

  • STUDIO TIME
  • PRODUCER FEE
  • PAYING SESSION MUSICIANS
  • PROMOTING THE RELEASE
  • MANUFACTURING COSTS
  • PROJECT UPKEEP (copyright, website, distribution)
I'm offering a number of unique, handmade or hand-designed perks as part of my campaign. I'm confident you'll be able to find something of interest - perhaps some handmade post cards, handwritten typographic lyrics, or a custom-crafted cover song would suit your fancy?
If I don't reach my fundraising goal, I will not stop driving toward my goal of releasing this EP and telling my story. Every dollar and cent that I raise helps support me in the pursuit of this project. But, on the other hand, if all goes better than expected and I raise more than the goal, I will put everything extra towards making a music video! 




The Impact:

I know that my story needs to be heard. It's time that I step out of the box I've put myself in and share my music with you. I'm the only 'me' out there, what if my message is waiting just for you? 



Risks & Challenges:

There are many challenges that I will face along the way, but I know I can push through with your help. 

  • Balancing a day job with pursuing music 
  • Deadlines, Timelines, and finishing on schedule
  • Producing an EP independently, without promotional or financial support from a label or publisher
I'm definitely going to need your help to push me along and encourage me!



Other Ways You Can Help:

I understand that not everyone will be able to contribute financially to my campaign, but if you believe in me and want my music to be heard there are still tons of ways you can help support me!

  • Follow me on Social Media so you can stay up to date on the progress of the project
  • Share my campaign with your friends, family, co-workers, neighbors, strangers, anyone and everyone! Every bit counts, and spreading the word will help immensely. 


Thanks for your time and for reading this! 


With Love Always,
Amy Jay

story:
**********  UPDATE!  UPDATE!  UPDATE! ***********

Isabella managed to raise close to $12,000 to go towards the used harp she has been wanting!  Unfortunately, Indiegogo does not allow us to update any other type of donations that were either given to us in person or mailed to us from around the nation.  But, she did it!!!!  Thank you SO MUCH to all her 'harp angels'.  All 84 of you made her dream come true!!!

We decided to surprise her with her new harp on the most fitting day of the year- Thanksgiving Day, 2015!  Isabella's plan was that she would play harp after dinner while we all ate dessert. Little did she know that while my Mom was distracting her upstairs, we were swapping her rental harp with her new harp downstairs.  It was a day to remember and Isabella was overwhelmed with emotion and lots and lots of tears (see video above for the reveal!).

Thank you again to all of you that supported her in her dream.  All 84 of your names were engraved on a plaque that was also presented to her on that same evening.  She will never forget this wonderful day!

God bless you and your families!

****************************************************************************

Isabella recently turned 10 and has been playing harp since the age of six. Her love for the harp has grown exponentially along with her talent. Playing the harp has become part of her daily life- practicing 2 hours a day.  Isabella has placed at all three of the competitions she has entered in the last two years (see video of entry in gallery).

After playing on rental harps for the last four years, a new opportunity to purchase a used harp came our way. Isabella has been able to play on this Lyon & Healy Style 23 harp  a few times-built sometime in the 1980's-  and she fell in love with it immediately!!!  

We knew that Isabella would be needing to upgrade to a full sized Concert Grand harp sometime this year, but with the extremely high cost of new harps ($32K+), we were expecting that we'd have to search for a rental harp. Fortunately, we came across this great harp and it's being sold by only it's second owner.  It has had very little 'mileage' and is in great condition. The tone is rich and Isabella's sound and pedal changes are a complete improvement from all her previous harps.

The total cost of this harp, after the purchase of a transport cover set, the necessary harp regulation ('tune-up') and new strings- will end up costing about $20,000. We think we could personally come up with half of this amount at this time.  For the last two years, we have had friends, family and even strangers suggest that we create a funding page to raise money for Isabella's 'future' harp because they want to help. So, we have decided to move forward right now with this incredible opportunity!

Isabella has recorded a personalized video (above) for you where you will hear additional information. She is so motivated to call this special harp 'hers' that she sat down and wrote out the words she wanted to share with you.  As her parents, we couldn't be more proud of our little girl.  She's kind, generous, loving, smart and has a beautiful soul.

If you are able to donate to Isabella's harp fund, we are truly grateful.  Any amount is completely appreciated and all donors will have their names engraved on a special plaque and will be invited to a private harp concert by Isabella! 

PLEASE help us spread the word!!!  Share this page (http://igg.me/at/harpforisabella/x) on facebook, twitter, and/or email it to your friends. You can do so by clicking to the left of the video at the top of this page.  Please ask friends to share with their friends if they can! 

Thank you all for your support of our daughter's talent and possibly her new harp! 

***NOTE:  Take a look at photos and a video of Isabella playing harp since she was 6 up to now  by clicking on the gallery tab. ***

ACHIEVEMENTS:

1st PLACE:   Young Artists International Harp Competition; Junior Division at age 8 (July, 2014)

3rd PLACE:  American Harp Society National Competition; Junior Division at age 9 (June, 2015)

Runner Up:  Classics Alive Music Competition; Junior Division at age 10 (Sep. 2015)

story:
Hello everyone!! 

Thanks for visiting my Indiegogo Campaign page! Most of my friends and family know me well and the music that I have been blessed of God to teach, play, sing, write, and record over the course of my life and career. But there has been more dreams in my heart that have yet to be fulfilled. I believe now is the time to see another dream fulfilled because this one carries another very special purpose for others who either enjoy or maybe need the music that I am about to create to help them. This is the reason I want to share the news of an exciting project that I will be working on this fall in this new chapter of my life and music ministry. 

My Project

I am preparing to go back into the studio this fall, and with the help of my friends Steve Clarke and Clint Curtis of Sevenview Studios, Springdale, NL, I will record TWO uniquely creative instrumental LP albums, one entitled "Healing Colors," and the other, entitled "My Peaceful Place." Besides creating the albums for the enjoyment of the listener, these recordings are specifically intended to be shared with people who struggle with any type of mental, emotional, or physical disease,  and with those who have been diagnosed with special needs or developmental or learning disabilities. The music will also be of benefit to anyone dealing with everyday stress, anxiety, and grief in that each song selection will be intentionally created to be a soothing, uplifting, and peaceful place for any listener. As the saying goes, "Sometimes music is the only medicine the heart and soul needs."  Everyone loves a "spa" and this music is meant be a tool to take any listener to a place of peace and relaxation simply because of the heavenly atmosphere that I will endeavor to create as I play each selection spontaneously. 

My Purpose

The term "Tehillah Music Source" or TMS, as I have coined the phrase, is summed up in a brief definition (see below) of what I have used at Freedom Victory Centre (our non-profit Ministry Centre,) for various promotion ads of our weekly "Tehillah Music Source" night for people with special needs. I started facilitating this weekly event since January 2015 and there's been such a ongoing flow of musical creativity flowing out of my heart. We have continued to receive very favorable and positive feedback of how the music has been of great help and benefit to those who are attending, parents and caregivers included. Positively unique behavioral changes have been taking place in a couple individuals with autism, for instance. It's very exciting for me to share this gift of creativity as an inspiration to them! As a worship leader, I know that I am making room for a new expression of heaven's music that God wants me to share with those who need healing, freedom, peace, or simply an encounter with God's love. This particular project has been a dream of mine for about 20 years and now I can see it coming to pass. People have been asking if I have any of this TMS music recorded on CD or available as digital downloads via the iTunes. I have assured them that it is forthcoming. It's obvious to me that it is the right time for me to get it out there to bless others! 

Definition of TMS

Using the medium of peacefully ambient music, Tehillah Music Source, or TMS is called “Spontaneous musical creativity sourced from the Holy Spirit.” Using this authentic, spiritual approach to peace and sense of well-being, Musical Facilitator and Educator, Clara Whalen-Inman will present a unique repertoire featuring a collection of peaceful, calming, and easy listening instrumental songs and sounds. Each piece will be spontaneously created and performed in a free style/expressive form, bringing freshness and newness to the listener. Combining the versatility of an electronic keyboard workstation and sometimes human voice, this musical experience will help provide a serene atmosphere for special needs children/persons, parents, and assistants alike, leaving them uplifted, relaxed, and de-stressed.


My Passion

For me personally, the music that I create has always been an expression of my worship to God, while for others who have listened, it has helped them engage or at least be inspired and touched deeply in their spirit, soul, and or body. Again, lots of positive, personal feedback received as I have shared . I have offered myself as an instrument through which God's healing power can flow and touch others where words aren't enough. I feel humbled and blessed as I continue on my  quest to let His creative river flow through me for His purpose and glory. This is the most important reason why I'm undertaking such a project so as to facilitate heaven's music and the sounds of God's loving heart to healing and restore hurting people.  

My Support Team includes YOU! 

A project such a this requires some significant funds such as I have projected in the budget of $15,000. This is where I can use your support for the cause! The main purpose of this 45 day campaign then is to pre-sell as many CD's and or digital downloads as possible to meet the budget. The budget costs includes a) cost of airfare and related travel expenses to NL for 10-14 days, b) studio time, c) production and manufacturing costs of the two CD's, d) post production costs,  e) an interactively designed website to service my music and digital downloads, f) advertising and marketing, g) equipment rentals and or incidental purchases necessary for the project, CD release concert costs, office supplies, CD pre-order mailing costs, and a variety of "perks" or "thank you" gifts for larger scale donors. 

I would be most happy and appreciative to receive whatever support you can offer as we build momentum together with the project. If you can also help me get the word out to other family, friends, and especially to those who would benefit from the creatively peaceful music that I will produce, I will be most grateful! Are you ready to join me on another adventure that is just too good not to share? I will be providing updates and info as the campaign is underway, so keep checking your email, FB, Twitter, and Instagram! I believe that we can easily reach the goal because I know just how many of my friends, family, and associates believe in the gift of music that I have been given by God to share, and I am confident that your hearts connect with the purpose of the project that I am passionate about! For that, I wish to thank you all in advance for every level of support, including your prayers and encouragement! Together we can share the dream of love! LET THE ADVENTURE BEGIN and pre-order your copies TODAY!!

Hello everyone!! Thanks for visiting my Indiegogo Campaign page! Most of my friends and family know me well and the music that I have been blessed of God to teach, play, sing, write, and record over the course of my life and career. But there has been more dreams in my heart that have yet to be fulfilled. I believe now is the time to see another dream fulfilled because this one carries another very special purpose for others who either enjoy or maybe need the music that I am about to create to help them. This is the reason I want to share the news of an exciting project that I will be working on this fall in this new chapter of my life and music ministry. My ProjectI am preparing to go back into the studio this fall, and with the help of my friends Steve Clarke and Clint Curtis of Sevenview Studios, Springdale, NL, I will record TWO uniquely creative instrumental LP albums, one entitled "Healing Colors," and the other, entitled "My Peaceful Place." Besides creating the albums for the enjoyment of the listener, these recordings are specifically intended to be shared with people who struggle with any type of mental, emotional, or physical disease,  and with those who have been diagnosed with special needs or developmental or learning disabilities. The music will also be of benefit to anyone dealing with everyday stress, anxiety, and grief in that each song selection will be intentionally created to be a soothing, uplifting, and peaceful place for any listener. As the saying goes, "Sometimes music is the only medicine the heart and soul needs."  Everyone loves a "spa" and this music is meant be a tool to take any listener to a place of peace and relaxation simply because of the heavenly atmosphere that I will endeavor to create as I play each selection spontaneously. My PurposeThe term "Tehillah Music Source" or TMS, as I have coined the phrase, is summed up in a brief definition (see below) of what I have used at Freedom Victory Centre (our non-profit Ministry Centre,) for various promotion ads of our weekly "Tehillah Music Source" night for people with special needs. I started facilitating this weekly event since January 2015 and there's been such a ongoing flow of musical creativity flowing out of my heart. We have continued to receive very favorable and positive feedback of how the music has been of great help and benefit to those who are attending, parents and caregivers included. Positively unique behavioral changes have been taking place in a couple individuals with autism, for instance. It's very exciting for me to share this gift of creativity as an inspiration to them! As a worship leader, I know that I am making room for a new expression of heaven's music that God wants me to share with those who need healing, freedom, peace, or simply an encounter with God's love. This particular project has been a dream of mine for about 20 years and now I can see it coming to pass. People have been asking if I have any of this TMS music recorded on CD or available as digital downloads via the iTunes. I have assured them that it is forthcoming. It's obvious to me that it is the right time for me to get it out there to bless others! Definition of TMS

Using the medium of peacefully ambient music, Tehillah Music Source, or TMS is called
“Spontaneous musical creativity sourced from the Holy Spirit.” Using this authentic, spiritual
approach to peace and sense of well-being, Musical Facilitator and Educator, Clara Whalen-Inman will present a
unique repertoire featuring a collection of peaceful, calming, and easy
listening instrumental songs and sounds. Each piece will be spontaneously
created and performed in a free style/expressive form, bringing freshness and
newness to the listener. Combining the versatility of an electronic keyboard
workstation and sometimes human voice, this musical experience will help provide a serene
atmosphere for special needs children/persons, parents, and assistants alike,
leaving them uplifted, relaxed, and de-stressed.My PassionFor me personally, the music that I create has always been an expression of my worship to God, while for others who have listened, it has helped them engage or at least be inspired and touched deeply in their spirit, soul, and or body. Again, lots of positive, personal feedback received as I have shared . I have offered myself as an instrument through which God's healing power can flow and touch others where words aren't enough. I feel humbled and blessed as I continue on my  quest to let His creative river flow through me for His purpose and glory. This is the most important reason why I'm undertaking such a project so as to facilitate heaven's music and the sounds of God's loving heart to healing and restore hurting people.  My Support Team includes YOU! A project such a this requires some significant funds such as I have projected in the budget of $15,000. This is where I can use your support for the cause! The main purpose of this 45 day campaign then is to pre-sell as many CD's and or digital downloads as possible to meet the budget. The budget costs includes a) cost of airfare and related travel expenses to NL for 10-14 days, b) studio time, c) production and manufacturing costs of the two CD's, d) post production costs,  e) an interactively designed website to service my music and digital downloads, f) advertising and marketing, g) equipment rentals and or incidental purchases necessary for the project, CD release concert costs, office supplies, CD pre-order mailing costs, and a variety of "perks" or "thank you" gifts for larger scale donors. I would be most happy and appreciative to receive whatever support you can offer as we build momentum together with the project. If you can also help me get the word out to other family, friends, and especially to those who would benefit from the creatively peaceful music that I will produce, I will be most grateful! Are you ready to join me on another adventure that is just too good not to share? I will be providing updates and info as the campaign is underway, so keep checking your email, FB, Twitter, and Instagram! I believe that we can easily reach the goal because I know just how many of my friends, family, and associates believe in the gift of music that I have been given by God to share, and I am confident that your hearts connect with the purpose of the project that I am passionate about! For that, I wish to thank you all in advance for every level of support, including your prayers and encouragement! Together we can share the dream of love! LET THE ADVENTURE BEGIN and pre-order your copies TODAY!!

story:
This is it, guys!


Thank you so much for stopping by. When I was first thinking of ways I could fund this project, crowdfunding never came to mind. But when I came across the idea, it seemed like an amazing way to involve all of you in this exciting process. As some of you might know, last summer I packed up and moved out of my home in Edmonton and flew across the country to Toronto, where I've been tirelessly sharpening up my skills as a songwriter and performer. After a year of writing and co-writing songs everyday and performing nearly every night, I've found an entirely new creative direction for my music.

Back in the day...


Many of you may have heard my previous recordings, like the Timeless EP, or if you were there at the very beginning... you remember when I was passing out little demo CDs in Nashville with song titles like "Christmas With You" and "So What If I Need Time" when I was fifteen. You were there since the very start, supporting and encouraging me to pursue what I love most. Back then, I only knew I loved writing songs. I had no real vision for who I would become as an artist and what kind of music I would make. But even so, every night I would come home from school and write a song about my day. My writing matured as I did, and I started to notice I sounded significantly less country than all my songwriter friends in Nashville. I wanted to give myself the chance to find out who I am as an artist - what my music can really be. That's why I'm in Toronto.

Now it's time!


I'm settled. I have a strong vision, an amazing team, and all but one resource to make it happen. Every cent from your donation will go towards the recording, producing, mixing, and mastering of 3 tracks.

I believe this record will be beautiful. Now, infinitely more so that your fingerprint is on it. Thank you for taking your time to read through this and for any future contribution you'll make towards making it happen. I can't thank you enough!

All my love,

Emily

story:
Elindultam 2 francia dj versenyen is. Ezek közül most az utóbbiról írok. 

Az I'm Your Dj egy 72 órás zenei maraton fesztivál oktatók nélkül, ahol az esemény szervezője meghirdetett egy online dj versenyt. A verseny belépője egy önálló fél órás mix készítése volt, melyet emailben kellett elküldeni a szervezőnek. A mixeket 3 dj zsűrizte. Pontosan nem lehetett tudni hány induló volt, csak válasz emailen és az esemény fb oldalán tették közzé azon dj-k neveit akik a most hétvégén, az először megrendezésre kerülő non-stop zenei fesztiválon folytathatják a verseny. Összesen 8-an kerültünk be ebbe a versenyben.

Miért folyik a verseny, mit kínál a szervező az első helyezettnek?

  • Az első nyer egy Beat By Dre fejhallgatót, 
  • 10 fellépési lehetőséget különböző neves francia klubokban,
  •  illetve a következő fesztiválon főműsoridőben való fellèpès lehetősègèt.
  • + a nevedet öregbìted nemzetközi vizeket.
A hétvégi programterveben jól látható, hogy hova szúrták be a versenyt.
Míg  középdöntő szombaton szabadtéren lesz, addig a döntő vasárnap már a fesztivál programjában.

Az utolsó pillanatokban elég borsos áron lehet kijutni a rendezvényre. 
Ezért fordultam az indiegogo-hoz és hozzád.
Ha van egy felesleges ezresed, elrepülnék vele Bordeaux-ba. :-)
Csütörtök éjfélig gyűlik a pénz! 
Ha mégse jönne össze, természetesen visszaadom mindenkinek. ;) 
 Üdv.:
Jeszy

story:
MINISTRY – THE BAND

Hi, I’m Professional Photographer Omar Mena!

Since the Buck Satan and the 666 Shooters promo shots, I’ve had the pleasure of capturing behind the scenes footage and photography of candid moments during Ministry’s time at the compound in El Paso, as well as promo shots, of the band. Included is footage from the Relapse sessions, rehearsals and From Beer to Eternity; all images are candid, beautiful and many unreleased footage/images.

So, with Ministry’s blessing, we have compiled a one of a kind opportunity to put together over 100 images in a comic book style format. Since we are pressing only a limited number of the comic book; we are needing your help to make this happen.

The comic book style book is a limited edition run only. So, please do us a favor by pre-ordering the book that ships on Halloween.

THE DOCUMENTARY

This documentary is full of unreleased footage from sessions that were left out of the webisodes from all the different campaigns I did for all three albums for Ministry.

The footage also includes footage of Tommy Victor (Prong, Ministry, Danzig), Tony Campos (Soulfly, Static X and Fear Factor) and many more special appearances.

Footage like this will not be made available again in the future and just like the comic, will be available in limited qualities.

Please help us with pre-orders so we can make this documentary work.

WHAT DOES THIS MEAN FOR YOU?

We have a bunch of perks available to you, the uber-Ministry fan. Everything from a discount on pre-ordering the comic and documentary together; as well as the opportunity to have limited edition prints, to getting the chance to advertise your business or band alongside the legendary Ministry.

ALL WE NEED IS YOUR SUPPORT

Thank you for being part of this special offering from Ministry. The band is completely grateful for your support and look forward to offering you a one of a kind item that you won’t be able to get anywhere else except through this Indiegogo campaign.

www.alfuckingjourgensen.com

https://www.facebook.com/Ministry?fref=ts

https://twitter.com/AlFknJourgensen

story:
Hi I'm Jonathan Czerwik and I make records as Tall Tree 6ft Man 

You might find my name alongside a song called 'tears and laughter' which featured on an episode of Fox TV's hit show Bones. This track became available as a download only add on to my first album, which came out a few years back. The song seemed to cause quite a stir, especially across the water in the US. Another song from that same album "The Woods Song" has recently been play listed by Spotify, hitting almost 400.000 spins!

Since then I've been writing, obsessively, spending most nights working away in my garden "shedio" creating and capturing as many special moments as I can. The time feels absolutely right to complete the work and create a definitive version of these moments in time, knowing that I've put everything I can into the songs.



There is a record label on board called Label Fandango, which is primarily run by those guys and girls that are behind Fierce Panda records. They offered to release the album and push the PR side of things. I just need your help to pay for some studio time to make the record perfect.

If you do get involved in the project and decide to join me on my musical odyssey to who knows where,  you'll be able to get loads of exclusive stuff, signed cd's, exclusive merchandise, and of course you'll get first dibs on the album.

Please have a listen to the songs I've added to this page, hear where it's all heading and get on board. For my part I promise I'll do everything I can to make a beautiful record.

I look forward to hearing from those who are interested.

Jonners

p.s If you've any questions just drop me a line talltree6ftman@gmail.com

story:
What's the Deal?

First check out this 3-song sampler from the new album on Soundcloud!

Ok hope you gave it a listen!  This is Cali Shaw and I've been making music with all my force for many years.  

It's been a joy and a privilege to meet so many of you guys and make art with you since the early 2000s with Felonious Groove Foundation and then on to my solo indie-folk project Cali Shaw Band which began in 2011. My music career is just a leaf on the tree of incredible things being made by independent folks just like me. But I'm so happy to be your leaf.

I'm finishing up my 2nd Cali Shaw Band studio album now, titled Under The Olive Tree.  Over the past year in Albuquerque we have recorded and produced an album that is lush and fully orchestrated.  It sounds fantastic and I can't wait to share it with you!

The album features:

  • The talent and sounds of incredible local musicians
  •  Full vocals and harmonies, whistles, vintage Gibson guitars, enchanting vibraphones, some big fat upright bass, and even a horn section!
  • 8 new original songs and a new folksy train march cover of "Over the Rainbow".

 I am making this album so that you can sing or whistle along and drum your hands on your steering wheel, your desk or anywhere that you like.  So join me and let's finish this record together!


What We Need & What You Get.

Making a professional album is expensive, between hiring the best musicians around, manufacturing the CDs, posters and T-shirts, and hiring artists for the CD art and other promotional costs.  The tab for the project is several thousand dollars. (Ouch!)

With the majority of the the project already completed, we need to raise  $2500 for the final push; getting this album pressed, packaged, and out to you and the rest of the world's indie-folk music lovers.

Anything extra will go towards promoting the album and producing an awesome music video for the song "Hold On to You".

The perks for your contribution are pretty straight forward and include everything from a digital download of the album to signed CDs, posters, T-shirts, a guest-list spot at the album release parties, and even a house concert at your home!

If we don't reach our goal of $2500, you will still receive all of the perks that your contribution paid for.  

So, please help spread the word!  Friends help friends fund good, local music.

CD release celebrations are set for Oct. 24th at The Outpost Performance Space and Nov. 13th at Sister Bar in Albuquerque NM. 


Who's on the Album?

Cali Shaw - Producer, Songwriter, Lead Vocals, Vintage Gibson guitars, Piano and Mini Korg

Dan Spanogle - Upright and Electric Bass

Josh English - Drums and Percussion

Nick Baker  - Vibraphone, Marimba, Drums and Percussion

Meredith Wilder of the band Wildewood - Lush Backing Vocals

Alex Maryol of Alex Maryol Band - Swampy Slide Guitars and Telecaster mojo.

Muni Kulasinghe of Le Chat Lunatique fame- Fiddle

Aaron Lovato - Saxophones 

Chadd James - Saxophones and Clarinet

JQ Whitcomb (he's off at Juilliard now pursuing a masters) - Trumpet  

The Album was recorded, mixed and mastered by Jesse Korman at Elephonic Studios

Who are the Artists designing the CD, Poster, and T-shirt art?

Jon Sanchez - One of ABQs best illustrator/screen printer artist around.  When he's not designing band posters you can find him at Comic-Con conventions around the country, local art festivals,  as well as making art designs for his favorite Sci-Fi movies. 
Wes Naman - Internationally famed photographer best known for his Scotch Tape and Rubber Band Series invited me into his studio to do some cool shots for the Album.
Sean Chavez - Super talented graphic designer who designed the art form my first albumWinter Bloom is on board again to lend his expertise in putting everything together into a nice little package for the CD!
Judith Shaw (that's mom) - World renowned painter serves as the original inspiration for Under the Olive Tree with her colorful oil on canvas paintings of Olive Trees and other nature inspired art. 
Justin Golightly - Indie Film maker who made the breakout indie sci-fi film Void is directing the music video for "Hold On To You".  We hope to have it done and ready to show at CD release party at Sister Bar on Nov. 13th. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Times are sometimes tough and I know you constantly get bombarded by bands and projects that need funding. 

If you can't help with a contribution but want to support local art and music,  please forward this page to some of your friends and family by sharing on Facebook, emailing or posting to any other social media platforms you use. To make it easier you can use any of the buttons on the left column of this page to instantly share this campaign across the internets.   Go ahead and try it out. Instagram it, Pin it, Tweet it!

Seriously though folks, all fundraising and social media aspirations aside, the ultimate goal at the end of the day is to share these songs with you and the rest of the world. We've worked hard on this album and I know you're really gonna enjoy it. So if nothing else please check out this free 3-song sampler from the album, and help spread the word along if you like what you hear...no strings attached. 

Thank you for your continued support and hope to see you at one of the release parties! 

-Cali Shaw

We've worked hard on this album and I know you're really gonna enjoy it. So if nothing else please check out this free 3-song sampler from the album, and help spread the word along if you like what you hear...no strings attached. 
Thank you for your continued support and hope to see you at one of the release parties! 
-Cali Shaw

story:
Short Summary

I want to get out and truly connect with music. I have plans for live shows, visuals, merchandise and of course more music. It can't be done alone though. As an independent artist, the supporters are the label. This all starts with you.

The Impact

This project is important to me for a number of reasons. Let's start with the title. FLOAT is an acronym. Freely Living Only At Times, which simply means you've got to learn how to control your emotions and not let them control you. 

I wrote + produced this entire project over the course of a year and a half. It was done during a period of time in my life where I wasn't capable of practicing what I preached so I put it into my art to rid myself of the thoughts that started to keep me captive. There's an underlying message: You've got to be and whatever you feel like BEING is, you take that and run with it.

I am by no means saying that this album is going to change the world, but, there's somebody out there that doesn't know I exist and we probably share the same stories and they need to hear what I've audibly written for them. This EP is also the first part of a trilogy, this is only the beginning...

Challenges

Being an artist, although exciting and fulfilling as my purpose in life, it is a struggle. The struggle is being independent and having to carry the burden of an entire team on your back. But, I've never complained because this is what I love.

I live for imagery, visuals, words that paint a picture and beats that wake your spirit when it's asleep. The difference between me and a lot of other artist is that I trust my struggle. I know that what I am being given is only a set up for the future so I take every moment as a learning experience and handle it in stride.

I've never asked for a handout and I damn sure don't want one because success that last doesn't happen overnight. With that said, I always find ways to make my vision come to life, but, the bigger picture can't be captured alone. I need your help to frame it all perfectly.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to contribute monetarily, here are a few ways you can support:

  • Share this campaign link (using the indiegogo share tools) on your social media pages, encouraging people to donate.
  • Word of mouth is the strongest promotion, let your friends know about Pierre King, what I do, who I am and if they can contribute that would be great!
Brilliance lives in bravery. Wealth comes from wisdom. Be bold and remain rich.

story:
Short Summary

Well for those who do not know me, my name is Andrew “aka” DJ Andyman, 19 years old from Johannesburg South Africa. Quite frankly I am looking for financial injection so that I can follow my dream whilst travelling Europe.

My History

Club DJ/Producer Targeting Resident Opportunities in Europe

House music grabbed me at a tender age of 12. With my love of house music I grew but so did my passion for music. I purchased myself a pair of CDJ’s to get started and enrolled on a DJ course (Technics DJ Mixx Club) for some extra training on beats and bars... I have not looked back since & may the future bring it on. “I am ready for anything”. Young and inspired.

I started my DJ'ing career in 2007.

2007-2008

1 1/2 DJ's Mobile Disco - Cable boy and sound setup at location.

Functions  completed; Weddings, 21st, corporate functions   and so on.

2008-2009

Permanent Wedding Venue @ Isindleke in Modderfontein on behalf of 1 1/2 DJ’s Mobile Disco.

Cable boy and sound setup at location.

Did the late shift most functions from 11H30 to 1,2 or 3am.

This venue was extremely busy and in the second half of the year the functions were on Thursdays, Fridays, Saturday and Sundays.

A lot of the time it was a double function meaning one in the day time and the second in the evening.

Functions completed; Weddings,21st, corporate functions.

2010

As above but the permanent venue relocated to the UK & 1 ½ DJ's went back on the road.

I attended the Technics DJ Mix Club and was qualified with a Gold Certificate which is one of their highest accolades.

I now am the resident mobile DJ for 1 ½ DJ’s and completed over 50 successful functions as the key draw card.

2011

I have been on the road most of the year with 1 ½ DJ’s whilst pursuing my dream of being one of the top club and production DJ’s.

I won the Casablanca @ Privilege DJ competition in Fourways with the opportunity to feature as a guest DJ @ Manhattans. I placed 6th out of 30 DJ’s in the Areira 2011 (Stones Centurion) DJ Competition.

I have featured and played alongside many well-known DJ’s  such as; Mark Stent, Dj Kent at Jet Night Club @ The Coco Cola Dome as well as Mastersims, Peter Booth, DJ Twist, Morgan Beat Box, Riccardo Dex, Ru-B any many more.

DJ Calculus has rated my skills in two separate competitions.

2012 - 2013

I was invited to play at Fashion TV Cedar square. Stones Edenvale have been a regular gig. I also sent a demo into 94.7 Highveld Stereo to Vin Diesel whom personally contacted me with very positive comments.

I featured in most of the clubs in Johannesburg. I also won the Areira's competition this year winnig a trip to Mozambique and playing with many artists on the beaches .

2014/2015

I have been applying my trade around the country whilst studying sound engineering & music production and working on a break through into this industry. Flexual records have signed a track I colaboratively produced “The Truth”. https://pro.beatport.com/release/the-truth/1548033 . Dark Truth is another alias I created with a friend of mine, click on the website icon to listen to some other mixes we have collaborated on. https://www.facebook.com/Dark-Truth-668795039899548/timeline/

What We Need & What You Get

With contributing to my project, you will help me achieve my ultimate goal of breaking into the European music scene and traveling outside of South Africa for the first time.

You get to help a young man fulfil his dreams.  You can enjoy the journey with me by following me on Facebook and Twitter.  Further to this I can promise that I give my best to achieve the goals I have set out and that I will pay it forward when I am a superstar to whomever may have a similar plight.

The Impact

Life changing. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I completely understand that not everyone will be able to contribute but everyone can still be help by sharing this page. The more people that see it will give me a better chance of achieving my goal.

I thank you for taking your time to look at the campaign.

In conclusion

I need all the help I can get to achieve my dream and with your assistance you may be helping the next biggest entertainment icon in the world.

 From South Africa.

story:
My Story

Howdy!! Amanda Raye here!

I am a singer/songwriter from St. Louis, Missouri. I’ve been singing since I can remember, and writing songs for the last 6 years. Recently, I got the hankering to start my own project to put my original music together as a collection. My good friend Julie says these are my “Heart Songs” from my heart to yours. I am excited and enthused to bring them to the table and share my art with all of you!

David and I decided that our girls would be better off in Missouri with our families until I finished this project and could get back to them. This was truly the hardest decision of my life, but I had to do what was best for them and for their Mama. Finishing this work is extremely important to my career and to them. The benefit of having a mother not afraid to do the work to make something of herself will serve them greatly in the future. We are doing great work and working diligently. I miss my girls more than anything, but they are happy and well taken care of by David and our families. I must finish this work, and get back to my babies, swiftly!

My Goal – The Breakdown

My goal of 7,000 gets broken down like this…

A portion goes to all the fantastic musicians who have contributed to this album. Tony Mata, David Mills, Rich Mossman - to name a few. I don’t play an instrument well enough to record – so we hired some amazing people to do all the heavy lifting for us. Let’s not forget the lovely vocalists who lent a hand as well!

A portion goes to my Dad for getting me started. He was my main investor and was so gracious to get me going on this project! Thanks for believing in me Dad!!

A portion will cover the production and studio costs of my album. A lot of hours have been put into this record to get it sounding this amazing. I must compensate the blood, sweat and tears put into my art!

A large portion goes to the CD’s and Vinyl copies that we’re ordering! Also, not to forget the all important, ‘Amanda Raye’ Merch!!

I’ve got some cool perks too! I’m excited to personalize CD’s, Vinyl, maybe write a ditty or two or make a funny video with one of you!!!

If our goal isn’t reached, whatever is raised will be taken care of in the order mentioned previously. until it runs out. I believe it is of the utmost importance to repay the efforts of those around us. That means musicians, my producer and my Dad. Hopefully Dad doesn’t get a collection agency after me…haha, that’s a joke.. Love you Dad!!

As we continue this work, I have had many friends and family ask if I would consider making this my debut Full-Length album...we are considering doing so, but of course the issue of time and resources stands in the way. If this campaign goes the way I am hoping it does....we just may have enough to make it happen!!

From My Heart to Yours – My Plan

I’ve been singing since I was a baby. Ever since I could form words, I have loved the impact music has had on my heart and soul. I have been passionate about music my entire life. Music inspires, uplifts, supports, and ties us all together. There is no doubt that music is a unifying entity in our world. When I write, it comes from deep within my heart and soul. I am displaying everything that is so sacred inside of my heart, for all of you to hear. I want to be the song floating around in your head every day, in your heart. I want you all to know that I’m not afraid to share who I am with all of you, and to encourage you to reciprocate. We are all we have, we need to feed and water our souls. Every one of us.

I plan to move to Nashville once this work is completed. I believe in this project, in these songs and in myself. I think I have what it takes, and I need to reach for that dream while I have the courage. I don’t know if I will be a success, or if I will just share what I have with all of you and that will be the great thing I did with my music…but I know that either way, I will be doing what gives my heart Joy. I will be showing my beautiful little girls that they should and can reach for their dreams, no matter how huge they seem. Failure is in not trying.

One other thing,  if I have had the pleasure of meeting you, I hope that you understood the purity my heart holds…and that, I understand and am grateful for every kind gesture, hug, word…all of it has motivated me to do this and without that, this would have been much more difficult a dream to dream. Thank you, from my heart to yours. 

You Can Still Help!

If you can’t contribute, don’t sweat it! If you can share this campaign on your Facebook or any of your social media sites and encourage others to do the same, we may be able to reach this goal! There are share tools on the indiegogo site that make it really easy! I would be ever so grateful if you could do that at the very least! Thank you SO much for your time and support!!

Love and Light,

Amanda Raye <3

story:
ABOUT US

The Teach Peace Build Peace Movement Musicians for Peace Ambassadors were the chosen talented and passionate children and youth of the Music for Peace Camp held last May 28-31, 2015 in Camp Capinpin Tanay Rizal. The Music for Peace Camp was co-organized by various organizations including JCI Manila and the 2nd Infantry Division of the Philippine Army and many other peace partners. 

The TPBPM Musicians for Peace Ambassadors are composed of youth ages 15 to 28 years old from the different sectors, faiths and ethno-linguistic groups including soldiers, children of soldiers, Muslim youth from Mindanao, Christians, Indigenous Peoples and also students from the Conservatory of Music.

Music for Peace Mentors include Singer and Song writer Mr. RJ Jimenez, and Musicians Kabaitan Bautista and Roman Gerard Enguero.

ABOUT THE CAMPAIGN
During the Music for Peace Camp, the output that we produced were original songs about stories of peace, stories about being an indigenous person, about being a Muslim and about being a soldier.  The music that we created aims to create more awareness about the stories of young people from all walks of life including those whose stories have not been much heard in the mainstream society.

WHAT WE NEED?

Our campaign goal is $5,000 so we can produce 10 original songs and 1000 copies of the album. The funds that we will raise will  be used for the production  of the songs like musical engineering, mastering, studio rentals and other production and recording expenses. 

The album will be sold during Teach Peace Build Peace Movement Events to raise more funds and help teach peace to more children in our adopted schools and communities in Mindanao,  Philippines. 

You will not only help our voice be heard through our music but you will also be able to help us raise more funds for the children in conflict areas. 

If by some way you will not be able to donate cash, you can still help us reach our goal by being part of our Love Society and conduct any of the following: 
1. Email this campaign to your friends.
2. Share this campaign in your social media accounts.
3. Blog about our campaign and share our story to the world!  
4. Fundraise for us and donate your proceeds directly to the campaign.

Thank you so much!

TPBPM Musicians for Peace Ambassadors

story:
Short Summary

Nasty Savage is a power metal from Tampa Florida, to be more particular Brandon Florida, and my favorite all time band. I also happen to have grown up with these guys as Ben Meyer was my neighbor, and also I was a room mate at his house twice in my life. I was a roadie for Nasty Savage for Ben Meyer, as well as for Richard Bateman. In fact Richard is more family than friend to me in fact. Any way after the band broke up I said there is no damn fan club for the band, and the web site for the band was pretty bad. (just a logo). So I formed the official fan club for the band, and the fans came running, from all over the world to join the official fan club facebook site, and the 600+ fans are die hard. So I said damn we need a tee shirt for the fans to help spread the word of this fan club. 

What We Need & What You Get

The reason I am doing this is I am trying to help raise money for a movie. I happen to be a film maker, doing my own damn movie. In fact my 11th full length movie. It also happens to be my first comedy. That is if any money is made. These Shirts have to be premade and every quote I have gotten is over $500.00. I started thinking damn, blood, sweat, tears (the band break up) for my favorite band for years, and I have never asked a DIME from any member for my hard work. 

So what do you get? You get a Nasty Savage 2 sided tee shirt, one with the classic ORIGINAL old school logo, and on the back it says NASTY SAVAGE fan club, and the official link to the page. https://www.facebook.com/groups/NastySavageOfficialFanClub/


The Impact

We will raise awareness of this legendary band, and do something good for the world. 

Risks & Challenges

If we dont raise enough money the shirts are not getting made. No one gets em. and it goes back into the pile of shitty ideas. 

Other Ways You Can Help

REMEMBER WHEN YOU CONTRIBUTE PLEASE HELP SPREAD THE WORD... 

BUY 2. One for you and One for a friend. 

This is not about the movie I am making, but about the band Nasty Savage, so dont bother asking about it.

I happen to be a film maker, doing my own damn movie. In fact my 11th full length movie. It also happens to be my first comedy. That is if any money is made. These Shirts have to be premade and every quote I have gotten is over $500.00. I started thinking damn, blood, sweat, tears (the band break up) for my favorite band for years, and I have never asked a DIME from any member for my hard work. 
So what do you get? You get a Nasty Savage 2 sided tee shirt, one with the classic ORIGINAL old school logo, and on the back it says NASTY SAVAGE fan club, and the official link to the page. https://www.facebook.com/groups/NastySavageOfficialFanClub/

    The Impact We will raise awareness of this legendary band, and do something good for the world. 
    Risks & Challenges If we dont raise enough money the shirts are not getting made. No one gets em. and it goes back into the pile of shitty ideas. 
    Other Ways You Can Help REMEMBER WHEN YOU CONTRIBUTE PLEASE HELP SPREAD THE WORD... 
BUY 2. One for you and One for a friend. 
This is not about the movie I am making, but about the band Nasty Savage, so dont bother asking about it.

story:
We are looking to raise a reasonable amount of money in order to fully fund the music video of Gambimi's debut single.

The song is called 'Roll With Me' it explores unconditional fidelity and tells a passionate tale of what romance can be.

In order to bring the best out of the song and extract all richness out of the narrative, sufficient funding is needed to enable us to dive into every possibility, opportunity and creativity.

The money raised will be used in equipment, hiring certain locations, covering cost for extra cast or actors, travel and accommodation (if needed) and also further crops, material and items that we will need in order to make this video clip a great success.

Please donate and become a part of a journey that will see a greatly talented man become the big star he is bound to become. This can truly be his breakthrough, but that will only be possible through your generous giving.

story:
is thrilled to be apart of the 
  
in partnership with
 

Ladies First is a celebration of extraordinary women. Through silly storytelling and song you are guided along a timeline highlighting bad ass women in America's history. 



Some things people said about Kristin Dausch:

"but the one I would put my bets on was Kristin Dausch.  Singing "Men," a tune from the failed So Long, 174th Street, she delivered a star turn worthy of Carol Burnett.  A truly individual character, with an amusingly put upon and almost bent posture, she belted this tune in a shockingly secure and brilliantly loose performance, making it her own. If this gal does not make it big, than there is no justice." - Melody Breyer-Grell, Cabaret Scenes

"Then she opened her mouth and out came her powerhouse, knock `em down on the back row belting"  - Mary L Clark, The Column

"First and foremost (she has) a voice that could belt high notes to the far reaches of the new Cowboys Stadium if need be. It still has all the velvet and satin for Jule Stynes great ballads..Dausch can act, too, and has a gift for comedy." - Lawson Taitte, The Dallas Morning News

"She's alright"-Her Mother



A bit about the conference:

You can see it in the existence of the term comedienne, a qualifier for a profession that we have been told is inherently male. Because of this "fact", women have allowed the art they create and the validity of their careers to be filtered through the male perspective. Their world view is taken in through someone else's eyes. But these women don't need to be better at appealing to men, they need to define and live by the female perspective.This 3 day conference will be a hub of ideas about how women can grow their art and actively change this skewed world view within their own communities.

A bit about ?WHAT IF! Innovations:

For nearly twenty years, ?What If! has partnered with organizations hungry for growth. We invent new products, brands, services, and business models; and we help our partners build their in-house innovation capabilities. Our style is provocative and passionate. Our mission is maximum impact.

story:
This is probably the most exciting adventure in my life.

I've been a violinist since when I was six and I always had a big dream. But we will talk about this later. 
Let me introduce myself first. I am Claudio Marzorati from Italy, I am a quite famous violinist in my country. I played also abroad, in other european countries, and I have a very important classic repertoire in my experience. I come from a family of musicians: my parents are pianists and my grandfather was a violinist too. Maybe it's family genetics!

Why I'm speaking to you? Simple.

I have a very important project in my life. I always wanted to do something special with my passion and my job as a violinist, such as the creation of a series of classical music workshops in Tuscany, where I live. This is probably the last step of this idea, the final goal. For now, I realized that the first of these steps is to bring a bit of italian classical music in the world, especially in those places where the most part of classical music was born.
I am talking about Austria and, especially, Vienna.

In order to promote my ideas, my first move is a big concert in Vienna on April 16th, where I will play two italian masters from different eras, like Giuseppe Tartini and Camillo Sivori, along with two giants of classic music such as Johannes Brahms and César Franck.
What I need

Basically, all your help to make it!

You know, as I told you, I've played in lot of countries in Europe, but I never playes in Vienna, the pulsating heart of classic music. Consider that Mozart lived there!

In every sense, to me, this is a debut in this city. That's why I want to make it simply perfect in every way.

With your contribution I will first of all rent the hall (DOVE), then organise whatever it's necessary to set up my concert in this amazing location.

I will also develope a strong communication campaign on social nets to promote this event, and, since I really would like to film all the event - you will see me playing! - well, I'd rather make it simply perfect!

And last but not least, I will create a fund for the next step of my musical project, that is the creation of a series of workshops for young musicians from all over the world in my beautiful Tuscany.

What's next?

The concert in Vienna, in my vision, is a way to promote myself of course, but this is not intented to be a self-ending target. This is, instead, a way to invite people in my country, to play and study music with me. My idea is to teach music in a different way, basically, and this is how I imagine my future workshops in Tuscany.

This is the biggest challenge!

There are a lot of ways to help me make this concert and all its consequences real.

First of all, if you can't support me, you can still help me sharing this project with your friends. You can also take a look on my Youtube and listen me playing past centuries masters. Or, you can still come to Vienna on day 16th of April: I will be really happy to meet you there!

Whatever way you will choose to make my dream real, I really want to thank you for your support!

story:
GREETINGS, FOLKS!!!

My name is Elijah The Mentor. I am a consultant to up and coming Caribbean musicians and also Founder/CEO of a Caribbean touring company named Optimistic Visions.

My campaign is to raise funds for the first Caribbean talent search series, BUILT FOR FAME, recorded in the United States and streamed throughout the Caribbean. 
With the help from contributors, Adding to the culture and creating opportunities for those who never fathomed a way out of a society of destitute has always been the goal which YOU can be a part of.


What We Need & What You Get, Family!!!

We want to raise $100,000 to properly deliver this package to the culture. This is a NOT-FOR-PROFIT venture. The funds will be distributed as followed:

BREAKDOWN OF BUDGET




                           What Do YOU get?

                          

We definitely want to give back to all the contributors that help build this dream. The perks to adding to MY culture are listed to the right...but I want to list them for you anyway because we are family now :-)

- Thank You very much $1 contribution

-Shout outs(social media) $5 contribution

-Shout outs + YOUR NAME signed to a big poster with the logo BUILT FOR FAME $10 contribution

-Shout outs + your name on Poster + 11x14 Poster signed by Elijah The Mentor saying "Thank You" $20 contribution

-Shout outs + your name on Poster +Poster signed by Elijah The Mentor + Glow in the dark wristband $35 contribution

-Shout outs + your name on Poster +Poster signed by Elijah The Mentor + Glow in the dark wristband + t-shirt with Logo $50 contribution

-Shout outs + your name on Poster +Poster signed by Elijah The Mentor + Glow in the dark wristband + t-shirt with Logo+ mp4 email video message saying thank you $75 contribution

-Shout outs + your name on Poster +Poster signed by Elijah The Mentor + Glow in the dark wristband + t-shirt with Logo+ mp4 email video message saying thank you + mp4 edit version of the full documentary from the inception to the announcement of the winner. $100 contribution

   WHAT HAPPENS IF WE DON'T HIT OUR MARK?

                                    

The show must go on!! The production will still happen even if I, Elijah The Mentor, have to put up the remainder of the funds for it to happen.. All I can say is THANK YOU to you all that help this dream come closer to reality for my culture.

                                       The Impact

            


Making this possible would create possibilities out of the impossible for a lot of people. And together, if we can help bring that dream alive for one person we've done our job. I'm projecting this to be just as popular as the powerhouses like American Idol and The Voice. In order for things to come to fruition it must be conceptualized first..so yes, we need to think BIGGER  ;-)


                          Risks & Challenges

              

In order for the for the show to be done we would need people to man certain positions, such as, host, producers, editing, equipment, staff, etc. If the mark isn't hit we run the risk of not having all the needed entities to produce the show and worst of all not having money to pay the crew for their time..(this is where I put my sad face now) :-(

Now to overcome these hurdles we would need to reach that goal of course...and to do that we would need to spread the word to everybody we know! The more people involved the brighter the chances for US to get this thing moving..(insert happy face now) :-)

                        Other Ways You Can Help

                                

You can post this movement on all of your social media outlets...remember to use the Indiegogo share tools to get them straight to our campaign..also follow us on facebook.com/builtforfame...be a part of the movement!..LETS DO THIS...(digital fist bump now) p#d....my nephew told me this was the emoji for fist bump.

$1,000 will cover just about 50% of all recording costs and the cost for the production of the physical CD and promotion to follow it.

I have worked and saved for the remaining project balance and will continue to save until the day I enter the studio. Any help would be GREATLY appreciated. Love you guys!

story:
The Late Night Jazz Orchestra

Hello and welcome to Team LNJO!  Co-led by Ian Roller and David Shorr, we are an 18-piece Big Band that features some of the best musical talents you can find in LA-performers and composers alike.  It is our mission to serve as the glue between the past, present, and the future of the Big Band tradition.  Established in February 2012, we've had some exciting performing and recording opportunities, bringing other people's music to life.  But now, it's about time we show the world what Team LNJO is all about and record our own debut album!!

The Plan

Our plan is to record our debut album in the Summer, and release it early Winter this year!  Can you feel it?  The time is FAST approaching!!

Producing an 18-piece Big Band album is no simple task.  To do it right, we need to pay for studio time at a large scoring stage, top notch recording/mixing/mastering engineers, the musicians' valuable time and talents, an artist for the album artwork, printing, pressing, and several other nominal costs.

But we can't just record the album and leave hundreds of copies around to clutter our desks!…if a major label spends x-amount to record and produce an album, it'll spend easily well over triple that figure on promotion and distribution costs.  Our total goal accounts for some extent of promotion; however, any pledges that take us above and beyond our goal will be used to further promote our album, Team LNJO, and the power of a large Jazz Orchestra!

And might I add that Drum Magazine's 2015 Jazz Percussionist of the year, Nick Mancini, will be guesting on the album!  In case you haven't seen his unofficial "teaser" video for the campaign: https://www.facebook.com/video.php?v=1027392527275537

The Bridge

We particularly look forward to recording this album at The Bridge Recording Studio in Glendale, CA.  We are confident that in this studio we can produce an album of the highest quality.  This is a first call scoring stage for virtually all the major Film and TV scoring sessions in LA, complete with all the best in sound and recording equipment.

The Purpose

Why do we deserve your support?  Why do we believe that what we are doing is important?

  • We are preserving one of America's indigenous art forms, one which is unparalleled in its impact on the ears, eyes, and hearts it reaches.
  • We love what we do, and we have worked hard to continue doing it at the highest level for over 3 years.  You can't load 18 of LA's finest musicians into a room at 9pm every Sunday night with a sense of value and purpose deeply engrained in the Team as a whole!
  • We are actively advocating the values of live music, a sense of community, working hard, and loving what you do, among many others.
  • Pouring all this talent, passion, and love into the creation of this album is going to yield an INSANELY AWESOME product!

Risks & Challenges

Every day that we assemble as a unit - some traveling as many as 50 miles each way to Northridge nearly every Sunday night just to rehearse - each of us faces our own challenges.  However, it is a challenge that our 18 core members and countless amazing subs (who we couldn't have made it here without) face head on.  On a weekly basis, each of us makes what is almost undeniably a risky investment in spending our limited and valuable time on this project.  Each individual involved fully understands that a Big Band simply has more mouths to feed than your average band; clearly, none of us are doing this for the money.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to further the success of this campaign, there are plenty of ways that you can help us out. The best way to help is to tell your family, friends and anyone that you believe might be interested in contributing to our campaign. Otherwise, just keep checking in on us and providing feedback on anything new we might release. Please, share this link and use the sharing tools provided by the IndieGoGo website. Thank you so much!

Here are some tips on how to help us get the word out and make some noise about Team LNJO:

  • The best way to help is to tell your family, friends, and anyone who you believe might be interested in contributing to our campaign
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools
  • Share the link to this page on any and all social media outlets
  • #goteamLNJO...if you're into that kind of thing... ;)
  • Bring your friends to an LNJO show!  We have two exciting all ages shows coming up where in lieu of a cover charge, we will be accepting pledges directly to this campaign using a laptop set up at the door!  These shows are this Sunday, March 29th, 8-10:30pm at The Springs in Downtown LA featuring Nick Mancini (608 Mateo St.  Los Angeles, CA 90021) and Sunday, April 19th, 11:30am-2:30pm upstairs at The Federal Bar in North Hollywood (5303 Lankershim Blvd.  North Hollywood, CA 91601)

story: I am ready to take the next step and make my first full album and music video!  I have new songs and stories to share about  being a mom and an artist. And I hope they will touch you and bring a smile to your face as music should. Thank you!

story:
I was a shy insecure boy growing up in rural Ohio. I was afraid most of my life. I was closeted, suicidal, depressed. My life, frankly, just sucked. I never wanted to go to college, but because my family said that was what I was suppose to do, I went to a local University and hated every minute I was there. I literally had nothing going for me. Until in 2009 I watched the Grammy's, and in particular I watch my favorite artist, P!nk, perform "Glitter in The Air". It changed my life. It was so majestic. In that moment I told myself that's what I am going to do. About a year later I found myself on The X Factor stage in front of 4,000 people including Simon Cowell, Demi Lovato, and Kelly Rowland. That was the big turning point in my career. The next year I found myself on a different TV series, American Idol, where I got to perform for J-Lo, Keith Urban, and Harry Connick Jr. It was just an incredible experience to be apart of and I am so blessed to have done both shows. Since then I have been On YouTube for the past year and have over 200,000 people that have clicked the subscribe button on my channel. Now it's time for me to create something that I can call my own. This EP has been 3 years of writing my ass off to get something I am happy and proud of. Recording and making music videos is very expensive, and that is where I need all of YOUR HELP! I have 5 songs I am recording and want to do a music video for my single, as it has it's own personality that would come across brilliantly in video form. I realistically need to raise around $30,000 to do what I want to do, but $20,00 is a good place to start! I hope you will help me create something that means so much to me. The journey begins now. 

The Breakdown:

-Recording per song: $1,000 (Studio/Mixing/Mastering)

-5 songs * $1000= $5,000

-Video costs for my single: $15,000 (Recording space, production, props etc) (price agreed upon by videographer)

-Lyric Video= $600 (Not budgeted for but if we raise more this will be paid off too)

-Bradlee
